loans.name: Believe In God Group

texts.en:
This is Mariatu K., Hassan T., Wullamatu K., Ramatu C., Ramatu K. and Adamsay K.. They have named their group Believe in God.

These group members have received several loans from Kiva through SMT, and have repaid previous loans successfully. Their last loan was for 1,000,000 SLL each. That loan made a tremendous impact in the lives and businesses of these borrowers. They were able to make a lot of profit from the loan, and were thus able to solve many of their problems. Having repaid the last loan successfully, they are again requesting a new loan of 1,200,000 SLL each to add to their businesses.

Mariatu K. (third from left) is the leader of this group. Mariatu was born in Sanda village, in northern Sierra Leone. She is approximately 35 years old, married to a businessman, and they have four children. Mariama’s children attend primary and secondary school. Mariama sells ready-to-wear-clothes for children. She has been in this business for about four years now.

loans.use: To expand her inventory of children's clothes

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en: Solomon is 47 years old and married with 4 children. His eldest child is 19 years old. He sells groceries and frozen foods at retail prices to his customers. He hopes to own a supermarket in the future. He hopes for a loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more groceries and frozen foods to sell. With these combined businesses, he hopes to meet the basic needs and necessities of his immediate family members. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Nuestro socio EDGAR tiene 32 años, es conviviente, es natural de la ciudad de Cusco y pertenece al banco comunal “EMPRENDEDORES DE SAN CRISTOBAL” de la Asociación Arariwa. El tiene dos hijos: Melani tiene 10 años y estudia en el colegio, Humberto tiene 3 años y esta en el jardín.        
 
El socio hace servicio de transportes en la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son tres años con el servicio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su labor. Nuestro socio es un padre trabajador y emprendedor que saca adelante a su familia. El socio requiere el préstamo para implementar el carro comprando accesorios nuevos.         
   
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Edgar (32) lives with his partner; he is from the city of Cusco and is a member of the "Emprendedores de San Cristóbal" Community Bank in the Arariwa Association. He has two children: Melani (10) goes to school and Humberto (3) is in kindergarten. He operates a taxi in the city of Cusco. He has been in business for three years and things are going well as a result of his hard work. He is an entrepreneur who provides for his family. He needs the loan to improve the taxi by purchasing new accessories. He is grateful for the opportunity which this loan will provide him, and he undertakes to fulfil the repayment schedule.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy accessories/parts for his taxi

loans.name: Leonel Guadalupe

texts.es:
El señor Leonel Guadalupe M. tiene ya más de seis años dedicándose al oficio de herrería.
  Al negocio le está haciendo falta materia prima y herramienta mas moderna, pero en esté momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión que desea realizar a su negocio. 
Don Leonel Guadalupe tiene bajo su responsabilidad un hijo que actualmente está estudian y desea lo mejor.
Con una parte de las ganancias del negocio planea pagar el crédito.
texts.en:
Leonel Guadalupe M. has been a blacksmith for over 6 years. His business is lacking raw materials and more modern equipment. However, he does not have funds now to invest in his business the way he'd like to. He has a son under his care who is a student and he wants the best for him. He plans to repay the loan with part of his business profits.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies and work tools.

loans.name: Ambrose

texts.en:
Ambrose K. is 32 years old and married to Marian. Ambrose runs a small scale lumber business in Kikambala in Coast Province. He purchases raw lumber, cuts it to size and then sells to the locals for construction. He has been doing this for four years now.

Ambrose joined KADET recently through his neighbor and is now accessing his first loan. He plans to purchase more raw lumber for processing. His main clients are area residents and his prices are quite fair. 

He hopes to develop his small scale business into a bigger and more profitable lumber store.

loans.use: To purchase raw lumber for processing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her stock of building materials

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer trabajadora y alegre de 43 años, luego de la separación de su pareja vive sola en una habitación alquilada. Tiene 2 hijos que está en la capital del país en busca de un futuro mejor.   

Ella es una persona muy reconocida por la zona donde vive, lo que le ha permitido tener muchos amigos, quienes siempre la apoyan en cualquier negocio que emprende desde hace 20 años. Es así que desde los primeros meses del año 2008 se inició en la venta de dulces y bebidas en un kiosko fuera de la casa de su hermana. Asimismo cuenta que le gusta vender las bebidas fermentadas, típicas de su región, pues son las más solicitadas durante las fiestas, obteniendo ingresos económicos que le permiten vivir cómodamente e incluso terminar de construir su casa propia. Es por eso que para más adelante anhela hacer crecer su negocio e instalarlo en su vivienda para ya no pagar por alquiler y generar más utilidades.

Este es el quinto préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy orgullosa de progresar cada día junto a los integrantes de su banco comunal, quienes también son sus amigos; personas responsables, solidarias y comprensivas. Con los dos mil soles que ahora solicita comprará mayor cantidad de dulces y bebidas para implementar su kiosco.
texts.en:
Ana is a happy and hard-working woman of 43 years. After her separation from her husband, she now lives alone in a rented room. She has 2 children that live in the capital of the country in search of a better future. She is a person who is very well known the zone where she lives. This has permitted her to have many friends, who have always supported her in any business that she undertakes for the past 20 years. In the first months of the year 2008 she began to sell candies and beverages in a stand at her sister's house. In addition she likes to sell the typical fermented beverages of her region, which are the most requested during the festivals. With this she obtains an income that permits her to live conveniently and even to finish building her own house. That it is why in the future she wants to grow her business and to install it in her dwelling, so she no longer has to pay rent and can generate more income. This is the fifth loan that she has had with MFP and she is very proud to progress each day along with the members of her communal bank, who are also her friends; comprehensive, supportive, and responsible people. With the two thousand soles that she now requests she will buy a greater quantity of candies and beverages to sell at her stand.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy merchandise such as snacks and beverages to sell at her food stand

loans.name: Jamans

texts.en:
Jamans O. is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

Jamans sells tires at retail prices to his customers. He loves this business because it is highly profitable. He is a hardworking man and he is so determined to lift his business and family above poverty. He hopes for a loan of NGN 170,000 to purchase more tires to sell. He hopes to expand his business.

Jamans is 42 years old and married with two children, his eldest child being 6 years old. His children attend school and this gives him joy. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tires to sell

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith is 49 years old and married with 2 children. Her husband is an athlete. Faith is an honest and friendly woman. She sells baby items, clothes and jewellery at retail prices to her customers. She has been in business for a long time. With these combined businesses, she hopes to support her husband in meeting the family's basic needs. Faith is requesting a loan in the amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more baby items, clothes and jewellery to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more baby items, clothes and jewellery to sell

loans.name: Lida

texts.en: Lida B. is from the village of Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 47 years old, is married, and has one school-aged child. Lida owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Lida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Lida is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her 6th from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Florentino

texts.es:
Descripción:           	    El sr Florentino es casado con la Sra. Isabel Gimenez de G., tienen cinco hijos, tres mayores y dos menores a su cargo, vive en casa propia en la compañía YTUMI de la ciudad CAACUPE  en donde posee su negocio.
 El negocio surgió hace mas de 20 años cuando se casaron, vieron una oportunidad en lugar donde están y con el tiempo fueron incrementando mas rubros.
La familia se dedica a la elaboración de chipas para vender, además posee un tambo de donde obtiene leche para la venta, y acopia (compra minorista para reventa) coco  para venderlos a las fabricas que producen jabones y aceites de coco.
 El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima para la producción de chipas, (almidón, queso, grasa vejetal ) y para el acopio de coco. El Sr. Florentino desea  crecer con su negocio  día a día para incrementar su ingreso familiar  y dar una vida digna   a toda su familia.
texts.en:
Description: Florentino is married to Isabel Gimenez de Gonzalez. They have five children. Three are adults and two are still under their care. He lives in his own house that belongs in the YTUMI company of the city of CAACUPE, where he has his business. The business started more than 20 years ago when they married. They saw an opportunity in the place where they live and with time they expanded to other areas. The family makes chipas [a traditional cheese bread] to sell. They also possess a stall where he obtains milk for resale, and he buys coconut to resell to companies that produce soap and coconut oil. The loan that he is asking for will be invested in the purchase of raw materials to make chipas (starch, cheese, vegetable shortening) and to purchase coconut. Florentino wants to grow his business day by day in order to increase his family income and give his whole family a dignified life.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase starch, cheese and coconut.

loans.name: Trương's Group

texts.en:
U. Trương Thị (20203050009) is a 23-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  U. is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Ô Cách nhóm 02 (2).


U. is married and has 3 school-aged children.  To make a living, U. owns and operates a business venture in the manufacturing sector, operating a furniture making business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling general household furniture to local businesses and community members.  U. has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5.000.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2009, U. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  U. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5.152.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional raw materials to expand her product offerings.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6.944.000 VND which will also be used to purchase additional raw materials to expand her product offerings.  The loan will be the second loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  U. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.


About the other borrowers in the Group:


1.  Trương Thị H. (20203050006) is a 25-year-old female who is requesting a 7.392.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector, raising livestock.


2.  Trương Thị XU. (20203050008) is a 21-year-old female who is requesting a 6.496.000 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector, operating a furniture making business.


3.  Trương Thị KhU. (20203050010) is a 35-year-old female who is requesting a 6.496.000 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector, operating a furniture making business.


4.  Nguyễn Thị H. (20203050007) is a 37-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector, raising livestock.


5.  Trương Thị H. (20203050098) is a 37-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector, raising livestock.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.




U. Trương Thị (20203050009) là 23 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  U. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Ô Cách nhóm 02 (2).


Trong khi không pH. chỉ có các pH. thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán trang thiết bị gia dụng thông thường cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa pH..  U. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, U. kiếm được khoảng 5.000.000 VND.  Vào 2009, U. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  U. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5.152.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua ngU. liệu thô bổ sung để mở rộng việc giới thiệu sản phẩm.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.944.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Trương Thị H. (20203050006) là 25 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Trương Thị XU. (20203050008) là 21 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.496.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


3.  Trương Thị KhU. (20203050010) là 35 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.496.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


4.  Nguyễn Thị H. (20203050007) là 37 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


5.  Trương Thị H. (20203050098) là 37 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings

loans.name: Kyagalanyi Masajja Development Group, Kampala

texts.en:
Self-assured and hardworking, 30-year-old N. Florence has, for the last eight years, sold bananas and charcoal in Masajja, Kampala, to earn a livelihood. Out of her narrow circumstances as a housewife evolved the idea to start up her own business.

This married mother of four has educated all her children with earnings from this business. Her business generates her profits in the range of 100 to 120 thousand shillings a week. She also ekes out additional profits operating a local commercial motorcycle business.

With this loan, Florence wants to buy more bananas and charcoal that she can later sell to her customers. She also wants to buy another commercial motorcycle or boda-boda as they are known here. Florence hopes to be the leading supplier of foodstuffs in the area.

loans.use: To purchase more yellow bananas and, later, another commercial motorcycle

loans.name: Enhmagnai

texts.en:
Enhmagnai D., 42 years old, lives with her husband and two sons in their own house in Uvurhangai province. Since her husband started his business in 2007 transporting raw materials, they have expanded the business type to coal, firewood transport, and trading. They are interested in enlarging the operation still more. 

Enhmagnai is very generous and tidy. She is requesting a 3,500,000 MNT loan to purchase a car in order to develop her business activity.

loans.use: To purchase a car to develop her business

loans.name: Delphine

texts.fr: H. Delphine est née le 02 Mai 1979 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Delphine vit depuis sa naissance au quartier Sègbèya à Cotonou. Delphine est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Mais Delphine ne vit plus avec son mari. Delphine vit seule avec ses enfants. Mais Delphine apporte une aide financière à son mari en assurant avec lui les diverses charges des enfants. Delphine a très peu fréquenté l'école. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Delphine prépare et vend du "Monyo" (akassa : fait à base d'amidon de maïs, accompagné de sauce aux poissons) à la devanture de sa maison. Delphine exerce cette activité depuis six ans environs et a déjà obtenu cinq crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu'elle a tous bien remboursés. Delphine s'approvisonne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. En vue d'augmenter son fonds de roulement et de mieux satisfaire la forte demande de sa clientèle, Delphine sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un autre crédit qui lui servira à augmenter le stock de ses produits.
texts.en:
H. Delphine was born on May 2, 1979 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  Since birth, she has been living in the Sègbèya district in Cotonou and is the mother of three children who are all in school.  Delphine no longer lives with her husband.  She lives alone with her children.  But she helps out her husband financially while she and her husband ensure that the different expenses for the children are covered.  Delphine did not attend school very much.  To support herself, she makes and sell "Monyo" (akassa:  made with corn starch) at the entrance to her house.  She has been in this business for about six years and has already had five loans from ALIDé that she repaid.  She stocks up at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin.  For purposes of increasing her working capital and satisfying further the strong demand from her customers, Delphine is requesting another loan from ALIDé that will be used to increase her stock of goods.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sacks of corn, some fish, and condiments

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Operating an agricultural farm has been a tremendous business venture for Alex B. from Rugazi, Ntungamo. Being a single, energetic and determined young man who is currently in the teaching profession, he has worked tooth and nail to start up the sale of bananas, which are commonly used to prepare a local dish by customers here in Uganda.

He is fond of his enterprise and is always able to earn about $37 monthly. This loan is to help him do the mulching and to buy stake poles and pesticides for his plantation. His major future move is the further expansion of the project to a large scale. This will help to improve Alex’s yields and production, creating an increase in sales revenue that will enable him enjoy a self-sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: purchase of mulches and banana plantation supplies

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: purchasing a carpet frame

loans.name: Channy

texts.en:
Mrs. Channy N. (in the photo) and her husband, Mr. Leanseng Hun, have been married since 2000 and have one son who is attending school. They are living on an island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Channy used to sell vegetables, but she quit because her business was not doing well. She is now a garment factory worker. Her husband has been a motor taxi driver for more than 2 years. Channy has already asked for one Kiva loan to replace her husband's motorbike with a new one. She is now asking for her second loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to get to work

loans.name: 30 De Agosto Santa Rosa Group

texts.es:
El comité de mujeres 30  de Agosto Santa Rosa, conformada por 12  mujeres de la zona rural  de la compañía de Pintos del distrito, Departamento  de Paraguarí; quienes se encuentran trabajando en forma organizada desde hace tiempos atrás, lleva adelante la presidencia la Sra. Nicasia G. Amarilla.

          Los miembros del comité trabajan en conjunto haciendo actividades de venta de comida, torneo de futbol, vóley  para solventar los gastos de pago de cuota, aparte de que los miembros el dinero prestado de la Fundación Paraguaya utilizan para compra de pollitos, cría de cerdos, ampliación de almacén, compra de accesorios para bijoiteria  y para utilizar en las actividades agropecuarias para la siembra de los cultivos para el sustento de la familia durante el año.
  Cada unas de las integrantes se dedican a diferentes actividades dentro de la comunidad.
La señora Nicasia es una mujer muy trabajadora, se dedica a la cría de animales y a la producción agropecuaria y al negocio de ventas de productos de uso domésticos.
Todas las actividades lo realiza con la ayuda de sus hijos y su marido y así tiene una familia luchadora que progresa constantemente.
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de pollitos, cerdos, inversión en la actividad agropecuaria y en su negocio.
texts.en:
The committee of women 30 de Agosto Santa Rosa (August 30, Santa Rosa) is composed of 12 women from a rural area and the Pintos company of the district, Paraguarí department. They have worked together in an organized way for a long time. Their current president is la Señora Nicasia G. Amarilla. The members of the committee sell food at soccer and volleyball tournaments to make their loan payments. In addition, they use money loaned by the Fundación Paraguaya to purchase baby chicks, raise pigs, expand warehouses, purchase accessories for jewelry, perform agricultural work, and sow crops to sustain the family during the year. Each of the members works at different activities within the community. La Señora Nicasia is a hard-working woman. She raises animals and cultivates crops and also sells products for domestic use. Her children and husband help her in all these activities; they are a family that is constantly working hard and progressing. She requests this loan to buy baby chicks, pigs, and to invest in agricultural work and in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of baby chicks and pigs, raising livestock, cultivating crops, warehouse expansion.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah C. is from the village of Regency, Iponan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 34 years old. Sarah is married and has 1 very young child. To make a living, Sarah owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling personal products such as lotions and perfumes in the local community. Sarah has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 7500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Sarah joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sarah has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Sarah is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Sarah from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

location.town: Iponan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Antonio Ignacio

texts.es:
Antonio Ignacio Hernández Hernández
Antonio es de 39 años de edad, casado, tiene y tres  hijos varones y ocho hijas  mujeres, es jornalero y actualmente  es artesano en la elaboración de ollas y sartenes de barro, en la actividad lleva 29 años de experiencia, solicita su primer crédito para ampliación de capital y  compra de barro plomo y azufre y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos económicos del mismo como el bienestar de su familia en general, según  referencias indican que es una persona responsable y trabajadora y según la actividad a la que se dedica podrá realizar sus pagos mensuales sin inconvenientes.
texts.en:
Antonio Ignacio Hernández Hernández
Antonio is 39 years old, is married and has three sons and eight daughters. Antonio is a day laborer and currently works as an artisan making clay pots and pans, which he has done for 29 years. Antonio is asking for his first loan to increase his capital and to buy clay, lead and sulphur. This will help him improve his income and his family’s general wellbeing. His references indicate that he is a responsible and hardworking man and his work will allow him to make his monthly payments without any problems.

loans.use: To buy raw materials, lead, sulphur and clay.

loans.name: Joice

texts.en: Joice J. is currently in the business of selling groundnut paste in the custom market in Juba, and is requesting a loan to stock more groundnut to make paste to sell. Joice is 32 years old and is married. Her husband is a policeman. She has one child, who does not go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy land.

loans.use: To stock more groundnuts for making paste to sell

loans.name: Dipa

texts.en:
This is 18 year-old Dipa K..  She is unmarried and in 2008, she established  her grocery store business.  Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 4 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to purchase grocery goods for her shop.  In the future, Dipa plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.  

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margains.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates:
 BPW Partner Page     Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team"

loans.use: to buy grocery goods for her shop

loans.name: Shirley

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PUNTUALITO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Shirley, ella tiene 36 años de edad; soltera   y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de hamburguesas, ella vende en forma ambulatoria en la ciudad de cusco siendo su horario desde las 6:00pm hasta las 10:00pm. la socia desea ampliar su negocio  .

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar más insumos para su pequeño negocio de hamburguesas.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido
texts.en: Shirley is a member of the “Puntualito” communal bank, located in the Cusco district in the province and department of Cusco.  She is 36 years old, single and has one son.   Her business is selling hamburgers from a mobile location in Cusco, from 6:00 AM to 10:00 PM daily.  She would like to expand her business and is asking for this loan so that she can buy more supplies for her small business.  She appreciates the people who are helping her achieve her dreams in this manner and is committed to repaying her loan within the established timetable.

loans.use: Supplies for her business

loans.name: Amina Hassan

texts.en:
Amina Hassan B. is a 50-year-old hardworking woman. She is married to James Sheikh, and together they have three children, ages 6 years, 3 years, and 2 years. Amina has been operating a boutique shop for about seven years, and she earns a monthly income of 15,000 KES.
When she learned of KADET from a staff member, she joined, and she has now applied for her first loan of 30,000 KES, which she intends to use to buy a stock of bags, bangles, new clothes, caps, and jackets. She plans to use the profits to expand her business.
Amina hopes to grow her business and to become the leading local investor. She also hopes to see her children realize their dreams in life through education.

loans.use: To buy a stock of bags, bangles, new clothes, caps, and jackets

loans.name: Nanci Marcelina

texts.es:
La Señora. Nanci Gonzáles es socia del banco comunal Génesis, vive por el sector de la ciudadela Calderón en la ciudad de Cuenca,  esta ciudad es reconocida por la belleza que encierra a sus alrededores, su centro histórico fue nombrado como patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, su gente es muy amable y de un corazón cálido.

Nuestra socia tiene 73 años, es viuda hace 26 años y tiene 6 hijos mayores de edad, 5 son casados, uno de sus hijos casados vive en su casa y comparte los gastos, su hija soltera trabaja y le ayuda en la economía de su hogar, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Doña Nanci se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y ropa por catálogo, actividad que desempeña hace 10 años, no tiene un horario fijo de trabajo y vende a sus amigas y conocidas.

En la banca comunal se encuentra en su cuarto ciclo y los créditos le han beneficiado en la compra de mercadería, ahora con su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más ropa y cosméticos para la temporada navideña. Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nanci Gonzáles is a member of the Génesis (Genesis) communal bank.  She lives in Cuenca’s Calderón sector.  This city is renowned for the beauty of its surroundings.  Its history city center was named Cultural Patrimony of Humanity.  Its people are very kind and warmhearted.

She is 73 years old and was widowed 26 years ago.  She has six adult children.  Five of them are married.  One of her married sons lives in her house and shares expenses.  Her single daughter works and helps with household expenses.  She does not own her house; she rents.

Nanci sells cosmetics and clothes via catalogue sales.  She has been in this business for 10 years.   She does not have a fixed work schedule and sells to friends and acquaintances.

She’s in her fourth cycle with the communal bank and the loans have helped her buy merchandise.  Now the new loan will be used to buy more clothes and cosmetics for the Christmas season.  Her dream is to have a house of her own.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and clothes.

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es: Solicitante, tiene 43 años, es saoltera vive en casa familiar, se dedica al negocio hace mas de 2 años,  señora tiene la meta de tener negocio propio, y cumplir con sus sueños y objetivos, solicita credito para capital de trabajo, para invertir en el negocio,
texts.en: The person requesting the loan is 43 years old. She is single and lives in her family's home. She has been working in this line of business for more than two years. Her ambition is to have her own business and to reach her goals and dreams, so she is requesting this loan for working capital so she can invest in her business.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Djiguisseme, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne  38 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’habillements, de céréales et de condiments alimentaires.                                                                        
Les femmes du groupe Djiguisseme sont à leur onzième prêt solidaire avec Soro Yiriwaso.                                                                          
BATOMA H. s’approvisionne en condiments au marché de Massigui hebdomadairement. Elle effectue ses ventes à domicile et au marché de Massigui, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 50 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer le prêt, prendre en charge les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the Djiguisseme group are all married women, averaging 38 years of age, with  five children. They live in traditional extended families in the village of Massigui, Dioila Prefecture, Koulikoro Region (the 2nd administrative region of Mali). They know each other as relatives and neighbors. They sell clothing, cereals and food condiments.

The members of the Danaya group are on their 11th solidarity loan with Soro Yiriwaso.

Batoma Haidara stocks up on condiments at the weekly Massigui market. She sells out of her home and at the Massigui market, for cash and on credit, to a customer base composed of women and men. She plans to achieve an average monthly income of 50,000 West African Francs, which will be used to repay the loan, cover expenses related to healthcare, food, and school fees, with the rest reinvested in her business.

loans.use: Purchasing food condiments

loans.name: Gema Carolina

texts.es: Gema Carolina tiene 27 años, es una persona muy responsable y disfruta mucho de su actividad económica. Ella tiene 1 hijo de 18 años a su cargo, por lo que siempre está al pendiente de lo que sus clientes solicitan ella es una persona muy dinámica y disfruta de interactuar con ellos. Gema siempre lucha por mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Ella solicita este crédito para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, pantalones y ropa en general. Sueña con mejorar su establecimiento.
texts.en: Gema Carolina is 27 years old and a very responsible person who enjoys her business activity.  She has 1 son in her care, and is always alert to customer demand.  She is a very dynamic person who enjoys interacting with them.  Gema always fights to improve her standard of living.  She requests this loan for the purchase of pants, shirts, skirts and other general clothing items.  She dreams with improving her establishment.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add to her stock of fruits to sell

loans.name: Genaro

texts.es: Genaro se dedica a la venta de pesca artesanal. Tiene más de 31 años en su negocio. Inicio por la necesidad de mejorar los ingresos de la familia. el ha sido siempre una persona muy luchador, pues con sus propios ingresos ha logrado salir adelante. Esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos pues se siente muy satisfecho con su negocio. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de   gasolina para el motor, redes entre otra cosa.
texts.en: Genaro earns his living by selling fish, a job he’s been doing for more than 31 years. He started his business because he needed to earn more money to support his family. He’s always been a hard worker so he’s managed to make progress in life. This is not the first time that Genaro has taken on a loan because he feels satisfied that his business is going well. With the money he wishes to buy gasoline for his engine, nets, etc.

loans.use: to invest in his fishing business

loans.name: Mrs. Thoeun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thoeun, born in 1982,  has been selected as village bank president by nineteen members who make up a village bank loan,  Each borrower will use their portion of the loan for different purposes in order to improve their family's standard of living. 

Mrs. Thoeun is a Khmer cake seller and a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she grows rice, selling pA. of the yield and using the rest to support her family. In the rice field, she has some problems because her field has infertile soil. To improve the rice production, Mrs.Thoeun is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer, gasoline, and pesticide. Her husband, Mr. C. Ney, is a farming laborer and fisherman.  He also works leaves of palm trees to make roofs to sell to support his family. This couple supports two children who are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, gasoline, and pesticide

loans.name: Gibson

texts.en:
Gibson is 25 and married with four children between one month and five years old. Two of his children attend school. For the past three years, Gibson has been a farmer in Litein town in the Rift Valley in Kenya. He employs one farmhand and sells milk to Kabianga Dairies and tea to Finlay Factory in Litein. 

Gibson is requesting a loan of 40,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He will use the proceeds from this loan to build a decent house for his family and pay school fees for his children. Gibson’s major business challenge has been the lack of animal feed. In the future, he plans to build a modern dairy and buy productive dairy cows.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Marianne

texts.en:
Marianne P. is from the village of Hinaplanan, Claveria, Misamis Oriental. She is 31 years old. Marianne is married and has five young children. 

To make a living, Marianne buys and sells bananas, like lakatan, kantong and kardava, and sweet potatoes in the local community. Marianne has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Marianne joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Marianne has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. 

Marianne is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional bananas and sweet potatoes. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Marianne from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional bananas and sweet potatoes

loans.name: Julia

texts.en: Julia is currently in a business of selling fish. She is 35 years old and married with 5 children, three of whom go to school. Julia borrowed a loan to stock more fish to sell. She hopes to expand in future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies and to repair machinery.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi sells kenkey (kenkey is made from steamed, fermented corn dough) at Kwaprow, near Abura, in Cape Coast. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a security personnel. 

Esi needs money to be able to produce the kenkey in large quantities. A loan from Kiva will help her to achieve her goal. She will use the loan to buy more sacks of corn. Her future plan is to be able to give a proper education to her children. The pan in front of her is half-cooked corn dough to be rubbed and boiled for sale.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of corn.

loans.name: Anjilyn

texts.en:
Anjilyn is 29 years old and married with 2 children. With 1 child in school, Anjilyn works very hard to provide for them.

Anjilyn runs a rice-retailing business in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 11,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional rice to sell. She has been in this business for 2 years. 

In the future, Anjilyn would like to repair and renovate her family's home.

loans.use: To purchase additional rice to sell

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 45-year-old father of four daughters and three sons. He has worked in various jobs and as he is getting old, he wanted to have more stable work. He thought of investing in a soft drink shop 2 years ago. Now that the shop is prospering, Ali decided to take out a loan from FATEN to purchase a fridge to keep fruit in instead of buying very small amounts to keep it fresh.

Ali is photographed in FATEN's branch.

loans.use: to purchase a fridge for his soft drink shop.

loans.name: Clara Berta

texts.es: Clara tiene 33 años, su actividad es la venta de tortillas. Hace más de 20 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que fue por iniciativa propia que ella comenzó este medio de vida, por lo que ha sido muy difícil mantenerlo ya que ha tenido problemas de salud, pues tiene 3 hijos es una mujer muy luchadora y responsable y siempre ha demostrado ser una buena Madre con sus hijos. Este financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como maíz, leña, cal, bolsas y coma. Ella sueña con que su negocio siga creciendo.
texts.en:
Clara is 33 years old and her business is selling tortillas.  She has been in this business for more than 20 years.  She started out in this line of work through her own initiative.  It has been difficult for her to keep her business going because she has suffered from health problems.

Clara has three children.  She is a very hard-working and responsible woman who has always been a good mother to her children.  She is requesting this loan to buy raw materials such as corn, firewood, lime, bags and a 'comal' (a special dish for cooking tortillas).  She dreams that her business will continue to grow.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, lime, bags and a 'comal' (a special dish for cooking tortillas)

loans.name: Man

texts.en:
Man sells recycling materials. His wife, Satas, now stays at home and does housework. They live along National Road Number Six, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. 

Man is asking for a loan of $200 to build a concrete brick room under his house.

Photo: Man is not sitting at his home. He is at his brother’s home.

loans.use: To build a concrete brick room under his house.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 54 years old and a widow from Nyalenda town in Kisumu County. She has four children who are in high school.

Mary has a grocery store that she has been running for the past 17 years. She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy more onions, tomatoes, garlic and vegetables to add to her stock. 

Mary is optimistic that the loan will help boost her business. She hopes to open up a big grocery shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy onions, tomatoes, garlic and vegetables

loans.name: Alexander

texts.ru:
Александр женат, у него есть сын-подросток Максим. Александр торгует мужской сезонной одеждой: тенниски, футболки, майки и т.д. на одном из местных рынков города Мелитополь. У Александра всегда большой выбор товара и приемлемые цены, доступные среднестатистическому покупателю. Александр начал этот бизнес еще 9 лет назад. Тогда направление в бизнесе помогли выбрать родные. На данный момент у него товара на 30 000 гривен, а прибыль составляет около 6 000 гривен в месяц. 

Александр планирует использовать кредит от КИВА на сумму 15 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить мужскую одежду к осеннему сезону и пополнить свой ассортимент. Александр давно мечтает сделать полноценный и качественный ремонт в своем доме. Поэтому, получив дополнительную прибыль от продаж, он хотел бы сделать ремонт в собственном доме. 

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en:
Aleksandr is married and has a teenage son named Maxim. Aleksandr sells men's clothes: polo shirts, t-shirts, dress shirts etc. at the local market in the city of Melitopol. He prides himself on the large selection and low prices he is able to offer at his store, which makes his clothes affordable for the middle class consumer. Aleksandr has been working in this business for the last 9 years. He started to sell clothes after encouragement from his relatives. He has currently 30 000 griven worth of inventory and the income form his business is 6000 griven per month. 

Aleksandr is planning to use the 15 000 griven credit from KIVA to purchase men's clothing for the fall season and expand his inventory. Aleksandr has always been dreaming to do quality large scale repairs in his apartment and he is planning to use the additional income from the clothing sales to finance his dream.

loans.use: to purchase men's clothing for the coming fall season and to expand his inventory

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for her sewing business

loans.name: Welchela

texts.en:
Welchela is 33 years old and lives in Brgy. Cantabon, Siquijor, Siquijor. She is a single parent with three children.

To earn a living, Welchela has a business selling of dried fish. She earns about PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. Welchela requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase more dried fish.

Welchela has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for four months. In the future, she would like to acquire more dried fish to be sold in her municipality.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Victoire Ayaba's Group

texts.fr:
Mariée et mère de 4 enfants, Victoire vit dans la maison de son mari dans un quartier populeux de la capitale économique du Bénin. Elle est la responsable d'un groupe de 2 membres. 
Revendeuse, elle commercialise des sacs et chaussures qu'elle expose à la devanture de son domicile. Elle mène cette activité depuis 2007 et en maîtrise les contours. Victoire effectue ses approvisionnements tous les deux mois tantôt à Cotonou, tantôt à Lomé. 
Dans le but de réduire à la fois la fréquence et le coût d'approvisionnement afin de maximiser son profit d'une part mais aussi et surtout de satisfaire les attentes croissantes de ses clients, elle a sollicité un premier crédit à FINADEV. Elle compte en tirer un revenu supplémentaire afin d'accroitre le niveau de sa participation aux charges du foyer. 
Victoire est la caution solidaire de Pauline, une de ses amies de quartier qui commercialise des divers et céréales à son domicile aussi.
texts.en:
Married and the mother of four children, Victoire lives in her husband's house in a populous neighborhood of the economic capital of Bénin. She is the leader of a group of two members. As a small-scale retailer she sells handbags and shoes that she displays in front of her home. She has been in this business since 2007 and is well versed in it. She buys her wares every two months either in Cotonou or in  Lomé. 

Wishing to resupply her business less frequently and at a lesser expense so as to maximize her profit on the one hand but also mainly to satisfy the growing expectations of her customers, she is requesting a first loan from  FINADEV. She hopes in this way to get supplementary income in order to participate in a bigger way in covering household expenses. 

Victoire is the guarantor for Pauline, one of her neighborhood friends, who sells various items and cereals, also at her home.

loans.use: to buy 50 pairs of shoes and 10 school bags

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.en:
Fortunata, who is from San Juan, Alicia, Isabela, is 53 years old, married, and has three grown children. To make a living, Fortunata has been raising livestock.for over 40 years, primarily pigs for fattening and sale. She earns approximately P5,000 (Philippine peso) a month.

Fortunata joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell.

loans.name: Alberta

texts.en:
Alberta is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with 6 children.  Alberta has a food shop that sells hot cakes, cheesecakes, & rice cakes. She has had this business for 5 years.  She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy raw ingredients for making snacks to sell. 
Alberta has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Alberta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks to sell

loans.name: Celerina

texts.en:
Celerina is a married woman from Tagbilaran City, Bohol. She raises pigs for a living. Celerina has been in this kind of business for 8 years. She works hard to support her family. Aside from raising hogs, she also makes rice cakes and other delicacies that she sells to the people in her community. 

Celerina requested this loan to purchase pig feed and raw ingredients such as rice, flour and sugar.  In the future, she hopes to have a stable business.

loans.use: buy pig feed and ingredients to make snacks

loans.name: Artesanias Del Sur Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Artesanías del Sur” lo conforman 18 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran artesanía en tejidos, en madera, venta de perfumes entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Puerto Montt.
Gladys integrante del grupo del banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra en primera fila, en el primer lugar de izquierda a derecha, arrodillada, viste una chaqueta color negro y jeans, además en sus manos sostiene un documento y un celular. Ella se dedica al rubro de la artesanía específicamente realiza tejidos, entre bufandas, gorros y vestidos, entre otros. También vende artesanía en madera y cuero. Arrienda un local en Angelmó (sector de ferias artesanales, destinadas al turismo). Se dedica a éste rubro desde hace 25 años, oficio heredado por su madre. La materia prima la compra en diferentes islas del sur de Chile.
Con el crédito comprará lanas para tejer, aprovechará la temporada de más alta demanda, debido al turismo, comprendido desde noviembre a febrero. 
Comenta que a lo largo de su vida ha podido concretar muchas metas en su negocio.
Gladys vive junto a su marido e hija de 29 años de edad, quien trabaja en el mismo rubro, comenta que toda su familia es comerciante. 
Sus sueños a nivel personal son ampliar su casa.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de los servicios otorgados por Fondo Esperanza, respecto al grupo comenta que las reuniones le han servido para conocerse con los demás emprendedores, por lo que ya se están afiatando.
Puerto Montt es una ciudad del sur de Chile, ubicada en la región de Los Lagos. Una de las atracciones de Puerto Montt son sus bellos paisajes verdes; sus playas poco frecuentadas; su gastronomía y especialmente la reputación de sus pescados y mariscos y sus artesanías. Es también la puerta de entrada a la Isla Grande de Chiloé, rica en tradiciones y leyendas.
texts.en:
This Communal Bank is called “Artesanías del Sur” (Crafts of the South) and consists of 18 entrepreneurs who engage in different businesses such as making knitted crafts, woodworking, selling perfumes, and other activities. All of them are from the city of Puerto Montt.

Gladys is a member of this Communal Bank group. In the photograph, she is on the first row. Gladys is kneeling, wearing a black jacket and jeans, and holding a document and a mobile phone in her hands. She is in the craft business, specifically making knitted items such as scarves, hats, clothes, and other items. Gladys also sells crafts made of wood and leather. She rents a shop in Angelmó (an area known for its artisan fairs and being frequented by tourists). Gladys has been working in this field for 25 years and inherited this business from her mother. Her materials are purchased from different islands in southern Chile. She will use this loan to purchase wool for knitting so that she can take advantage of the season when there is much higher demand as a result of tourism. This period is from November to February.

Gladys says that throughout most of her life she has been able to achieve many goals in her business. She lives with her husband and her 29-year-old daughter who is in the same line of work. Gladys says that all of the members of her family are merchants. Her dreams on a personal level include expanding her house. She is very pleased and grateful for the services provided by Fondo Esperanza. With respect to her group, she says that the meetings have helped her get to know the other entrepreneurs and they have already bonded.

Puerto Montt is a city in southern Chile that is located in the region of Los Lagos. The attractions of Puerto Montt include its beautiful green vistas, but there is little activity on its beaches. The cuisine is well-known for its fish and seafood. The local handicrafts also have a reputation. Puerto Montt also serves as the gateway to Isla Grande de Chiloé, which is rich in traditions and legends.

loans.use: to buy wool for knitting.

loans.name: Esther Wanjiku

texts.en:
Esther used her previous loan to buy dairy cows for rearing and milk production on her farm and, as a result, her income has increased. She repaid the loan well and in good time.

This will be Esther's eighth loan, which she plans to use to buy small heifers for rearing and later reselling. In the future, Esther hopes to venture more into dairy farming, milk production and dairy products, thereby increasing her income and improving her family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy heifers for rearing and selling.

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima - El Tambo Group

texts.es:
La señora REDMIRA D. 55 años D. edad, es socia D. la Alcancía comunal “Virgen D. Fátima – El Tambo”, Ella es una madre casada que tiene dos hijos el hijo mayor tiene un  trabajo independiente, el hijo menor cursa en el colegio del estado. 
La socia se levanta a tempranas horas D. la mañana para que pueda atender en su bodega  venta D. productos comestibles como azúcar, arroz, patatas, bebidas, verduras, condimentos, carnes y otros. Solicito el préstamo para la compra D. productos comestibles así poder variar y surtir su bodega con mas productos. Está ubicada la quinta persona lado izquierda vestida con  polo color rojo.
texts.en: Redmira, 55, is a member of the “Virgen D. Fátima-El Tambo” communal bank.  She is married and has two children.  The oldest works independently and the youngest is going to public school.  She rises very early in the morning to open her grocery store selling foodstuffs like sugar, rice, potatoes, soft-drinks, vegetables, condiments, meats and others.  She asked for the loan to buy foodstuffs to vary her store’s stock with more items.  She is the fifth person from the left dressed in a red polo shirt.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
La Sra.  Martha  tiene su negocio de venta  de productos de cristalería, plásticos, melanina y ropa en el mercado, ella es una de las personas fundadoras de ese pupuloso mercado por lo que esta fue una de las primeras comerciantes que llegaron a ese mercado.
Ella es madre soltera de dos hijas las cuales dependen de ella actualmente, ninguna se encuentran en el colegio.
Ella trabaja con una de sus hijas quien le ayuda en la atención de la demanda, ha trabajado veinte y dos créditos con ceprodel y todos estos han sido para compra de mercadería de su negocio.
texts.en:
Martha sells glassware, plastics, melmac and clothes in the market.  She is one of the founding merchants in this very crowded market because she was one of the first merchants to set up shop here.

She is the single mother of two daughters who depend on her; neither one of them attends school.

One of her daughters helps her tend to customers.  She’s had 22 Ceprodel loans all of which have been used to buy merchandise for her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her business.

loans.name: Berdikul

texts.ru: Бердикул имеет большую семью, их семеро, он, его жена и пятеро детей. С детство он помогал отцу, его отец занимался выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. Сейчас он также занимается выращиванием лука. Бердикул старается расширить свой бизнес, чтобы мог обеспечить своих детей и дать образование всем им. Бердикул запрашивает займ для покупки семена лука. Он надеется на вашу помощь и заранее благодарен вам за вашу доброту.
texts.en: Berdikul has a large family of seven, that includes himself, his wife and five children.  Since childhood, he has been helping his father, who was involved in growing agricultural crops.  Currently, Berdikul is also involved in growing onions.  He tries to expand his business in order to provide for his children and give all of them a good education.  Berdikul is requesting this loan for the purchase of onion seeds.  He relies on your help and thanks you in advance for your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase onion seeds

loans.name: Arnovi De Jesus

texts.es: El señor Arnovi trabaja como mayordomo en una finca de una vereda del municipio del Retiro ubicado al norte de Antioquia, en su lugar de trabajo y gracias a su excelente desempeño, le brindaron la oportunidad de tener su propio ganado y es por esto que requiere de la compra de dos terneras con las cuales pueda aprovechar e iniciar su negocio, con lo cual pueda mejorar la calidad de vida de su esposa e hija de tres años y por quienes vela y responde económicamente. El sueño del señor Arnovi es tener bien consolidado su negocio y brindarle una buena educación a su hija.
texts.en:
Sr. Arnovi works as a foreman on a farm in a district in the township of Retiro, located north of Antioquia. Thanks to his excellent performance, he was offered the opportunity to have his own cattle at his place of work. Consequently, he needs to buy two calves so he can take advantage of the situation and start his own business. This would enable him to improve the quality of life of his wife and 3 year old daughter, who are dependent upon him.

Arnovi’s dream is to see his business well established so that he can provide his daughter with a good education.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es: La señora Beatriz es costurera  y su esposo trabaja en el área de  construcción. El crédito que requiere es para  trámites legales de protocolización y transferencia  de un bien inmueble a su nombre. Beatriz es casada y tiene dos hijos. Vive en casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona  de Pasankeri  de la Ciudad de La Paz. Beatriz se encuentra muy contenta con el crédito  ya que le ayudara a registrar su propiedad. Es la primera vez que trabaja con kiva y la segunda vez que solicita un crédito de IMPRO.
texts.en:
Beatriz is a seamstress, and her husband works in construction.

The loan that she needs is for legal notarization and transfer of a property to her name.

Beatriz is married and has two children.  She lives in her parents’ house in the Pasankeri zone of the city of La Paz.

She is very happy with the loan because it will help her register her property.  This the first time she has worked with Kiva and the second time she has requested a loan with IMPRO.

loans.use: to pay the costs of legal notarization and transfer of property that she bought to her name.

loans.name: Roel

texts.en:
Roel is married and has two children. Roel is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Roel is a farmer who grows pigs to earn a living. He has been doing this for two years. 

He has requested a loan of 40,000 to purchase housing materials such as plywood, nails, etc. 
 
Roel has been a member of PMPC for one year.

loans.use: to purchase housing materials such as plywood, nails, etc.

loans.name: Basma

texts.en:
Basma is a 49-year-old married woman from Hay Nazal, Jordan, who lives with her four family members. Basma prefers not to display her photo on the internet and this photo is of her son.

Basma is requesting a 1,000 JOD loan to buy a modern digital camera. In the future, she plans on opening a photo shop and her dream is to buy her family their own home.

loans.use: to pay for beauty salon supplies

loans.name: Badamhand

texts.en: Mrs Badamhand is 51 years old, lives with her husband and a daughter in a small house in Ulaanbaatar, Mongola. Her husband, battogtokh, is 51 years old. He is unworkable. Her daughter, she is 12 years old. She is a second school student. Mrs Badamhand her children clothes retailing business on rental counters in 2002. Nowadays,  She owns two rental counters. Her current assets is 4 300 000 MNT. Thus, She is planning to increase products she sells, she buys her products to offer  for customers.  She is quiet-natured and responsible person. She is asking 4 000 000MNT to purchase more goods from Erlian to offer her business.

loans.use: To purchase more goods from Erlian

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.ru: Дилбар живет на районе Н.Хусрав. Она замужем и имеет 29 летного сына. Сын женат и имеет детей. Невестка домохозяйка, ведет домашнее хозяйство и ухаживает о детьми. Сын занимается мастером по ремонт домов. Ее муж работает учителем в средней школе. Он умный и добрый человек. Дилбар занимается животноводством на районе. В Таджикистане вполне позволяет развивать такие деятельности. В бизнесе купле и продаже крупнорогатых скотов она занимается  около 10 лет. Дилбар много сил выкладывает в свою работу и для нее ее деятельность очень важна. Она старается все время работать и улучшить жилищные условия  жизни семью.  Она просит кредит для купли крупнорогатого скота, чтобы увеличить поголовье скотов. Она верит в Вас, и надеется на Вашу помощь.
texts.en: Dilbar lives in the Nosiri Khusrav region. She is married and has a 29-year-old son. Her son is married and has children. Her daughter-in-law is a housewife: she runs the household and takes care of the children. Her son is a construction contractor. Her husband works as a teacher in a secondary school. He is a clever and kind person. Dilbar rears animals. Tajikistan has the right conditions for developing such businesses. She has been in the business of buying and selling cattle for about 10 years. Dilbar invests great efforts in her work, and this activity is very important for her. She tries to work all the time and improve living conditions for her family. She is asking for a loan to buy some cattle in order to increase the size of her herd. She believes that she will be helped. Dilbar looks forward to your support!

loans.use: to buy cattle in order to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard O. is a member of ‘Life in Africa’ and works with the invisible children bracelet project as a repairer.

Richard (28) came from the District of Pader and now lives at the Acholi Quarters with his wife and son of 2 years. He was forced to leave his home in the north due to the insurgency there. His camp where he had initially taken refuge was attacked by the rebels and that prompted his movement into the capital city where he has now lived for the past two years.

Richard’s story is one that has a real success behind it. He just started of at the stone quarry where everyone was actually getting their daily bread and later got a chance of joining life in Africa, this brought great change to his life. He has managed to start saving for his vision project which he feels is a video showroom, which is still lacking in the area. When he adds some more money onto what he has saved, he will be able to achieve now. He therefore seeks a loan of 800,000/= for this project . He will be able to pay this back in 12 months at the rate of 80,000/= a month, and below is the budget for this money. (This business is mainly done in evening so he can handle). Though he also have a brother who is willing to help him incase there is need to open early.

Screen 4” 350,000/=

Deck (video) 150,000/=

Amplifier 100,000/=

Generator 200,000/=

Total: 800,000/=

Other items like a pair of shelter speakers, tapes, fan and will be catered for through his savings.

loans.use: Buying Equipment for a video Show

loans.name: Serafina

texts.en: Sera and her husband share a talent for screen printing. They are raising 4 school-aged children, and are both employed. Her goal is for her children to get a good education that will benefit them in the long run. Sera was prompted to join the SPBD programme by the family's lack of money and other means of support. She decided to put her talent to good use with the help of her husband. Sera used her first loan to purchase plain materials, mostly lava (sarongs), screen-printed them, and sold them to individual shops. Because of the unique styles and beautiful colours, Sera’s business is booming - new orders are constantly being placed by her customers. She is now able to put her children through school and support her family financially. Sera is also looking to possibly expand her business by hiring 2 workers. And if she manages to save some extra money, Sera plans to expand her shop and even export her products to overseas markets. Currently, money is still a constraint, and she still has a long way to go. However, with the help of SPBD, Sera has already achieved her goal of being able to put her children through school.

loans.use: Purchase of paint, cotton materials, a screen, a brush, puletasi, and t-shirt materials

loans.name: Salaevalu

texts.en: Salaevalu is thirty-five years old and has five children.  Keeping up with the school fees for all of her children is a struggle that she doesn’t always win.  She used two previous loans from SPBD to launch her flea market stall where she sells traditional Samoan handicrafts to locals and tourists.  While her business is going well, she still needs to increase her sales to be able to give all her children the education she feels that they deserve.  Thus, having repaid the first two loans, she is seeking a third to expand her product line and increase her inventories.

loans.use: to purchase traditional Samoan crafts from local artisans to re-sell at her flea market stall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Rose would like to buy two bales of second hand clothes and dairy cow.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Mrs. Ana Román is 41 years old, has been married since the age of 25 to Mr. Saturnino Domínguez who is 47 years old and who works as a bricklayer in the construction industry. They have three sons of 22, 19 and 17 years old, the oldest of whom works in their parents store and the younger two are students.

Doña Ana is an entrepreneur, and is the owner of a business selling drinks, which she began six years ago with small savings thanks to sacrifices and dedications from both sides that were necessary to open the store. Thanks to this hard work and concessions it is one of the most frequented shops in the area.

Today they are interested in making a venture into the traveling sales of motorcycle parts in addition to selling drinks. Because the construction work her husband is involved in does not bring him much work, this expansion will enable them to have greater profits and provide a better education for her sons. This is the motive behind her request for a loan of $1000 to purchase motorcycle parts to sell such as crowns, chains, fixed wheels and keys.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Ana Román de 41 años de edad, está casada hace 25 años con el Sr. Saturnino Domínguez de 47 años de edad, de profesión albañil (obrero en obras de construcción). El matrimonio tiene 3 hijos de 22, 19 y 17 años respectivamente, de los cuales el mayor trabaja en el negocio a sus padres y las 2 menores se encuentran estudiando. Doña Ana es una mujer emprendedora, actualmente es propietaria de una casa de bebidas, que se había iniciado hace 6 años con un pequeño ahorro que gracias al sacrificio y dedicación de ambos fueron juntando para poder emprender su negocio, gracias a esto es uno de los más concurridos de la zona Hoy día están interesados en incursionarse, además de su venta de bebidas en venta ambulante de repuestos para motocicleta; ya que las obras de construcción escasean y su marido no tiene mucho trabajo; de este modo generar más ingresos económicos para la familia y bridarles una mejor educación a sus hijos. Por este motivo están solicitando el préstamo de $1000 para comprar repuestos para la venta tales como corona, cadena, piñón y pistón para motocicletas.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle parts such as crowns, chains, fixed wheels and keys

loans.name: Angela Jesús

texts.es:
Angela is very driven! She tries to make more money for the family by working hard each day. About 6 years ago, she decided to start raising 'cuyes'-guinea pigs. This way she pays for the education of her two kids who have high hopes for the future. They are currently attending a very prestigious school in town. She raises guinea pigs out of her home, and she later sells them according to her clients' demands. She prepares them ready to eat for the eating pleasure of the people in her town. Thanks to her successful business, she has been able to pay the bills together with her husband who is also in agriculture.

Since they both aspire for a great future, both have decided to expand their businesses with the sole purpose of improving their family living conditions and to help pay for their kids' education so that they can one day become good citizens in society.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Angela es una mujer esforzada que cada día da lo mejor de sí para incrementar la economía de su hogar, es así que hace 6 años toma la decisión de criar cuyes y de esa manera apoyar la educación de sus dos hijos que en la actualidad estudian en un prestigioso colegio de su localidad y tienen muchas ganas de superación y planes a futuro.Se dedica a la crianza de cuyes en su modesto hogar para comercializarlos deacuerdo a la demanda de sus clientes, ella los prepara y vende listos para su adecuada cocción para deleite de las mesas huancaínas. Gracias al éxito de esta actividad ha logrado estabilizar la economía de su hogar en compañía de su esposo que también se dedica a la actividad agrícola. Ante sus deseos de superación ambos han decidido incrementar sus respectivos negocios con el propósito de seguir mejorando su nivel de vida familiar y los estudios de sus pequeños para que en el futuro puedan convertirse en hombres y mujeres de bien útiles a su sociedad.

loans.use: To purchase more guinea pigs and more food for feeding

loans.name: Flavia

texts.es:
Flavia is 57 years old and is married to Antonio, aged 60 who is a salesman. They have three children, all adults, who thanks to the effort made by the couple have managed to access higher education and thus to train for a profession.

She owns a grocery store in which she stocks all the basic store cupboard items for the home. She remarks that she was living in Argentina where she worked as a domestic for five years, until she decided to return to her own country and establish her own business. From then on she has always kept a well-stocked pantry and she comments that she has very little competition and as a result her business is going very well.

She always turned to the Foundation’s loans, as they invested in her store. Now she needs a loan in order to buy more merchandise such as sugar, flour, oils etc., as these are in high demand at this time of year.

Translated for the Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Katy Long

Flavia de 57 años está casada con Antonio de 60 años de profesión comerciante y tienen 3 hijos, todos ya mayores de edad, que gracias al esfuerzo de la pareja han logrado tener acceso a estudios superiores y así hacerse de una profesión.

Posee una despensa donde cuenta con todos los artículos básicos para el hogar. Comenta que estuvo viviendo en la Argentina donde trabajó como empleada doméstica durante 5 años, hasta que un día decidió volver al país y montar su propio negocio. Desde ese entonces cuenta con una despensa muy bien surtida y según comentó tiene muy poca competencia por lo que le va muy bien en su negocio.

Siempre recurrió a los préstamos de la Fundación, los cuales invierte en su despensa. En esta oportunidad necesita del crédito para la compra de más mercaderías como azúcar, arroz, harina, aceites, etc. debido a que tiene mucha demanda en esta época del año.

loans.use: Purcahse of oil, rice, dulce de leche, sweets, etc.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Mrs. Julia is a very enthusiastic and enterprising woman. Her family is made up of herself, her husband and four daughters (ages 23, 20, 15 and 13). Her husband works at Peru Ceramics (Ñaña).

About ten years ago, they decided to start a pottery business, Handcrafted Ceramics Shop, with two gas and wood kilns handcrafted by her husband. They produced a variety of ceramic items (feeders, water dispensers, vases for flowers, urns, flowerpots, cups, Keros (beakers based on ancient designs) and others) based on the desires of their clients.

Currently their main products are the tiled feeders and water dispensers for birds, rabbits and guinea pigs. Their production for Purina has reached between 800 and 1000 pieces per week.

They currently buy about 15 to 20 tons of clay for four months of production and due to the increase in local demand have three operators. They have plans to market to other provinces and outside of the country and are in the process of implementing these business plans. They are aware that additional capital investment will be needed to respond to the increased demand that will result from the expansion of the business. They need to acquire an electric kiln, more tons of clay, increased number of workers, etc.

Julia wants the loan to buy an additional kiln. This will give her the resources to improve the education of her daughters. The oldest daughter is studying business administration and they all help with the painting of the pottery.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Julia es una entusiasta y emprendedora mujer, su familia esta constituida por ella, su esposo y 4 hijas (23,20,15 y 3 años), su esposo trabaja en Cerámica Perú (Ñaña).
