Decidieron emprender desde hace aprox. 10 años la formación de su Taller Artesanal de Cerámica, con 2 hornos construidos artesanalmente por el esposo a gas y leña, elaboran diversos modelos de cerámicas (bebederos, comederos, floreros, jarrones, maceteros, tazas, Keros y otros), de acuerdo a los requerimientos de sus clientes.

Actualmente su principal producto son los bebederos y comederos enlosados para aves, conejos y cuyes llegando a elaborar entre 800 y 1000 piezas semanalmente para Purina.

Actualmente compra aprox. 15 a 20 toneladas para 4 meses, cuenta con 3 operarios debido a que se ha incrementado sus pedidos a nivel local, tiene la visión de abrirse mercado a provincias y al extranjero el cual esta en proceso de tramites para la formalización del negocio, adquirir un horno eléctrico, ya que tiene pleno conocimiento que requerirá de mas capital para poder afrontar los requerimientos en grandes cantidades el cual pasa por ampliar taller, mayor toneladas de arcilla, incrementar números de trabajadores y otros.

Julia desea comprar un horno y así mejorar la educación de sus hijas (la mayor esta estudiando administración y apoyan en las pinturas de las cerámicas).

loans.use: Purchase of materials such as a kiln to produce pottery.

loans.name: Valina Joao

texts.pt:
Valina is not legally married, but lives with a man with whom she has 3 children. Her husband is a truck driver for a private company. The family lives in the administrative post of Chonguene, which is about 15 kilometers from Xai-Xai, and is where Valina has her business. Intially Valina’s husband was FDM’s client, but they decided that the husband should leave the business to Valina so he could take on the job as a truck driver. So, Valina has run the business since March 2007 and the business has grown. She has already repaid her first 9-month loan taken out in March, and now she wants a second one. She is an honest person and has always made her payments on time. Many things have changed in Valina’s life. She had such good results from the first loan that that she was able to open another stand for selling staple goods, improve her home, and says that she is really happy for having received the loan. If the business continues to do well, she and her husband plan on building a better quality home. Valina’s children, except the youngest one, are in school, and if everything goes well with building their house, the couple plans on legally marrying.

Translated from Portuguese by Jill Haring, Kiva Volunteer.

Lidia nao casou oficialmente , mas vive com um homem com quem tem 3 filhos. O marido de Valina e motorista de um camiao, pertencente a um privado. Valina e sua familia vivem no Posto administrativo de Chongoene, que dista da cidade de Xai-xai cerca de 15 Kms. Valina exerce o seu negocio em Chongoene. Inicialmente quem era cliente do FDM era o marido de Valina mas o casal resolveu que o marido deveria deixar de fazer negocio e deixar essa tarefa para Valina, enquanto ele se empregaria como motorista num privado que lhe convidara. Assim Valina assumiu o negocio.desde Marco de 2007.Desde entao o negoci esta a crescer. Ela tomou o primeiro emprestimo em Marco por 9 meses. Ela conseguiu reembolsar o valor emprestado, agora quer tomar um outro. Ela tem bom caracter, pois que sempre pagou pontualmente a sua divida.Muita coisa mudou na vida de Valina. Com o emprestimo anterior ela conseguiu bons rendimentos de tal sorte que conseguiu abrir mais uma barraca onde vende tambem produtos de primeira necessidade, melhorou a sua habitacao, e diz que se sente muito feliz por ter recebido o emprestimo. Se o negocio continuar a correr bem como ate entao ela e o marido pensam construir uma casa com material convencional , pois que a que tem foi construida com material local. Os filhos de Valina a excepcao do mais nvo estao a estudar no ensino basico. Se tudo correr bem e conseguirem concluir a casa que planeiam construir, o casal ira regularizar a sua situacao matrimonial.

loans.use: Valina wants to use the money to purchase products for her small store.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro C. is a 54-year-old man who is married with four children. All of his children live outside the house and he is now working to support himself and his wife. When Pedro was younger, he worked as a traveling salesman and repaired couches and chairs. His wife is a crafter and works making blankets and quilts.

Together they work making goods and selling various things. The loan they are asking for is to increase the amount of material they have in the hopes that their business continues to grow.

loans.use: To buy blankets, thread, and other supplies for work.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria B. was born in Santísima Trinidad on July 22, 1952. She is married to Ramon Benitez Encina and have been married for 32 years. They have two children, Gustavo and Monica, 24 and 27 years old respectively.

Maria and her husband have been selling clothes, intimate apparel and sporting goods on the streets and by special orders for more than 20 years. They got started in the city's municipal market and later got more independent. Since 1988 they became active members of "Fundacion micro creditos" which helped them increase their inventory and improve their way of life thanks to their profits.

Nowaday, they wish for another loan because they have increased their selling zones. This requires them a higher inventory, especially t-shirts and sports clothes, underwear, socks, shirts, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Maria B. nació en Santísima Trinidad el 22 de julio de 1952, ella está casada con el señor Ramón Benítez Encina y llevan casados 32 años. Tienen dos hijos, Gustavo y Mónica de 24 y 27 años respectivamente.

María y su esposo se dedican a la venta de ropas, lencerías y artículos deportivos en general en forma ambulante y a base de pedido desde hace más de 20 años. Se iniciaron en el mercado municipal de la ciudad y luego se independizaron. Desde el año 1998 empezaron a ser clientes activos de la Fundación y con micro créditos que la ayudaron a aumentar su inventario de mercaderías y mejorar su nivel de vida a través de sus ganancias.

Hoy día desean adquirir un nuevo crédito ya que han incorporado nuevas zonas para sus ventas, lo que les demanda mayor cantidad de mercaderías, especialmente remeras y shorts deportivos, ropa interior para damas, medias, camisas, etc.

loans.use: Purchase of clothes, intimate apparel and sports apparel.

loans.name: Sebedon Group

texts.en: Mohamed K. is 70 years old, married, and has 6 children. His children are still young and in school.  He is the leader of the group and has been farming his whole life.  All of the group members would like to expand theirs farms and cultivate rice, sweet potatoes and vegetables.  They are therefore requesting a loan of Le. 1,500,000 to hire labourers and purchase fertilizer.

loans.use: to expand their farms and cultivate greater amounts of vegetables and rice

loans.name: Calixto Francisco

texts.es:
Señor Calixto Francisco Sánchez is a native of the city of Bluefields. He is thiry-years-old, is married to señora Maritza Roa, and both have three young children. Señor Sánchez has been a traveling salesman for five years. He has both men and women of all ages as customers, who prefer him for offering a variety of products and because he goes to their homes. Right now he needs to buy twelve units of mosquito nets at $4 each, five dozen sheets at $53 per dozen, and three dozen towels at $29 per dozen. With this investment, he will be able to obtain more profits and to satisfy his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

El Sr. Calixto Francisco Sánchez es originario de la ciudad de Bluefields, tiene 30 años de edad, esta casado con la Sra. Maritza Roa ambos tienen 3 hijos menores de edad. El Sr. Sánchez es vendedor ambulante hace 5 años, tiene como clientes a hombres y mujeres de todas las edades que lo prefieren por ofrecer una variedad de productos y a domicilio en estos momentos necesita comprar 12 unidades de mosquiteros a $ 4.00 dólares la unidad, 5 docenas de sabanas a $53.00 dólares la docena y 3 docenas de toallas a $ 29.00 dólares la docena, con esta inversión podrá obtener mas ganancias y satisfacer a sus clientes.

loans.use: To purchase mosquito nets, sheets, and towels.

loans.name: Khat

texts.en:
Mr. Khat C., 33, is a widower and lives with his only child in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. He is a truck driver and his truck is used to transfer a large amount of soil from place to place. Since 2003 he has been in the business of selling soil by using a big truck. On average, he makes USD $5 per day. Currently Mr. Khat is earning less profit because his truck is too old and uses a lot of gas. He wants to replace the old and unreliable motor to make his truck more fuel efficient. This move would allow his business to be both more economical and environmentally friendly.

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: To replace an old motor for his truck.

loans.name: Orillas Del Lago Group

texts.es:
Agriculture is the principal activity of 16 people who work in a group called "Orillas del Lago" (Lake Shores). They all live in the community of Achocalla (in El Alto in La Paz), where the climate is perfect for the type of work that they do. They grow mainly vegetables, including potatoes and corn. They also sell flowers and plants. They sell all of these products within the community and also in the markets in the city of El Alto. They would like credits to strengthen their capital for their new harvests, and in this way ensure their sales and generate income that can help them with their family finances.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La agricultura es la actividad principal de 16 personas que trabajan organizados en un grupo bajo la denominación “Orillas del Lago” todos viven en la localidad de Achocalla (El alto –La Paz ) donde el clima es perfecto para el tipo de trabajo que ellos tienen, siembran principalmente verduras , papas, choclos y otros , también se dedican a la venta de flores y plantas. Todos estos productos los comercializan dentro la localidad y también los mercados de la ciudad de El Alto. Quieren créditos para reforzar su capital para las siguientes cosechas, de esta manera asegurar sus ventas y generar ingresos que puedan apoyar en la economía de sus hogares.

loans.use: They need credits to invest in new harvests.

loans.name: Ith

texts.en:
Mrs. Ith S., 25, the mother of two preschool-aged children, is a farmer and pig breeder in Takraong Village in Kampong Chhnang Province.  Her husband, Mr. Tot Thy, sells firewood in the local village. Since his business is going well he wants to expand it, so his wife is requesting a loan to buy more firewood for him to resell. 

Previously, Mrs. S. obtained a loan, now fully repaid, from AMK to buy piglets for breeding.

loans.use: To buy more firewood for her husband's business to resell.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 43-year-old trader. She is married with three children. She has sold used clothes and charcoal in a local market in Obuasi for fifteen years. With this business, she has been able to support two children to complete senior high school. Her major challenge over the years has been funds to scale up the business. 

Gladys has lots of marketing experience and she is very confident that the loan would enable her to make remarkable business progress. She wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothes and bags of charcoal to increase her inventory. She says her greatest joy would be when she is able to provide all her kids with quality education to make them more resourceful in future. She hopes to save enough to fulfill this dream of hers.  Gladys is a member a group called Isaiah. Members in this group guarantee and support one another to repay the loan. Gladys doe not sell on the day of group meeting and she was at her group meeting when her photograph was taken.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes and charcoal

loans.name: Chem

texts.en: Chem M., 34, is married and lives with her husband and their three school-aged children in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. Since 1992, she has been engaged in the business of selling fermented fish and palm sugar to earn a living. On average, Chem M. is able to make about US$2.5 per day. Her husband, working as a taxi-driver, also makes approximately US$2.5 per day. At present, Chem M. would like to take out a loan of US$800 to purchase a motorbike and a trailer to transport the fermented fish and palm sugar.

loans.use: Purchase of a motorbike and a trailer for business

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: El Sr. Francisco tiene 37 años de edad, habita en un barrio que se llama Maria Auxiliadora en la capital de Managua, su esposa le tiene un hijo de 3 años de edad, el negocio de don Francisco es la venta de lubricantes desde hace cuatro años, lo cual inicio con préstamos en una micro financiera, las ventas abecés son bajas debido a la gran competencia de mercado, debido a los altos intereses en otras instituciones, luego opto por Afodenic ya que sus intereses son bajos ya con esta solicitud es la tercera lo cual va a comprar mas productos de lubricantes, ya que tiene bajo el inventario lo cual espera mejorar las venta, como sus ganancias. A largo plazo es pode establecer bien su negocio tener una fosa donde poder hacer los cambios de aceite y también brindar otros servicios, ayudar a sus hijos con los estudios , como también comprar su propia casa ya que habitan en la casa de su mama.
texts.en:
Francisco is 37 years old and he lives in an area called Maria Auxiliadora in the capital city of Managua. His wife has given him a son, now aged 3. Francisco's business for the past four years has been the sale of lubricants. He started the business with loans from a micro financing institution. The sales sometimes are slow given the great competition in the market. Because the interest rates of other institutions were so high, he opted to go with Afodenic because the interest rates are lower. This will be his third loan and with the funds he will purchase more lubricant products to replenish his inventory. This will improve his sales, as well as his income. In the long term he plans to install a car port were he will be able to do oil changes and provide other services as well. He will help his children complete their schooling and he also dreams of purchasing his own home. They currently live in his mother's house.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase lubricants.

loans.name: Cleris

texts.es: Cleris tiene 30 años de edad, es madre dos niños pequeños, vive junto a su esposo que la ayuda en todo y está de acuerdo con sus decisiones para la mejora de su negocio. Ella se dedica a la venta de bebidas, hace un año pudo abrir una pequeña fuente de soda, trabajo que le gusta mucho realizar, y da una buena atención día a día a sus clientes. Este negocio le es muy rentable, ya que se encuentra ubicado en un buen lugar y es muy concurrido por personas que degustan de sus bebidas, debido al  clima caluroso y a su amable trato. Este es su 2do préstamo con MFP, y ha demostrado ser responsable con sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita quiere mandar a ampliar, ambientar e implementar mejor su negocio para tener más acogida.
texts.en:
Cleris is 30 years old, mother of two small children, and she lives with her husband who helps her with everything and support her decisions to improve her business. She sells beverages. A year ago she opened a small soda fountain, work that she enjoys very much, and she provides excellent customer service. This business is very profitable for her, as it is located in a good place and frequented by people who enjoy her beverages due to the hot climate and friendly service. This is her second loan with MFP, and she has demonstrated to be responsible with her payments. With the money she will expand, decorate, and improve her business to be more welcoming.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand and decorate her business

loans.name: On

texts.en: Mrs. On S. is a villager in the Tapaing Khna Village in the Kampong Speu Province. She and her husband, Mr. Khlot Suon, are farmers. On their plantation, they gather only a little rice revenue which cannot support the family well. To improve their living conditions, Mrs. On S. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow in order to start a cow breeding business. Mrs. On S. is 33 years old and the mother of six children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are attending a local school. Her husband is presented on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow to start a cow breeding business

loans.name: Phares

texts.en: Phares N. is a Tanzanian entrepreneurial man. He runs a business of a cosmetics shop at Ukonga ward in Dar es Salaam. He purchases the items from Kariakoo city market wholesale shops and other wholesale shops in Buguruni marketing center. Phares is planning to run a wholesale cosmetics shop at Kariakoo business city center but lacks the necessary funds. Therefore, he is requesting a loan to buy more stock and produce more income.

loans.use: To buy more stock.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Antonio tiene 21 años, vive con sus padres, en la casa de ellos. Se dedica a la fabricación de ladrillos desde hace 5 años, empezó trabajando para otras personas como jornalero, fue donde adquirió toda la destreza y experiencia en el proceso de fabricación de ladrillos, por lo que tiempo después, junto a su hermano, decidieron arrendar un terreno arcilloso para emprender su propia fábrica, que hasta el momento está dando buenos resultados debido a la demanda de ladrillos en su localidad. Antonio está involucrado en el mismo proceso de la fabricación de los ladrillos y ha contratado nuevos jornaleros que le ayudan en esta labor, pero ahora quiere abastecerse de material para el comienzo del verano que será a mediados del mes de marzo a abril, donde las condiciones climáticas son favorables. Es la primera vez que Antonio tiene un préstamo con MFP, su deseo es trabajar por el bienestar de su banco comunal y ser puntual en sus pagos. El dinero que solicita será invertido en lo que haga falta para su fábrica, en esta ocasión, con una parte pagará a los jornaleros y con el resto del dinero comprará leña para el horno donde se realiza la cocción de los ladrillos. El pago que realiza sus jornaleros es de 80 soles por día y la lecha se compra por camionada valorizada en 500 soles.
texts.en:
Antonio is 21 years old and lives with his parents. He has dedicated himself to brick making for the last 5 years. At first, he worked for other people as a day labourer, gaining the dexterity and experience needed to make bricks. Then, he and his brother decided to rent a plot of land with good soil for making clay and begin their own brick factory. So far, they are doing very well, thanks to the high demand for bricks in their neighbourhood. Antonio involves himself in making the bricks and as well, he has hired some other labourers to help with the work. Now he would like to stock up on supplies for the start of summer - in march and april - when the climatic conditions are the best for brick making. This is the first loan Antonio will be receiving from MFP and he very much wants to work hard for the good of his communal bank, and intends to make his payments punctually. The money he is requesting will be invested into his factory. It will help pay the labourers' salaries and will be used to buy fuel for the brick baking oven. The labourers receive 80 soles a day and the fuel, bought by the truckload, costs 500 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fuel and pay labourers' salaries

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen D. is currently brews local alcohol and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Hellen is 38 years old and is married. Her husband is a soldier. She has three children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a shop. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open a shop

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma B. is forty-three, married, and the mother of three.  She lives in Hamtic, at the south end of beautiful Antique Province, where farming and fishing are the backbone of the economy.  Two of her children are in primary school, and one is in high school.  Her husband is a fisherman.  Norma plans to use the money from this loan to buy new nets, rope, and line for her husband's fishing boat, and will use the remaining balance as working capital for her business of buying and selling fish.  One day, Norma hopes she and her husband can buy a long line fishing boat so they will be able to earn more money. She wants to be able to send all of her children to college.

loans.use: To buy nets, rope and line for fishing, and for capital to buy and sell fish.

loans.name: Trần's Group

texts.en:
L. Trần Thị  (20209010004) is a 28-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Băc Ninh.  L. is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 0 (4).


L. is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To make a living, L. is starting a business venture in the food sector operating a butcher shop.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from butchering & selling beef in the local community.  L. has just started operating this business and earns approximately 4.000.000 VND a month from these activities.


L. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  L. is requesting a loan from SEDA for the first time.    She is now requesting a new loan of 5.152.000 VND which will be used to invest in renovating the business.  The loan will be the first loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  L. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Nguyễn Thị Thuỷ (20209010001) is a 28 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector running a general store.


2.  Nguyễn Thị N. (20209010002) is a 35 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector running a general store.


3.  Nguyễn Thị P. (20209010003) is a 29 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a restaurant.


4.  Lê Thị

loans.use: To invest in renovating the business

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en:
Cicilia E. currently sells secondhand shoes and is requesting a loan to buy more shoes and clothes to sell. She is 39 years old and is married to a teacher who has taught at the Gabat primary school for 9 years. Cicilia has four children, two girls and two boys; they all go to school at the Hai gabat primary school where their father teaches. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services. These programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more shoes and clothes to sell

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing is a photographer. He is 40 years old and married with no children. He hopes for the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase a digital camera and film. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a digital camera and film

loans.name: Horacio Alexander

texts.es: El señor Horacio Bermúdez, reside en el barrio Barcelona en la capital de Managua, tiene 42 años de edad, casado y con tres hijos que su esposa procreo, dos están estudiando y uno trabaja y ayuda con los gastos. Sus planes es poder terminar de hacer su vivienda. El se desempeña de fotógrafo y venta de estilaje deportivo, tiene veinte años de experiencia y inicio con préstamos en financieras, con este crédito va a compra material para trabajar en fotografía como en estilaje deportivo. Su meta es poder montar su propio estudio fotográfico. Da las gracias Afodenic por los beneficios que hasta ahora ha logrado con los préstamos en el ramo de su negocio este es su sexto ciclo y espera poder seguir trabajando con el financiamiento para lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Horacio B. lives in the Barcelona region in the capital city of Managua. He is 42 years old, is married and has three children. Two of them are studying and one is working and helps out with the expenses. His plans are to finish building their home. He is a photographer. He has been in business twenty years and he started out with bank loans. With this loan he will purchase products for his photography. His goal is to set up his own photography studio. He is grateful to Afodenic (Kiva Field Partner) for help he has received. This is his sixth loan and hopes to keep up his financing to meet his goals.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products for photography

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena M. is from the town of Katipunan. She is 48 years old. Helena is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Helena owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector, operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling ready-to-wear clothes in the local community. Helena has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Helena joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Helena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Helena is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Helena from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Ymelda

texts.es: Ymelda tiene 48 años, ser madre y esposa la comprometen a velar por el desarrollo y progreso de sus seres queridos, con quienes vive en la casa que adquirió desde que se casó. Su buena sazón la impulsó a tomar la decisión de dedicarse a la venta de comida, pues su interés de ayudar en los gastos de la casa la motivó a iniciar su propio negocio, el cual viene realizando hace 6 años en su casa. Ymelda prepara grandes cantidades de tamales que distribuye en las tiendas de su localidad y también vende de forma ambulante, lo cual le toma  varias horas fuera de casa todos los días de la semana. A pesar de ser una actividad agotadora, por las largas caminatas en las calles, Ymelda tiene muchas ganas de progresar y espera que en un futuro cercano pueda tener un puesto estable donde venda diversidad de platos de comida. Este es su octavo préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA, y junto a sus compañeras, trata de mejorar cada vez más en los trabajos que realizan como organización dentro de su banco comunal. Con los 2000 soles que viene solicitando adquirirá los comestibles necesarios para la preparación de sus deliciosos tamales.
texts.en:
Ymelda is 48 years old. Being a mother and wife obliges her to watch over those she holds dear. She lives with them in the house she has had since getting married. Her maturity drove her to make the decision to sell food, while her interest in helping with the household expenses motivated her to begin her own business, which she has been operating for almost six years out of her house.

Ymelda prepares large quantities of tamales that she distributes in local shops and also sells to take away. Her work takes her outside the house for several hours every day of the week, in spite of this being exhausting due to the long walks through the streets.

Ymelda is very determined to progress and hopes that in the near future she will be able to have a stable place where she sells diverse plates of food.

This is her eighth loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA and each time, together with her partners in her community bank, she tries to bring more improvement to the work of the organization. With the 2000 soles she is applying for she will acquire the foods necessary for her delicious tamales

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of ingredients for her tamales

loans.name: Havea

texts.en:
Havea I. is a 44-year-old woman who lives in Lalovaea village. She is married and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, Havea owns and operates a store where she sells products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste.  She has been in this business for more than two years, and earns about $700 WST a month from her work.

Earlier this year, Havea joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and business. She is applying for her first loan from SPBD to buy more products to sell. Havea plans to use the additional income made possible by this loan to improve and expand her business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: to buy new items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Welfrida

texts.en:
Welfrida J. is from the village of Pigsag-an , Cagayan de Oro City. She is 38 years old. Welfrida is married and has 6 children. To make a living, Welfrida owns and operates a 'sari-sari' (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Welfrida has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Welfrida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Welfrida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Welfrida is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Welfrida from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Maria Blanca

texts.es:
La Sra. María Blanca T. M. es socia del banco comunal Barrio Sucre,  ubicado a unos 50 minutos  a las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca, en la parroquia Cumbe, ella vive en el barrio Manano Loma

María Blanca tiene 41 años de edad, es casada y tiene 8 hijos,  de 21, 19, 16, 15, 13, 10, 8, 3 años de edad, sus primero 4 hijos estudian en un colegio a distancia y trabajan de lunes a viernes como empleados en una hacienda y,  sus 3 hijos menores estudian en la escuela de Cumbe, está separada de su esposo desde hace 6 años porque era malo, acota le maltrataba mucho y les abandono, no le pasa pensión para sus hijos pero se siente tranquila en su hogar porque está muy bien acompañada de sus muchachos y se ha convertido en padre y madre para ellos.

María Blanca se dedica  los quehaceres  domésticos y a la crianza de animales como  cuyes, pollos y borregos, lleva mucho tiempo en la venta de sus animales y le va muy bien en este negocio, con el ha sacado adelante a sus hijos. También manifiesta que los créditos le han beneficiado en la compra de  estos animales y se ha estabilizado un poco económicamente.

Este su tercer ciclo junto a la fundación y nos cuenta que lo que mas le agrada es  el bajo interés que Espoir le brinda, la facilidad para acceder a los créditos y,  la capacitación en temas de salud, o como invertir su dinero, etc. Y,   sobre todo el ambiente de su  bankito ya  que las socias son muy cordiales y se llevan de lo mejor porque han llegado a ser  muy buenas amigas y se apoyan en las buenas y en las malas.

El préstamo que realiza lo va a invertir en  la compra de más pollos, cuyes,  y chanchos, así como  también el alimento y vitaminas para su crecimiento.

El  sueño de María Blanca es poder darles el estudio a sus hijos y que lleguen a ser unos profesionales en la carrera que ellos escojan.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Blanca T. M. is a member of the communal bank “Sucre” which is 50 minutes outside the city of Cuenca, in the Cumbre parish. She lives in the Manano Loma neighborhood. María Blanca is 41 years old, married, and has 8 children ages: 21, 19, 16, 15, 13, 10, 8, 3. Her 4 oldest children take classes online and work Monday through Friday as employees in an hacienda. Her three youngest children are students in Cumbe’s elementary school. She has been separated from her husband for 6 six years because he was no good. He was abusive and left them and doesn’t pay child support. In spite of this, María Blanca is happy at home because she is surrounded by her family. She has become both mother and father to her children. María Blanca takes care of the house and raises animals like guinea pigs, chickens, and sheep. She spends a lot of time selling her animals and is having a lot of success with this business. She has been able to support her family this way. These loans have helped her buy animals and helped to her to find economic stability. This is her third loan with the foundation and she tells us that what she likes best is the low rate of interest Espoir charges. This helps her make her payments. She also likes the trainings on health, investing, etc. Above all, she likes the atmosphere of her communal bank because the members are friendly and everyone gets along because they have become good friends who support each other through thick and thin. She plans to invest her loan money in the purchase of chickens, guinea pigs, and pigs plus animal feel and vitamins to help them grow. María Blanca hopes to be able to give her children good educations and wants them to become professionals in the fields of their choice.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more animals like chickens, guinea pigs, pigs, feed, vitamins

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita B. is from the village of Balanlinao. She is 40 years old. Anita is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Anita owns & operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Anita has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Anita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Anita is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & as working capital. This loan will be the 10th loan taken out by Anita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & as working capital

loans.name: Loem

texts.en: Loem T., 40, is a rice farmer and currently lives in Pursat province, Cambodia. Without the farm work, Loem T. also makes and sells snack cake to neighbors or passers-by in the village. She is married, but divorced her husband, and has two school-aged children, who are dependent on her income. Loem T. said that she hopes to own a shop, which she will use to attract the customers to buy her cake. That is why she requested a loan to build a small shop.

loans.use: To build a small shop

loans.name: Suyapa Concepcion

texts.es:
la sra. Suyapa Concepcion A. O. se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, esta es su unica fuente de ingresos, tiene mucha experiencia haciendo tortillas.
su producto lo vende en diferentes zonas cercanas a su casa de habitacion, tambien lo reparte en pulperias, siempre los fines de semana le encargan para reuniones y fiestas, normalmente en las reuniones de fines de semana la comida que se prepara es la carne asada, frijoles fritos, queso, chismol, aguacate etc, y con este sabroso plato de comida no pueden faltar las tortillas que son el complemento especial para este tipo de comida.
se siente muy feliz ya que todo le esta saliendo bien.
su meta en un futuro es poder remodelar su casa y su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Suyapa Concepcion A. O. is in the business of making and selling tortillas. This is her only source of income, and she has a great deal of experience making tortillas. She sells her product in different areas near her residence, and also distributes it to small stores. Every weekend she receives orders for gatherings and parties. Normally at these weekend gatherings the food prepared is grilled beef, refried beans, cheese, salsa, avocadoes etc. With this tasty dish there must be no lack of tortillas, which are the special complement for this type of food.

She feels very happy now that things are going well for her. Her goal is to be able to remodel her house and her business.

Translated from Spanish by Joseph Tobin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase corn, lime, firewood, water

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
La señora Maribel, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Luchadoras”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 33 años y es madre de 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella y están estudiando.

Las ganas de salir adelante y el impulso optimista que posee, hizo que Maribel iniciara su propio negocio de venta de cosméticos, donde poco a poco, trascurrido el tiempo, le dieron muy buenos resultados y hoy en la actualidad, con el negocio que maneja se siente muy contenta y orgullosa. Los productos que ofrece son de la línea Avon, donde cada tarde después de realizar sus obligaciones del hogar, se dirige a ofrecer sus productos que tiene en stock y de paso también aprovecha para mostrar sus catálogos a sus clientes, donde sus productos le llegan mensualmente. Como complemento para su negocio también se dedica a la venta de Productos de Gano Café (Productos naturales para la cura de diferentes tipos de enfermedades). 

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000.00, comprará productos de belleza para su stock como, perfumes para damas y caballeros, cremas, polvos compactos, lápices labiales, esmaltes de uñas,  asimismo comprar una  vitrina para exhibir  sus productos. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá comprando productos de Gano Café.

Maribel, esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a iniciar su propio negocio y a otras mujeres que quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maribel belongs to the “Fighting Women” Community Bank in Tarapoto District, San Martín Province, Department of San Martín. She is living with someone, is 33 years old and the mother of 2 children, who still depend on her and are studying. The desire to get ahead and the optimistic impulse which she possesses led Maribel to initiate her own cosmetics business. Little by little, over time, she obtained very good results and today, at present, she feels very content and proud of herself. She offers Avon products, and every afternoon, after attending to her household obligations, she ventures out to offer the products which she has in stock, and to show her customers catalogs of items which she receives monthly. To complement her business, she also sells Gano Café products (natural products to cure different types of illnesses). With this loan of 1000 new sols she will buy beauty products for her stock, including women's and men's perfumes, creams, powder compacts, lipstick, nail polish, plus a display counter to exhibit her products. Part of the money will be used for purchasing products from Gano Café. Maribel is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her initiate her own business and those of other women who wish to grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY BEAUTY AND HEALTH PRODUCTS

loans.name: Ziyad

texts.en:
Ziyad is a young Palestinian man aged 27 years. He is married with three young children aged 4, 3 and 1 years old.

Ziyad owns a shop in Khanyounis, south of Gaza City at Gaza strip. In this shop he sells spare parts and accessories for motorcycles. In addition to that, he also fixes them and fixes bicycles, too. He gained his experience working for another shop before having his own.

Demand for bicycles and motorcycles in Gaza strip is very high because gas for cars is not available all the time and is also expensive since Gaza is now under tough siege. Ziyad has requested a loan from FATEN of 1,150 USD to pay for spare parts. He appears in the photo at his shop.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his shop

loans.name: Tesie

texts.en:
Tesie P. is from the village of Yumbing, Mambajao Camiguin Province. She is 39 years old and married with three young children. To make a living, Tesie owns and operates a  sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Tesie has been engaged in her business for more than nine years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Tesie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tesie is requesting a loan of 4,000 PH,P which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Tesie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en: At 44, Ruben is still single. Despite that, he is still happy to be living. He is a farmer and spends most of his time working on the farm. He wants to expand his farm. He has hired some laborers to help him prepare the land for planting. He says that he needs farm inputs but is not able to purchase everything he needs. He applied to CEVI for a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). He will use this loan to purchase farm inputs like fertilizers and other things.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Cresilda

texts.en:
Cresilda S. is from the village of Calabayan, Ozamiz City. She is 29 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Cresilda owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products, such as coffee, Milo, sugar, salt, shampoo, soap and toothpaste, in the local community. Cresilda has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from these activities.
In 2009, Cresilda joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Cresilda is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sanae

texts.en:
Sanae is a 50-year-old woman who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with her husband and their two children.

Sanae has owned a grocery store for a few years. She also sells candies, canned food, home cleaning products, etc. She requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her store. This is the first time that she has requested a loan from A. Majmoua.

Sanae is speciA. in her work because she opens early in the morning and closes late in the evening. Her clients are her friends, neighbors and passers-by. When she first started her business, she didn’t have enough cash to purchase a lot of merchandise. She decided doing her business because she wanted to supplement her husband’s income, as well as always wanting to work for herself.

In future, Sanae plans to keep on improving her store.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Them

texts.en:
Them C., age 36, is married and resides with her children in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. She has two children. She is engaged in a business selling various kinds of dessert at a local market in the city, earning approximately an income of US$ 6 per day. By doing so, she is able to cover her family expenses, especially the children’s education. She has been in this business since 2008. Her husband is a parachute soldier based in the city, earning an income of US$ 2 per day.

The standard of living of the family has improved since she has been in this business, so she wants to have a loan to expand her business. C. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to buy more ingredients to aid her dessert shop. With any remainder, she wants to make improvements to her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, partnered with Kiva.

loans.use: buy more ingredients for the dessert shop

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith I., 41, is making sure that her family has adequate provision for their daily needs. She is married to Alexander and they are blessed with five children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been managing her variety store for one year now.

Edith has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings* and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times from CCT’s cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her variety store.

Now, with your help, Edith would like to obtain a PHP 9,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business by buying stock needed to replenish her current inventory.

Edith dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education. She also works hard so that her family can have a good and peaceful life.


* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy stock needed to replenish her inventory

loans.name: Baudelia

texts.es:
La  Señora  Baudelia R., tiene 41 años de edad, es viuda y  tiene 2 hijos, ambos en edad escolar.
La Señora Baudelia se dedica a la venta de comidas tales como: empanadas, milanesas, croquetas, etc.
Para poder comenzar con esta actividad su difunto marido trabajaba como empleado y de las ganancias empezó a montar el pequeño copetín.
    Esta actividad ya lo realiza hace 15 años, tiene bastante éxito, ya que las comidas preparadas son de muy buena calidad y con muy buen precio, además se encuentra en un lugar estratégico, ya que es el de mayor movimiento en la zona.
El préstamo solicitado es para la compra de un congelador, para poder enfriar mayor cantidad de bebidas.
 El deseo de la Señora Baudelia es lograr que sus hijos lleguen a ser profesionales.
texts.en:
La Señora Baudelia R. is 41 years old and a widow. She has two school-age children. She sells food such as strips of breaded steak, small meat pastries, croquettes, etc. In order to start this business, her deceased husband worked as a clerk, and this small business of selling appetizers was initially funded by his earnings. She has been selling food for 15 years with much success. The quality of the food is very good, and the prices are very reasonable. In addition, her site is strategically located on one of the busiest routes in the area. The requested loan will be used to purchase a freezer, which will enable her to cool more beverages. La Señora Baudelia's wish is to see her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of freezer

loans.name: Vevincia

texts.en: Vevincia R. is from the village of Duka, Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 35 years old, is married, and has five school-aged children. Vevincia owns and operates a business planting and harvesting lanzones (a fruit) and mangoes for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. She is also engaged in buying fruit and sells it together with her own harvest to neighboring villages. In 2009, Vevincia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Vevincia is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Jaime Jhony

texts.es: El Sr. Ramírez Jaime Jhon, vive en el caserío el palto, perteneciente al Distrito de Pachacutec. Tiene dos hijos. Su esposa trabaja como obrera de campo en Ica Pacific. El Sr. Ramírez trabaja como obrero de campo en Drokasa desde hace 4 años. Cuenta con casa propia la cual esta construyendo. Solicita el financiamiento para realizar acabados a su vivienda para así cumplir con su sueño de tener una mejor vivienda y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. El Sr. Ramírez agradece el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Ramírez Jaime Jhon lives in the village of El Palto, which belongs to the Pachacutec district. He has two children, and his wife works as a farm laborer in Ica Pacific. Ramírez has worked as a farm laborer in Drokasa for the past 4 years. He has his own house, which he is still in the process of building. He requests financing to complete construction of the dwelling, which will fulfill his dream of having a nicer place to live and providing a better quality of life for his children. Ramírez appreciates the opportunity we provide for him through this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make improvements to his home.

loans.name: Carlina's Group

texts.en:
Carlina R. is from the town of Benito Soliven. She is the leader of a 12-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Carlina R..
Carlina is 49 years old and single. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making dimsum and selling it to the local community. Carlina is just starting this business.
In 2009, Carlina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Carlina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her second from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

location.town: Purok 2, District II, Benito Soliven, Isabela

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce W. N. is thirty eight years old. Her husband works with Chartis Insurance and they have 2 children. Her business is located at the third floor of a building in Nairobi, the capital city of Kenya. She sells beaded baskets to walk-in and repeat customers. She also sells the baskets to tourists. She has been in this business for the past three years and she says the business is profitable. She says the major challenge she has is lack of enough space to do her business and also small market share. She wishes to get to the international market where she can sell the baskets, as they are really loved by many white people. She is using her loan of KES 50,000 to buy more materials for making the baskets. She hopes to provide employment to many people and increase her clientele base. She describes herself as hardworking and kindhearted.

loans.use: Materials for baskets: e.g beads

loans.name: Sophat

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophat B. is 51 years old and lives in Preal village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Seng Soam, are farmers who own 2 hectars of land where they grow corn, beans and rice. Mrs. Sophat B. also sells groceries at home to earn a small profit and support her family.

In order to support the farming crops and her grocery business, Mrs. Sophat B. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and corn and bean seeds to help her grow crops. With the rest of the loan she will buy more groceries to enlarge her business activities.

Mrs. Sophat B. is a mother of four children; one is a laborer in Malaysia, one works at a garment factory, and the other two attend the local school. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide, and corn and bean seed.

loans.name: Tomasa Beatriz

texts.es:
La Sra. Tomasa C. de 38 años de edad, está casada con el Sr. Anibal Rojas de 37 años de edad, ellos tienen 4 hijos que estan cursando sus estudios secundarios.
   Doña Tomasa se inició en este rubro aproximadamente en el año 1.995; con el capital que juntaron con el sueldo que percibe mes a mes su cónyuge, después de varios años decidieron abrir para su propio negocio de fabrica de remeras, buzos, etc, atendiendo que el señor tenía ya años de experiencia en este rubro porque estaba trabajando en una de las  empresas más grandes del país fabricando ropas. 
En la actualidad en su negocio ya tiene muchos contactos y clientela formada.
   Ella invertiría este crédito en comprar más mercaderías (telas, sierres, hilos, etc) teniendo en cuenta los pedidos que acarrea esta temporada de frio.
texts.en:
Sra. Tomasa C. is 38 years old and married to Sr. Anibal Rojas, who is 37 years of age. They have four children who are enrolled in high school.

Doña Tomasa started sewing in 1995 with capital accumulated from her husband’s monthly salary. After several years, she decided to open her own business making T-shirts, sweatshirts, and other items since her husband has years of experience working for one the largest clothing manufacturers in the country. Her business currently has several contracts and an established customer base.

She will invest this loan in the purchase of more sewing supplies (fabrics, zippers, thread, etc.) to account for the orders she has received for this winter season.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric, zippers, thread, and other sewing supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy painting materials to paint her house

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 19-year-old single man living with his family in Lebanon. After working in a supermarket in his town and getting the needed experience, he opened a mini market in addition to preparing a corner to sell vegetables and fruit. He’s been operating his business since 2008. His shop is situated in a busy area so he was able to win over a good number of customers among those passing by his grocery shop during those two years. He’s thankful for his decision because he’s able to be supportive to his father and help him with some responsibilities despite his young age. Today, he is requesting to borrow US$ 1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase his shop inventory. Note that this is his second loan.

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e., blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.) Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

About Ameen:
Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in the Lebanese Microfinance sector since 1999. Originally, a micro-credit program created by CHF International, Ameen evolved to become Ameen s.a.l. in 2003, a Lebanese services company. In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the Central Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financial institution specialized in Microfinance.

At Ameen s.a.l. we pledge to provide financial services to the largest number of micro and small entrepreneurs and to the working poor, to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loans Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: increase his shop inventory

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
This is Lourdes D., 56, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Rodrigo D., a cook. They are blessed in their marriage with fine and healthy physiques and contentment in their business.

Lourdes operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5-Philippine-pesos worth of cooking oil or an egg. Juanita earns by getting supplies at a wholesale price and selling at a piece rate. Juanita’s store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php200 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php29,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She has been a member of Center for Community Transformation for three years now and regularly attends fellowship meetings*.  

She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. Lourdes dreams that her business will be a stable source of income for her and her husband.


**All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: Buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Alberta

texts.en:
Alberta L. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 61 years old. Alberta is married and has nine adult children. Alberta owns and operates a farm where she grows rice and corn. At her age, Alberta is still strong enough to work at the farm. She also said she is happy maintaining her farm.

Alberta joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Alberta has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Alberta is requesting a new loan of 6000 Philippine pesos (PHP) which will be used to buy rice and corn seed, fertilizers like manure, and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: buying seed, fertilizer, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Yen

texts.en: Yen T. N. is 50 years old with two children who are attending high school. She has  opened a shop that sells many kinds of cakes and noodles; she has been in this business for 5 years. Her business is good. She earns 100,000 VND profit per day. Joining our credit program in 2004, she has used  loans very  effectively in expanding her  shop. Currently, she wants to have a loan of 7,630,000 VND to buy rice as a raw material to make cakes.

loans.use: to buy rice as a raw material to make cakes

loans.name: Alexandra Elizabeth

texts.es:
Alexandra de 37 años, vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil, tiene una pequeña tienda de legumbres y frutas. Es madre soltera con tres hijos. 

Inicio el negocio hace 7 años atrás porque no había una tienda de verduras y frutas por donde vivía, poco a poco con esfuerzo y dedicación a podido aumenta el negocio con mas frutas. Trabaja desde las 06h30am hasta las 22h00pm de lunes a domingo. Un promedio de las ventas de cada vegetal es de $ 0.75 c/u. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, vegetales y frutas para su negocio. En el futuro quiere comprar un vehiculo para movilizar todos los vegetales que necesita.
texts.en:
Alexandra is 37 years old and lives in the Guasmo of Guayaquil; she has a small store where she sells vegetables and fruits. She is a single mother with three children.

Alexandra began this business 7 years ago because there wasn’t a vegetable or fruit store where she lived. Little by little and with hard work and dedication she was able to increase her business with more fruits. She works form 6:30 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. Monday through Sunday. The average sale of each vegetable is $ 0.75 p/u.

With this loan she wants to buy rice, vegetables and fruits for her business. In the future she wants to buy a car to move all of the vegetables that she needs.

loans.use: To buy rice, vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Tsend-Ayush

texts.en: Tsend-Ayush B. is 44 years old and lives with her husband and 3 year old daughter in Bayanhoshuu of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her daughter, aged 3, is not yet of school age and stays at home. Tsend-Ayush and her husband operate a taxi service. She started driving a taxi in 2003 using her own Excel car. After several successful years, she used her earnings to buy a new car after selling her outdated one. With the business profits, they were able to build a new house in their yard. In the future, they plan to build a garage for their car. Tsend-Ayush is a very clever woman and says, "I want to decorate our house". She is requesting a 700,000 MNT loan to purchase spare parts and to build a garage for her car.

loans.use: To purchase car parts

loans.name: Mwalimu

texts.en:
Mwalimu is a married man with three children. One of his chidlren attends school, while the other two are still too young for school. He owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are transportation and food.

For more than sixteen years, he has operated a retail shop selling sugar, maize flour, and wheat flour. Mwalimu faces a major challenge of transportation. He buys goods in bulk from town and transports them to his shop. Mwalimu hopes to operate an agricultural farm in the future. 

He decided to join Yehu because it empowers rural economically-marginalized entrepreneurs. With the 40,000 KES loan, he wants to purchase a poshomill machine that will enable him to grind maize into flour.

loans.use: To purchase a poshomill machine

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “LA AMISTAD DE OLLANTAYTAMBO ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Ollantaytambo perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ernestina; La socia tiene 46 años de edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos, la socia se dedica a la artesanía la socia trabaja como empleada en un centro artesanal, ella se encarga de la venta de la mercadería, la socia trabaja todo el día incluyendo los sábados, ella está aprendiendo a realizar aretes en alambres de alpaca y con mostacillas, la socia desea comprar material para realizar sus aretes y poder venderlos. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra materiales para realizar joyas en alambres.

La socia  agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the "La Amistad de Ollantaytambo" ["The Friendship of Ollantaytambo"] communal bank.  This communal bank is located in the district of Ollantaytambo, which is in the province of Urubamba, department of Cusco.

This borrower is Ms. Ernestina.  She is 46 years old, married, and has 4 children.  She works in the crafts business, as an employee at an artisan's center where she is in charge of selling the merchandise.  She works every day, including Saturdays, and is learning how to make earrings from alpaca wire and beads.  She would like to buy materials for making her earrings and to be able to sell them.  She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of materials for crafting earrings from wire.

Ernestina is grateful for and values the fact that she is being offered a loan in this manner, and she promises to comply with her repayments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to purchase materials for making jewelery from alpaca wire

loans.name: Eyad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a 30-year-old husband and father of 3 children. He was raised in a farm which has been owned by his family since 1980. He has a small cow-raising farm. He produces all kinds of dairy products. He is well known in his community and has an excellent reputation.

He applied for a $1800 loan to build a small barn and to buy a cow. He aims to grow bigger, expand his business, and widen the line of production

loans.use: Build a small barn and buy a cow

loans.name: Mrs. Suy Sophal Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of twenty people who are living in Sman Pream village, Takeo province.  Mrs. Suy S. is the village bank president who was been selected by the other members.  Each of them will use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their family's standard of living. 

She is a chicken seller in the local market where she is able to earn profits to support her family.  She is also a pig breeder, while her husband, Mr. Kusorl Soa, is a driver who gets a low salary to support his family.  They work a lot but they earn little income.  In order to improve her income, Mrs. Suy S. is applying for a loan to buy a cow to start a new cow breeding business.  She is a mother of two children who are both students. 

All the members are shown in this picture but one of them is blocked.

loans.use: To buy a cow to start a new cow breeding business.

loans.name: Joel

texts.es: Joel, de 27 años es un joven muy trabajador y responsable, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Jany de 20 años y su querido hijo Harold, quienes son el motivo principal de todos sus esfuerzos. Todos los días muy temprano por la mañana, Joel sale a trabajar sus campos, para él no existen los días de descanso, ya que tiene que trabajar continuamente su chacra, para tener una buena producción. Sus principales productos de siembra son, el cacao, el café y la hoja de coca, los cuales vende al por mayor en la ciudad de San Francisco. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que tiene trabajando en sus cultivos, ya que puede disfrutar libremente de sus verdes campos, lleva 9 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas que pueden aquejarlas. Para el futuro, desea comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar su producción. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas y espera serlo ahora también. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará abono e insecticidas para mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Joel, 27 years of age, is a hard-working and responsible young man.  He lives in his own house with his wife Jany, who is 20, and his beloved son Harold.  They are the primary motivation for all of his efforts.  Every day, very early in the morning, Joel goes out to work his fields.  For him, there is no day of rest, as he has to work his crops continually in order for them to yield well.  The main crops that he plants are cacao, coffee, and coca leaves, which he sells at wholesale in the city of San Francisco.  

What he enjoys most about his work is the freedom that he has working the land.  He has been carrying out this activity for 9 years, and finds the most difficult aspect of his work to be the plagues that can afflict his plants.  In the future, he would like to buy additional land in order to increase his production.  

This is his first loan with MFP; he has been very punctual in paying his loan installments, and hopes to do so again this time.  He plans to use the two thousand Peruvian soles he is requesting to buy fertilizers and insecticides to improve his crops.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon Z. C. is a 36 year old businessman. He is married to Florence and together they have been blessed with three children. Simon owns a butcher shop and has been in this business for the last ten years. His other source of income comes from selling hides and skin from goats and other animals.

This marks Simon’s third loan from KADET, and he plans to buy fifteen goats for slaughter in his butcher.  The anticipated profits will be directed to the expansion of his business. His dreams and hopes are to become a successful businessman through KADET loans.

loans.use: to buy fifteen goats for slaughter and sell

loans.name: Union Y Solidaridad Group

texts.es: Esta foto fue tomada en la casa de la señora Minerva Pérez, una integrante del grupo unión y solidaridad, que está ubicado en el estado de veracruz, en México. Minerva se dedica a la venta de artículos del hogar que inició hace 5 años. solicita el préstamo para adquirir mas mercancía, sus ventas han mejorado por lo que solicita el préstamo para invertir mas en sus productos. Ella tiene 29 años, estudió una C. comercial, y es madre de un varón de un año, espera obtener más ganancias y mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y su hijo. Silvia M. es la presidenta del grupo, tiene 35 años estudió hasta la secundaria, tiene 2 hijos. Silvia se dedica a la venta de zapatos por catálogo, que inicio hace 3 años. solicita el prestamo para la compra de zapatos por temporada de regreso a clases. Observaciones: se ve a las 11 mujeres del grupo en la foto, la señora que sólo sale su cabeza y parte de su torso se llama Socorro, la segunda de izquierda a derecha de las que estan atras.
texts.en:
This photo was taken at the home of Sra. Minerva Pérez, a member of the group “Unión y Solidaridad” (Unity and Solidarity) which is located in the State of Veracruz in Mexico. Minerva began selling household items five years ago. She is requesting a loan to acquire more merchandise. Her sales have improved, so she is requesting this loan to invest in more products. Minerva is 29 years old and studied for a business degree. She is the mother of a one year old son. Minerva hopes to generate more revenue and improve the quality of life for herself and her son.

Silvia M. is the group president. She is 35 years old and studied through high school. Silvia has two children. She began selling shoes through a catalog three years ago. Silvia is requesting a loan to buy shoes for the school year since students are returning to classes.

Note: Looking at the eleven women in the photo, the woman whose face and torso are partially obscured is named Socorro. She is standing at the back, second to the left.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to sell

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en: Thuy T. N. is 26 years old with 2 children who are at  primary school. She  manages a shop that provides a motorbike repair service.  Since her husband is a excellent repairman,  her shop is always crowded with customers. She can earn 3,000,000 VND profit per  month. A client of our program  for 6 years, she has  had no difficulty in making weekly or monthly repayments. Currently, she wants to have a loan of 8,066,000 VND to buy more  motorbike parts to make her repair service better.

loans.use: to buy more  motorbike parts to make her repair service better

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Don Juan de 42 años de edad, reside en San Simón departamento de Morazán, es soltero y vive solo administrando una farmacia, este negocio inicio hace 8 años ya que trabajo anteriormente en un farmacia como vendedor lo que le dio la experiencia para tratar con los clientes y manejar los precios de los medicamentos, su horario es de 7:00am a 8:00pm.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para comprar vitaminas, sueros, analgésicos, que son de los más demandados por los clientes y al tener el préstamo comprara por cantidades grandes al mayoreo permitiéndole tener un mejor precio por parte de sus proveedores.
El sueño que quiere realizar don Juan es instalar una sucursal en otro lugar e ir creciendo como microempresario.
texts.en:
