Juan, 42, lives in San Simón, Morazán department.  He’s single and lives alone running a pharmacy.  He started the business 8 years ago since he used to work as a salesperson in a pharmacy and got the experience of taking care of customers and managing medicine prices.  His schedule is 7am to 8pm.

He is asking for the loan to buy vitamins, serums and analgesics which are the items most requested by customers.  Having the loan will allow him to buy them in large quantities at wholesale thus allowing for better prices from his suppliers.

Juan’s dream is to open a branch in another place and to continue to grow as a micro businessman.

loans.use: To buy vitamins, serums and analgesics to sell.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort Y. bakes bread which she also sells. She lives in Abee which is near the fishing town of Elmina. After baking the bread, she sells it, presenting it on her head as you can see on the picture, walking the streets of Abee. Comfort is a widow, responsible for seven children who live with her. Sadly her husband has passed away so they rely entirely on her. 

Comfort has been selling bread and other provisions for eight years now.  She expects to boost her business with the loan to be able to take better care of her children. Besides the basic household expenses she is also covering the costs for her children’s education like books, uniforms and other learning materials. She plans to increase the amount of baked bread to be able to sell more and increase her profit as a result.

loans.use: to bake more bread for sale in her town.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 40 years old and married. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 49,500 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her General store.

Nenita has borrowed and paid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from viand (food) vending.

Nenita aspires to save enough from her business activities to repair her house and to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en:
Clementine is 36 and is married, with four children between 3 and 13 years old. She owns a small business where she sells beans. She has been engaged in this business for five years, and her business is clean. She opens her business from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day except Saturday. 

She has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to buy more beans to sell for a good profit. With any profits, Clementine will reinvest in her business and save for the future.

loans.use: to purchase more beans to sell

loans.name: Simon Muigai

texts.en:
Simon is 24 years old and has worked in the transport industry in Naivasha town for the last two years. He also practises farming on his small farm on the outskirts of the town.
Simon was introduced to Kiva partner, KADET, by his friend and this will be his second loan. He paid his previous loan of 75,600 KES well and in good time. He plans to use this loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for his farm. In the future, Simon hopes to grow both his transport and farming businesses.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a pickup truck to transport her work equipment such as tables, chairs, ice box and seafood

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es: Zoila, tiene 45 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo segundo D. 53 años y su querida hija Stefany D. 15 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad D. vida. El negocio al que Zoila se dedica es la venta D. ropa D. forma ambulatoria, ella todos los días recorre las instituciones públicas y privadas, en busca D. clientes que deseen comprar algo D. lo que venD.. La ropa la compra por catalogo, es por eso que los modelos que venD. son muy novedosos y llamativos. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es aconsejar a sus clientes sobre las prendas que están D. moda, lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que caminar todo el día en busca D. clientes. En adelante, espera tener el dinero suficiente, para poner una tienda, donD. pueda vender con mayor tranquilidad. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, esta dispuesta a trabajar muy duro para pagar a tiempo sus cuotas. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más ropa, para poder ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad D. donD. escoger.
texts.en:
Zoila, 45, is a very unassuming, hard working woman.  She lives in her own house with her husband, Segundo, 53, and her beloved daughter, Stefany, 15, for whom she wants to proviD. a better quality of life.

Zoila is a clothing street vendor.  She visits public and private institutions daily seeking customers who wish to buy something of what she sells.  She buys the clothes via catalogue and this is why the items she sells are novel and eye catching.  What she enjoys the most about her work is advising customers regarding the items of clothing that are in style.  She’s been in this line of work for two years and considers the most difficult part having to walk all day looking for customers.  In the future, she’d like to have enough money to set up a store to sell more peacefully.

This is her first loan with MFP and she is willing to work very hard to make her payments on time.  She will use the requested 1500 new soles to buy more clothes to have a wider variety available for her customers to choose from.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to meet customer demand.

loans.name: Jargal

texts.en:
Jargal is 24 years old and lives with her husband in an apartment in Hovd province of Mongolia.  Her husband is an officer at a government agency.  She manages a hair salon in her town. She started her business in 2010 and is planning to expand her business in the future. 

She used to work as hairdresser at Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia for several years.  During that time she gained enough knowledge and experience to open her own hair salon.  She is a polite woman who is requesting a 300,000 MNT loan to purchase equipment for her business.

loans.use: To purchase equipment for her hair salon

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI  est un groupe constitué de six  hommes tous mariés, ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans et en moyenne 4 enfants. Ils vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à  YOLLA  un des villages de la commune de Fana, préfecture de Dioïla, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Ils sont à leur troisième collaboration avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir réaliser les activités hivernales. Ils font exclusivement la culture du maïs qui reste la  culture dominante de la zone. 
TIDIANI, qui est le premier debout à droite de la photo, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 1,5 hectares de maïs.
La production est vendue au niveau de Fana et  Marka-Coungo à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 200 000FCFA après la campagne.
texts.en:
BENKADI  est un groupe constitué de six  hommes tous mariés, ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans et en moyenne 4 enfants. Ils vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à  YOLLA  un des villages de la commune de Fana, préfecture de Dioïla, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Ils sont à leur troisième collaboration avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir réaliser les activités hivernales. Ils font exclusivement la culture du maïs qui reste la  culture dominante de la zone. 
TIDIANI, qui est le premier debout à droite de la photo, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 1,5 hectares de maïs.
La production est vendue au niveau de Fana et  Marka-Coungo à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 200 000FCFA après la campagne.

loans.use: Labour, semence, engrais, herbicide et petits équipements

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Analyn works hard to support her family.

She has a vehicle repairs business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending.  Analyn is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase a new machine for her repair shop business. 

Analyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a new machine for her repair shop.

loans.name: Paulino

texts.en:
Paulino is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with one child. 

Paulino provides motorela or habal-habal services. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy tools & pay for the utilities needed for his motorela.

Paulino has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Paulino hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for the utilities needed for his motorela

loans.name: Fredy Alfonso

texts.es: Fredy  de 47 años de edad,  es un hombre casado que vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos en las edades de 16 a 20 años; él inició su experiencia de negocio hace 20años pues su padre fue mayorista de frutas y le ayudó a desarrollar y emprender su aventura empresarial, con la que Fredy ha trabajado toda la vida en condiciones de independiente, pues observó que le generaba rentabilidad y desde el principio se entusiasmó. Así fue que inició con un punto de   venta de  frutas en el municipio de Baranoa, a 20 minutos de Barranquilla de lunes a sábado y  de cervezas los fines de semana en su casa del barrio Simón Bolívar, uno de los barrios más populares y tradicionales de Barranquilla, donde funcionó el primer aeropuerto del país. Fredy es técnico electricista industrial y también ofrece este servicio en su oferta y obtiene otros ingresos adicionales. En la actualidad  está solicitando un crédito mixto, con el fin de comprar un congelador y cambiar el que tiene, ya que últimamente  este no está funcionando muy bien y comprar bebidas en mayor cuantía así como adicionar  a su negocio la venta de  pollo y carnes frías.  Sus estados financieros están de acorde a la actividad de su negocio, presenta   sus compras las hace de contado, tiene un margen de utilidad bruta del 34,19%, y sus gastos familiares con respecto a la utilidad operativa representan el 75,63%, sus cuentas por cobrar son mínimas cuenta con tres clientes que son pensionados los cuales le cancelan los fines de mes. Su sueño es lograr que su familia tenga cada día mayor bienestar y que sus hijos sean exitosos en lo que emprendan, justamente el motor por el cual trabaja.
texts.en:
Fredy is a 47-year-old married man who lives with his wife and two children, ages 16 and 20. He started working 20 years ago. His father was a wholesale fruit vendor and helped him start and develop his business venture. Fredy has been enthusiastic from the beginning and has worked independently all of his life. As a result, he has operated a profitable business. Fredy started out selling fruits Monday through Saturday in the town of Baranoa, which is 20 minutes from Barranquilla. On the weekends, he would also sell beer from his home in the Simón Bolívar neighborhood. This neighborhood is one of the most populated and more traditional areas of Barranquilla, where the first airport in the country is located. Fredy is also an industrial electrician and offers his services to earn additional income.

At the moment, he is requesting a loan for multiple purposes. He hopes to buy a freezer to replace the one he currently has because it has not been functioning lately. Fredy will also buy beverages in bulk and add chicken and cold cuts to his business. His financial records are in line with his business activity. Fredy's purchases are made with cash and he maintains a gross profit margin of 34.19%. His family expenses with respect to his operating profit represent 75.63%. Fredy’s accounts receivable are minimal since he has three customers who are pensioners and settle their bills at the end of the month. His dreams are for his family to improve their well-being each day and to see his children become successful at whatever they pursue. They serve as the motivation behind his work.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer, a large quantity of beverages, chicken, and cold cuts.

loans.name: San

texts.en: We know that farming is the one business in which it is very hard to earn enough income to support a family and be as rich as others. But Mrs. San and her husband make an effort every day to feed their children so that none die, and they have a good living standard. Both of them have been farmers since 2008. They have four children, all enrolled in school. To create a family that lives in prosperity and is as modern as others, Mrs. Horn and her husband would like to requests a loan from Kiva in order to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other materials. She hopes that she will send all of her children to study at high levels. She is grateful to the foundation for the opportunity it provides her.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other materials.

loans.name: Enim 5 Group

texts.en: Wisje is 45 years old. She is still single. In the picture she is the one who wears glasses. Her business is making accessories and souvenirs for weddings and birthdays. Part of her loan is to pay for tools to make souvenirs. Now she sells souvenirs in her house. In the future she wants to have an accessories store in central Jakarta and she also wants to build a business in cooperation with her nephew.

loans.use: to pay for tools to make souvenirs

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last four years. He is 28 years old and married to his wife Jane. They have one child.

He was introduced to KADET LTD  by one of our field officers and this will be his third loan. He has paid all of his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use this loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Joseph hopes to become one of the leading farmers in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a hardworking businessman. For the last three years, he has been selling home-made soap. Previously, he used to sell clothes. 

In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. His dream is to grow his business and register it as a company. 

He is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to buy industrial salt as a raw material for making soap.

loans.use: To buy industrial salt as a raw material for making soap.

loans.name: Muslima

texts.ru: Муслима честная, трудолюбивая женщина. Более 4 лет она занимается предпринимательской деятельностью. За это время Муслима достигла больших успехов в бизнесе. Она в основном занимается продажей  ткани и женской одежды. У Муслимы также у магазина есть салон красоты.  Она  является руководителем этого салона. Муслима имеет  двоих детей, сын помогает ей в бизнесе. В  будущем она хочет расширить бизнес и открыть швейный цех.  Муслима поэтому обращается к вам и просит помочь в предоставлении  займа на сумму 1680$ США. Она надеется, что вы не откажете ей в помощи и благодарит вас за поддержку.
texts.en: Muslima is an honest and hardworking woman. She has been a businesswoman for the last four years and has been very successful in her endeavors. Muslima's main occupation is selling fabrics and women apparel. Muslima's store also has a beauty parlor which she manages. Muslima is a mother of two children and her son helps her with business. In the future she would like to expand her store to also include a sewing shop. That is why Muslima has turned to you to ask for a loan of $1680. She hopes that you will not deny her your help and is very grateful for the support.

loans.use: to expand her business

loans.name: Taghreed

texts.en: Taghreed is a 35-year-old mother of four children. Her husband works in a governmental institution earning a very humble salary. To be able to support her husband with the financial income of the family, Taghreed started selling blankets and clothes five years ago. By doing this, they have been able to manage their daily living so far. Now Taghreed wants to buy more blankets and clothes in a larger quantity to get a wholesale price, so she can re-sell them and make more profit.

loans.use: to buy more blankets and clothes in a larger quantity to get a wholesale price

loans.name: Gabool

texts.en:
Gabool is a 29-year-old-woman who is married and a mother of three children. She lives in Sana'a where she completed her secondary school and high diploma, in spite of family financial challenges and a hard life.

Gabool started her business, which is a Beauty Salon for women, three years ago with the expectation that she would be able to meet her own needs and her children's. She tirelessly worked in her salon and attracted new clientele to the extent that she hired another woman to help her. Her living conditions improved and so did her income.
 
The expansion of Gabool's clients made her in need of funding to purchase more beauty supplies. She applied for her first loan from AMB and repaid it successfully. Now Gabool took her second loan amounting to 80,000 Rials from AMB in order to purchase more beauty supplies for her salon. In the future, Gabool intends to expand her business and hire another woman to replace her. She is also saving for her children in order to enroll them in a private school.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and other beauty supplies

loans.name: Mardelia

texts.es: Mardelia tiene 60 años, vive sola en su casa que es de su propiedad. Sus hijos ocasionalmente la visitan en compañía de sus nietos, dándole a ella la alegría de verlos crecer. La actividad que realiza Mardelia es la venta de abarrotes de primera necesidad, negocio que lo realiza en su bodega ubicada en los espacios de casa, desde entocnes atiende a sus vecinos. Tiene 15 años trabajando en su tienda, y hasta el momento lo ha hecho sola, pero han habido ocasiones en que sus hijos la apoyaban cuando estaba de visita en su casa. Lo que le gusta de esta actividad es que le ha permitido, por muchos años solventar los gastos de su hogar, así como brindarles una educación a sus hijos, que son su orgullo, comenta además, lo bien que se siente al sentirse productiva. Considera rentable su negocio, por la rotación que tiene los productos y dándole una buena administración. Este sería el primer crédito con la institución MFP, se siente bien y cómoda con el grupo comunal el cual forma parte, y espera poder seguir recibiendo el apoyo de la institución. Con el monto solicitado, lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes al por mayor, como aceites, azúcar, y demás, para poder mantener su bodega.
texts.en:
Mardelia is 60 years old and lives alone in her own home. Her children and grandchildren occasionally visit her, so it gives her great joy to see them grow. Mardelia sells groceries and basic necessities. Her business is located in her home, so she is able to serve her neighbors. She has managed her store for 15 years and currently works alone, but occasionally her children will help out whenever they come to visit her. What she enjoys about this business is having been able to cover her household expenses over the years as well as provide an education for her children. She is proud of this achievement. In addition, she says working makes her feel productive. Mardelia considers her business to be profitable because she is able to manage the turnover of her products.

This will be her first loan with MFP. Mardelia feels good and is comfortable with the Communal Bank group that she has joined. She hopes to continue receiving support from the organization. The amount she requested will be used to buy groceries in bulk such as oil, sugar, and other products, so that she can maintain her store.

loans.use: to buy oil, sugar, and other products in bulk.

loans.name: Maria Clelia

texts.es:
María tiene 31 años, vive solo con sus dos hijos en Otavalo en la Provincia de Imbabura al Norte de Ecuador. María es una persona trabajadora, honesta y luchadora que quiere sacar adelante a sus hijos.

María trabaja sola en una tienda de víveres, solicita el primer crédito a Fodemi ya que necesita invertir en la compra de víveres para su negocio ya que su clientela le pide productos que ella no tiene y pierde ventas y clientes, entonces este crédito ayudará a María a incrementar su negocio y clientes, que le generará muy buenos ingresos que facilitará la mantención de su familia.

Su sueño es poder tener un local propio, y poder comprar electrodomésticos de enfriamiento para productos perecibles.
texts.en:
María is 31 years old and lives alone with her two children in Otavalo, in Imbabura province, in the north of Ecuador.  María is a hard-working, honest and tenacious person who would like to provide for her children.

María works alone in a grocery store.  She is requesting her first loan from Fodemi as she needs to invest in buying foodstuffs for her business.  Her customers are asking for products that she does not have and so she is losing both sales and customers.  The loan will help her to increase her business and her number of customers.  This will make her very good income with which she can support her family.

María's dream is to own her own premises and to be able to buy cooling appliances for her perishable products.

loans.use: to stock her grocery store

loans.name: Damalie

texts.en:
Damalie is 38 years old and lives in the town of Buwenge in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is married and has 7 children with 3 of them currently in school. For the past 8 years, Damalie has been working hard to manage her clinic, which provides basic health services and sells medicine. 

To help expand her business, Damalie has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more medicine for resale, and will help Damalie to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Damalie hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house of her own. 

Damalie is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Damalie who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more medicine for resale

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen, de 49 años convive junto a Mauro de 52 años; viven en casa propia junto a sus 02 hijos Iván y Kendy, quienes son el motivo de su esfuerzo. Carmen, se levanta muy temprano y en compañía de su pareja se dirigen a sus chacras para cuidar de sus plantas de cacao y achiote, ya que es el sustento de vida que poseen. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es ver a diario el avance de sus plantas y esperar la cosecha; lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo mas difícil es no poder combatir con las plagas de insectos que perjudiquen  su producción. Con el crédito solicitado podrá comprar plantas de frutas para sembrar en sus tierras para después cosecharlas y venderlas ya que vio que es muy rentable. Este será su préstamo número 03 con MFP, y esta apta a pagar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que desea acceder a otros créditos posteriormente. Los 2,000 nuevos soles, invertirá comprando plantas de frutas como: naranja, piña, pacay, entre otros. Para poder tener mas productos en sus tierras y venderlas a buen precio.
texts.en: Forty-nine-year-old Carmen lives with her partner, 52-year-old Mauro, in their own home with their two children, Iván and Kendy, who are their motivation to work hard.  Carmen gets up very early and, together with her partner, goes to their farms to take care of their cacao and annatto plants, since these are their only means of support.  What she likes most about her work is seeing her plants grow on a daily basis and waiting for the harvest.  She has been doing this for 10 years and she thinks the most difficult part of it is not being able to fight the plagues of insects that damage her crops.  With this loan, she will be able to buy fruit plants to plant on her land and later harvest and sell, as she has seen that this is very profitable.  This will be her third loan with MFP and she is good about making her payments on time since she wants to take out more loans afterward.  She will use the 2,000 nuevos soles to buy fruit plants, such as orange, pineapple, and pacay, among others.  This will allow her to produce more on her land and sell at a good price.

loans.use: to buy fruit plants such as orange, pineapple, and pacay

loans.name: Cathelina

texts.en:
Cathelina is 38 year old, married, and has four children, one of whom attends school. She has a business of selling charcoal in Yambio, South Sudan, which she has been doing for two years.

Cathelina is requesting a loan through BRAC South Sudan, which she will use to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: El Sr. Jorge, es una persona trabajadora y responsable el  cual  tiene   una  tienda  abarrotes  la  cual  le  permite  salir  adelante  día con  día,  gracias  a  su esfuerzo  diario  ahora  tiene   su  casa  el  cual  representa  su  patrimonio  familiar,  el  requiere   de nuestro  apoyo  ya  que  necesita  impermeabilizar la  losa  de  su domicilio  ya  que  desea  mantenerla  protegida en  esta  temporada  de  lluvia, ve  en el crédito  la posibilidad  de  brindar  a su  familia  una  mayor  seguridad agradece  el apoyo  brindado  para  la realización de  su  proyecto.
texts.en: Jorge is a hard-working and responsible person who has a grocery store that allows him to get ahead day by day.  Thanks to his daily effort he now has his house, which represents his family legacy.  He needs our help because he needs to waterproof the slab of his home, since he wants to protect it in this rainy season.  He sees in the loan the possibility of giving his family greater security.  He is grateful for the support offered to realize his project.

loans.use: to waterproof his concrete slab.

loans.name: Cinthya

texts.es:
Cinthya se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida. El crédito lo requiere para compra de insumos (papa, chuño, carne, fideo y condimentos) que le ayudara a la preparación de alimentos. Cinthya es soltera  y no tiene hijos .Vive en casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona  de San Martín en  la Ciudad de La Paz. 
Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en: Cinthya works preparing and selling food.  She needs the loan to buy ingredients (potatoes, dehydrated potatoes, meat, noodles and condiments) that will help her prepare the food.  Cinthya is single and has no children.  She lives in her parents’ house located in the city of La Paz’s San Martín zone.  It is the first time she’s worked with IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for food preparation.

loans.name: Nyangasi

texts.en:
Nyangasi is a married man with six school-going children. He owns a house with piped water but no electricity. His greatest monthly expenses are food for his family and school fees for his children. 

Nyangasi has operated a tailoring business for the past six years; his potential clients are his neighbors. He faces a major challenge of seasonality. He dreams of expanding his business. 

With the Kshs 40,000 he wants to purchase fabrics, embroidery and also pay for sewing machine repair. He decided to join Yehu to get capital to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics, embroidery, and also pay for sewing machine repair.

loans.name: Mujeres Valientes Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama Mujeres Valientes, es un grupo que se está esforzando por poder salir, y por medio del trabajo continuo poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida. El grupo tiene 17 mujeres todas con un objetivo en común, ayudar a mejorar la situación de vida de sus familias.
Una de las integrantes, la señora Benjamina quien se dedica a la venta ropas, ella es muy emprendedora, ella recorre en una motocicleta por la zona ofreciendo sus prendas en la propia casa de sus clientes en vista de que hay muchos lugares de ventas.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas variadas para la venta, con lo cual podrá seguir trabajando y ganándose el sustento para su familia.
texts.en:
The lending group called Mujeres Valientes [Brave Women] is a group that makes the effort to get ahead and, through continual work, to improve their living conditions. The group has 17 women all with a common goal: to help improve the quality of life for their families. 

One member, Benjamina, works in clothing sales. She is very hardworking and goes around on a motorcycle throughout her neighborhood showing her articles in her clients' homes. This business model means there are many points of sale. She is seeking this loan to be able to buy various articles for sale, with which she will be able to go on working and earning a living for her family.

loans.use: to buy clothing articles for sale.

loans.name: María Leticia

texts.en:
ENGLISH

Three years ago, Leticia started a small business where she sells Tacos and Hamburgers outside her house. She started the business mainly because her husband works in an eventual position, where the pay is not predictable and consistent. That is why some days they do not earn money and for this reason she decided she needed to support the family economy by working herself. She works at home and at the same time, is able to take care of their teenager sons who need a lot of attention. One of them has a tow in front to her house where she prepares the meals.

More recently, their daily clients have been increasing, and this is why she needs a loan of $925 USD and commits to paying back in a term of 6-12 months. The money will be used to buy tables and chairs and also be able to offer a better service in a more comfortable area in the garage of her house.

ESPAÑOL

Hace tres años que Leticia inició su negocio de venta de Tacos y Hamburguesas afuera de su casa. La razón por la que inició fue debido a que su esposo tiene un trabajo eventual por eso había días en que no percibía ingresos y ante esa situación, decidió apoyar la economía familiar con este negocio, sin tener que salir de su casa y descuidar a sus hijos que son adolescentes y requieren de su atención. Cuenta con un remolque ubicado en el frente de su casa en donde prepara los alimentos al público en general.

En la actualidad sus clientes se han ido incrementando, es por eso que necesita un préstamo de $925 USD a pagar en un plazo de 6-12 meses, para comprar mesas y sillas y poder atender a sus clientes en un área más cómoda dentro de la cochera de su casa.

loans.use: To Buy Tables and chairs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase spinning and weaving machinery

loans.name: Vaelupemaua

texts.en: For shop owner Vaelupemaua T., being the family breadwinner is not easy when there is a large family and many disputes.  Although her immediate and extended family tends a small plantation, her shop is this large family's main source of income.  Maintaining this lucrative business is a lot of responsibility.  Currently, Vaelupemaua is running low on inventory.  Given her family's needs, she is not always able to reinvest as much of the profit as she would like back into the business.  So she is currently applying for a loan to purchase inventory and re-stock her shop.  This will ensure she is able to keep her doors open and her loyal customers returning.

loans.use: Re-stock her shop

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en: Aminata B. is married with five children.  Her husband is a petty trader while Aminata runs a small restaurant selling local dishes in the market town of Magburaka of Sierra Leone.  At thirty-five years of age, she has been running the business for two years. She is requesting the loan funds to purchase bags of rice and other stock.   She said during the rainy season it will be difficult to travel into the villages to purchase the local rice, therefore she needs to buy the stock now and store them to continue running her restaurant without difficulties.

loans.use: Purchase stock for small restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy more merchandise

loans.name: Clarisa

texts.es:
Clarisa is the mother of three children. Her oldest daughter is studying at a university and the other two children are in high school. She lives with her husband, who is the one that gave her the idea of working in a new grocery store, since he works in a sales position in the market. Thanks to the tireless teachings of her husband, she began her commercial foray under the attentive supervision of her constant companion. She also counts on help from her two littles children who help work the busiest days in the store. Thanks to the quality of her services, she was soon able to count on the kindness of many people, which why she began to realize the need to increase the number of items she offers. Clarisa is very happy with her work and is commited to continuing her work for the benefit of her household.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer

Clarisa es madre de 3 hijos, su hija mayor está cursando estudios en la universidad y los otros dos hijos están en el colegio; vive con su esposo que le dió la idea de trabajar en una nueva bodega, a raíz de que él cuenta con un puesto de ventas en el mercado. Gracias a la inquietud y enseñanzas de su esposo inició su travesía comercial bajo la supervisión y atenta mirada de su incondicional compañero adicionalmente cuenta con el apoyo de sus dos pequeños hijos quienes colaboran con su labor los días de mayor afluencia del público. Debido a la calidad de sus servicios en poco tiempo cuenta con la simpatía de muchas personas y por esta razón se ve en la necesidad de incrementar el número de artículos que oferta; Clarisa está muy contenta con su labor y se compromete a seguir trabajando para beneficio de los miembros de su hogar

loans.use: Purchase of stock and storage for her grocery store to increase sales.

loans.name: María De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
Maria de Los Angeles is a woman that has struggled all of her life to make a better life for her children. Her husband spends most of his time away from the home because he is a truck driver. However, Maria has tried to not let this problem affect her or her family neither emotionally or economically. Since her husband is most often away, she does not have the financial security she needs. If she need to pay for something, but he is away, she and her family are left stranded. This is why she began to look for a job as a salesperson for standing fans in a furniture store. As time went by she realized that she could increase her earnings if she invested in buying her own standing fans to sell. That way she could cut out the middle man. That is the way she did it, she saved some money and bought several standing fans and began to sell them. Now she has several clients and she keeps looking for more so that she will earn more money. She also sells shoes from a catalog to her friends and clients. In the picture above she is shown showing her shoe catalog.

Recently she has many orders that she has not been able to fill because of a lack of money. That is the reason why she is asking for a loan of $475 that she will repay in 6 months. With this loan she will be able to but more merchandise to offer to her dear clients. With your help Maria will be able to improve her economic situation and celebrate a Christmas holiday united with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela and Kendra of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteers

María de los Ángeles es una mujer que a luchado siempre por sacar a sus hijos adelante a pesar de que su esposo trabaja la mayor parte del tiempo fuera de su casa, puesto que es chofer de un camión, sin embargo María a tratado de que este problema no le afecte a la familia tanto en el aspecto emocional como en el aspecto económico puesto que el tener al esposo fuera de la ciudad no le brinda la seguridad de que en cualquier incidente que se requiera dinero poder apoyarla. Es por esto que comenzó a buscar trabajo como vendedora de avanicos de pedestal en una mueblería, y al paso del tiempo se dio cuenta que las ganancias se le incrementarían si ella invierte una cantidad al comprar los avanicos y se quita del centro el presupuesto que gana la mueblería, y así lo hizo, juntó un poco de dinero, compró vario abanicos y comenzó a ofrecerlos, hoy ya tiene varios clientes y sigue buscando más para poder tener mayores ganancias. Aunado a esto María ofrece zapatos por catálogo entre sus amios y clientes.Así como en la fotografía muestra su catálogo de zapatos.

Sin embargo actualmente tiene varios pedidos que no a podido surtir por falta de dinero y es por esto que María está solicitando un crédito de US $475 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero poder comprar más mercancía para ofrecerle a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda María y su familia podrán salir adelante y festejar una navidad en familia.

loans.use: Fill her shoe orders

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria G. is a native of San Martin, Peru. She has four children of whom only one lives with her. She started as a small business owner by selling candy. As a result of her entrepreneurial spirit, she was able to create another business, selling sandwiches and “salchipapas.” She bought a street cart, working with it everyday starting at 6:30PM, generating another form of income. Maria would like to buy two display cases so that she may sell seasonal articles. It’s worth mentioning that Maria is an amiable, perseverant person who is close with her community.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

María G. es natural de San Martín, departamento del Perú. Tiene 4 hijos de los cuales 1 hijo solo vive con ella. Se inicia como microempresaria vendiendo golosinas. Debido a su espíritu emprendedor pudo formar otro negocio el cual es de venta de sandwiches y salchipapas, se compró un carrito sanguchero. trabajándolo todos los días a partir de las 6:30p.m. generándole otro tipo de ingreso. María proyecta comprar dos vitrinas para poder vender artículos de temporada. Cabe mencionar que María es una persona amable, perseverante y solidaria dentro de su comunidad.

loans.use: Stock purchase.

loans.name: Simon

texts.es:
Simón has an upholstery shop where he maintains and lines vehicle interiors. His wife is a street vendor, and in this way, they manage to use their principal income to cover the college education costs of their children. They live in the 16 de Julio Zone in the city of El Alto.

The credit is necessary for the purchase of a computer for his children who are at the public university and also for the purchase of raw materials for his shop like upholstery, thread, and other materials.

This is his second credit through Kiva. His good record with the institution authorizes him to be approved for another loan. His previous credit was paid off before the final payment date.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Simón tiene su taller de tapicería en el cual realiza mantenimiento y forrado de interiores de vehículos en general; la esposa es comerciante ambulante y de esta manera logran sus ingresos principales con los que cubren la educación universitaria de sus hijos; viven en la Zona 16 de Julio de la Ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito es requerido para la compra de una computadora para sus hijos que están en la universidad publica y también para comprar materia prima para el taller, como ser tapices, hilos y otros materiales.

Es el segundo crédito vía Kiva, el buen antecedente con la institución le faculta aprobarle otro préstamo. El crédito anterior con Kiva ha sido cancelado antes de la fecha final de pago.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of upholstery, thread, and other items; also for the purchase of a computer for his children

loans.name: Asia

texts.en: Asia S. has been a tailor for 25 years. She works in a sartorial factory but also does some tailoring work at home. Asia is married and lives with her family in Smolian, Bulgaria. Her husband works in a constructing company. Because Asia does so much work at home, she has applied for $775 (1,000 BGN) to buy a better sewing machine.

loans.use: To buy a better sewing machine.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim sells purified water in the town of Makeni.  With his previous loan, he increased his stock.  Lack of a clean drinking water supply is a big problem in the town and Ibrahim is trying to provide the service to those who can’t afford to buy.  Due to lack of sufficient capital, Ibrahim could not meet the demand of his customers especially during the dry season.  He is therefore requesting a loan of Le.3, 500,000 to increase the stock and sell wholesale.

loans.use: To increase his production of purified drinking water so that he can sell it wholesale.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es:
As he is always looking for ways in which to earn more money for his family, Orlando O. spends all his time looking after businesses. He now has a grocery store and a sweet shop, which is a recent addition as he used to have a mechanic workshop which, unfortunately, he had to close due to competition. He therefore started the sweet shop with his wife, who is a primary school teacher.

Orlando, who has 1 son, is not afraid of any business, and he has a great vision for the progress of all his businesses. The wellbeing of his family is what motivates him everyday.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Siempre con la idea de buscar formas de obtener ingreso económico para mantener a su familia, Orlando O. emplea todo su tiempo para el manejo de sus negocios. Actualmente tiene una bodega y un taller de confección. Este último lo cambio no hace mucho por un taller de mecánica que tenia. Lamentablemente por el exceso de competencia decidió por cerrar su taller de mecánica y empezó un taller de confección con la ayuda de su esposa, quien labora como profesora de primaria. Orlando, padre de un hijo, no le teme a nada cuando de negocio se trata, tiene la visión de progreso bien en claro y la búsqueda del bienestar familiar es lo que lo motiva a seguir trabajando día a día.

loans.use: To finish building his house and to build some rooms to rent/El qusiera poder terminar de construir su casa y construir habitaciones para alquiler

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es:
Maria belongs to "Grupo Mientras Tanto Las Rosas de Yungay". She sells sweets, sodas in the Yungay province.

With the loan of S/. 500.00, which will be paid back in 4 equal payments, she will purchase 5 cases of soda, disposable diapers, and 5 dozen paper plates.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, KIVA Volunteer.

Las señora Maria pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto Las Rosas de Yungay, se dedica a la venta de golosinas, gaseosas y descartables en el mercado del distrito y provincia de Yungay, departamento de Ancash. Con el préstamo de S/. 500.00 , el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará 5 paquetes de gaseosas , paquetes, 2 paquetes de pañal desechables y 5 docenas de platos descartables. Ella tienen 57 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos que le ayudan en su negocio.

loans.use: More supplies for sales

loans.name: Cheikh Oumar

texts.fr:
Cheikh Oumar is a mechanic and his main business consists of repairing motorcycle tires. This loan would help him build his business and buy new products. The income will help him pay for the schooling expenses for his children as well as take care of his wife and children.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Cheikh oumar est un vulganisateur son activité principale est la réparation des pneus pour moto .Le pret contracté lui permet de renforcer ses activités par l'achat de nouveaux produits.Les revunus tirés de l'activité lui permettent de payer les frais de scolarité de ses enfants mais aussi d'entretenir sa femme et ses enfants.

loans.use: Operating funds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To replenish her small clothing store

loans.name: Subira's Mkorofi Si Mwezi Group

texts.en:
Subira is 22 years old. She is married.

Subira has a business selling shoes and bed sheets. Each day, she works at her business. She can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

Subira now hopes for a loan so she can buy more shoes and bed sheets to sell. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Arafa, Mwanakhamis and Kidawa.

loans.use: To buy more shoes and bed sheets to sell

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
La señora Patricia pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Jardines”, vive en la región y provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto. Su actividad económica lo desarrolla en una de las calles que pasa por el mercado No 02 de la ciudad. Se dedica a la compra y venta de gallinas. 

Con el crédito recibido de S/.800, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará  gallinas, porque sus compras lo hace diariamente, eso quiere decir que invierte a diario para atender bien a los clientes que la visitan, y a quienes también entrega, sobre todo a las personas que venden caldo de gallina.
 
La señora Patricia tiene 26 años de edad, vive con su esposo y su pequeño hijo que aún depende de ella. Trabaja duro todos los días porque a veces tiene que salir en busca de sus animales para tener que vender todos los días, Su meta es comprar un terreno para poner un corral de pollos y gallinas.
texts.en:
Patricia is a member of the communal bank “Los Jardines.” She lives in the region and province of San Martin in the district of Tarapoto. She carries out her economic activity in one of the streets that goes by the No. 02 market of the city. She dedicates herself to the purchase and sale of chickens.

She will use this loan of $275, which she will repay in six months, to purchase chickens. Because she makes her purchases daily, she invests daily so that she can tend to her clients that come to her as well as to those to who she delivers especially those that sell chicken soup.

Patricia is 26 years old and lives with her husband and small child who still depends on her. She works hard every day because she sometimes has to go out in search of animals so that she has something to sell every day. Her goals is to purchase land to have a pen for chicks and chickens.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chickens.

loans.name: Lamine

texts.fr: LAMINE D. HABITE AU QUARTIER CHAMP DE COURSE A DIOURBEL. SON ACTIVITE CONSISTE A ACHETER DES MOUTONS, LES ENGRAISSER ET LES REVENDRE. IL A UNE EXPERIENCE DE 5 ANS.
texts.en:
LAMINE D. lives in the CHAMP DE COURSE district of DIOURBEL. His work involves buying sheep, fattening them, and selling them. He has five years of experience.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fattening sheep

loans.name: Bui Thi

texts.vi: Chị Bùi Thị Thuỷ năm nay 35 tuổi, Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2007. Vòng vốn đầu tiên chị vay để đầu tư vào kinh doanh. Hiện tại gia đình chị đang kinh doanh bia và hàng khô cho thu nhập 2.500.000đ/ tháng. Với mức thu nhập này kinh tê gia đình chị đng ngày càng ổn định hơn. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9 triệu đồng để đầu tư vốn mua thêm bia về bán
texts.en:
Mrs. Bùi Thị Thuỷ is 35 years old. She has participated in the TYM Fund since 2007. She invested her first loan in a business. Today, her family retails beer and dried goods for an income of 2,500,000 VND per month. With this level of income, the family's financial situation continues to improve each day. For the upcoming loan, she hopes to borrow 9 million VND to put towards purchasing more beer to sell.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret O. is 44 years old, married, and has 6 children. Three of her children are in college, and one other is attending secondary school.

Margaret runs a small "hotel" in Rongo, Kenya (many of the small restaurants in the area are locally known as hotels). In her hotel, Margaret cooks local dishes to serve to the community. Her business has been open for under a year. Because this is a relatively new business, Margaret is applying for a loan of 10,000 Kenya Schillings ($150.00) to give the hotel a financial boost to start things off positively.

loans.use: Buy restaurant supplies

loans.name: Ahmadchon

texts.ru: Xошимов Ахмадчон парень в возрасте 30 лет , женат имеет 1 ребёнка.Его бизнес это производство домашних национальных лепёшек.Он арендует комнату в доме своего друга.В его цеху 8 работников.Сам Ахмадчон печёт хлеб в тандыре.Для закупа оптом муки ему недостаточно денежных средств. Для этого он обратился в Микроинвест.Если купить муку за наличные , то Ахмадчон говорит что разница в цене большая , чем за безналичку.Увидев деятельность Ахмадчона явно видно что производство в разгаре,и ему необходимо помочь.Сам Ахмадчон благодарен всем инвесторам.
texts.en:
Ahmadchon H. is 30 years old. He is married and has one child. His business is baking home-made national flat bread. He leases a room at his friend’s house and employs 8 workers. Ahmadchon does not have enough money to purchase flour wholesale, however it makes little business sense to purchase flour at its retail cost; thus, he reached out to MicroInvest for a loan. Ahmadchon’s business is booming, and he is grateful to all of his investors.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Flour purchase

loans.name: Maria Esmeralda

texts.es: La Sra. Maria reside en Hialeah, tiene 65 años de edad, sus hijos son independientes, desde hace  quince años vende  electrodomésticos y piñatas, que inicio con capital propio de lo que iba ahorrando, doña Maria hace préstamos los cuales se ha beneficiado para invertir en su negocio, con esta solicitud es la quinta la cual va invertir en electrodoméstico para vender a sus clientes unos encargos  que le han hecho, sus planes son vender otros productos en donde le generen mejores ganancias.  Así como terminar de hacer mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
María lives in Hialeah and is 65 years old. Her children are now adults and she has sold domestic electronics and piñatas for 15 years. She began her business with her own savings. This is the fifth loan that María has requested, and she has used the other loans to invest in her business. She will use this loan to buy domestic electronics to sell to her customers, from whom she has already gotten a few orders. Her future plans are to sell other products that will generate more income, and to finish the improvements she is making to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy domestic electronics

loans.name: Edith

texts.es: Edith Días D. A., resiD. en el Cantón San Juan buena vista en Ahuachapán, vive junto a su esposo Elman A. D. 45 años D. edad cuya profesión es ser agricultor y con sus cuatro hijos menores D. edad. Edith D. 44 años ha trabajado durante 15 años en el negocio del maíz, el cuál consiste en cultivarlo y venderlo anualmente cuando la cosecha esta lista. El deseo D. Edith es el D. aumentar su capital D. trabajo D. manera que pueda invertir más en su negocio, todo esto con el fin D. poder mejorar los ingresos familiares y poder brindarles estudios a sus hijos y D. esta manera ofrecer un mejor futuros para ellos.
texts.en:
Edith Días D. A. lives in the San Juan Buena Vista district in Ahuachapán. She lives with her husband, Elman A., who is 45 years of age and a farmer, and their four young children. Edith is 44 years old and has worked for 15 years in the corn business, which consists of cultivating it and selling the annual harvest when it is ready. Edith’s wish is to increase her working capital to invest further in her business. All of this is toward the goal of improving the family’s income, and proviD. an education for her children so they can have brighter prospects for the future.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more corn for her business.

location.town: Cantón San Juan buena vista, Departamento de Ahuac

loans.name: Regina C.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 25-year-old Regina S. from Mbeya. She is single. 
Regina has been running a clothes-selling business since 2007. She purchases clothes at wholesale and sells them at retail. 

She works at the business for 5-8 hours per day, 6 days per week. One employee assists her. Regina currently earns about 130 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400USD in order to purchase more clothes in bulk for her business. In the future, she plans to open the same business at a new location. Regina thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future

loans.use: To purchase more clothes in bulk

loans.name: Viclar

texts.en:
Viclar T. owns a small variety store. She sells food and other commodities to earn an income for her family. She is thirty-two years old and has two children. She wants to earn money in order to pay tuition and other school fees. Her husband, Christopher T., is helping her in their small business. Viclar admitted that her store is the only thing that sustains their family now. She started her business from her small savings of $75 for their livelihood.

She needs additional capital in her business. She is requesting a loan of $100 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy additional merchandise to sell.

CEVI is reaching out to more entrepreneurs like Viclar to sustain their business. They not only provide credit, but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy inventory for her store

loans.name: Esther Nakalema‘S Group

texts.en:
Esther is 36 years of age. She is married with four children aged 6 and 13 years, including a set of twins. All her children go to school. She rents a one-room house where she is staying with seven people. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has access to electricity and piped water at home. The family gets three meals a day.

Esther operates a retail shop in Mulago and that is how she earns a living. She doesn’t incur any transport expenses because she lives near her shop. Esther receives about 20 customers a day and sells to all categories of people on a retail basis. She works seven days a week. Her monthly expenses include the license for the business premises, rent for her home and business, feeding her family, and school fees.

Esther has been in this business for four years now. This is her first loan ever since she joined MCDT two weeks ago. Esther wants to use this loan to buy more home products for resale. She aspires to see her business grow bigger and also to start a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy more home products for her shop

loans.name: Ljubinka

texts.en:
Ljubinka comes from a suburb of Sarajevo. She is divorced and has one daughter who lives with her. Ljubinka has been re-selling clothing at the market in Sarajevo for a long time and her offering gets better from year to year. When she is not at the market, she sells out of her home. She is a young single mother who works hard to provide an easy and comfortable life for her daughter.

Ljubinka decided to take her first loan from WWI in the amount of 1200 KM to purchase summer clothes to re-sell.

loans.use: To buy clothing to re-sell

loans.name: Habiba Group

texts.en: Habiba is the group leader of the Habiba group, which has three members. They requested a loan of 28000 Afghan. They live in 15 Kabul, Afghanistan. Habiba and Abdull Ahmad want a loan to expand their fresh-fruit businesses. Najwa wants to take a loan for her business of tailoring. She wants to buy a new machine for her business. With this loan, they can all make their businesses grow to support their families and make a better future for themselves and for their families.

loans.use: To expand and progress their businesses

loans.name: Armandina

texts.es:
La socia ARMANDINA, es natural de la provincia de Calca  en el distrito de Huarán S/N, perteneciente a la ciudad del Cusco, sitiado a 1 hora y 30 minutos desde la misma ciudad.

Nuestra socia es casada, ella tiene 50 años de edad y tiene 4 hijos, el último de sus hijos que aún las acompaña tiene 23 años, ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con las manualidades, ella teje en todo tipo de lanas, y en macramé, diversos bolsos, gorros, sandalias, bufandas, chompas, guantes, y mucho más, la socia desea el préstamo para poder invertir en la compra de materiales y así tener mayor producción y mejorar sus ventas.

Nuestra socia agradece y valora la ayuda brindada en razón de que en el distrito donde la socia vive no se cuenta con la banca financiera. Ella se compromete a cumplir con el pago total de la deuda.
texts.en:
This member, Armandina, originates from the Calca province in the district of Huarán, part of the city of Cusco and located 1 ½ hours from the same. Our member is married, 50 years old, and has 4 children. The youngest of her children, who still lives with her, is 23 years old. She alternates her homemaking activities with creating handicrafts. She knits all types of yarns, macramé, different styles of purses, hats, sandals, scarves, sweaters, gloves, and many other items. The member wishes to receive a loan to invest in the purchase of raw materials so she can increase her production and, therefore, her sales. Our member gives thanks for and greatly values the help provided, particularly because in her region there are no financial institutions. She commits to repaying the loan in full.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for her knitted crafts.

loans.name: Khsang's Group

texts.en:
This small loan is being requested by three borrowers, all of whom live in Rolosh Commune in Siem Reap Province. The group leader, Khsang H., 53, is a widowed mother caring for four children who are students. She currently earns a living planting vegetable crops. All of her children also work by growing crops when they are not studying.

Since the crop business is a main source of family income, Khsang H. has requested a loan to grow different kinds of crops during this farming season.

The other two borrowers are N., who will be using part of the loan to buy a bicycle for her family and the rest to buy more fertilizer to improve her crop yield, and L., who is an internal staff member for a hotel and is asking for a loan to buy a bicycle to ride to work.

loans.use: To grow different kinds of crops during this farming season

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, beans, tortillas, shortening, churros, soft drinks, coffee, bread, crackers, candy, oil, toilet paper, milk, dairy products, meat, soup, pastas, soap, pills, salt

loans.name: Lealoaina

texts.en:
Lealoaina F.'s main source of income comes from planting and harvesting taro for sale. She is a 61-year-old woman living in the town of Vaovai. She is married and has 13 adult children. Lealoaina has been in this business for over four years and earns approximately 400 WST a month. (0) 

In 2009, Lealoaina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Lealoaina is requesting a loan for the first time from SPBD. Lealoaina is requesting a loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. Lealoaina plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia C. is  44 years old. She is married to Emmanuel Sr and they are blessed with five children.  Two of them have already graduated from college and three are still studying in a public school.  They live in the village of Isidro Paredes of Diffun Qurino province. The family has a good reputation  in the village. 

Farming is their major source of income. Ofelia maintains a mushroom project in their backyard. She earns income  from her mushroom production. Buyers buy her harvested products weekly in kilos at lower price so that they will also have income when they retail it to their customers. With the help of her husband, Ofelia is very grateful to have her business keep growing and by requesting additional business capital from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP 5,000 she hopes that she will generate more income from the business.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expenses for university study

loans.name: Fina

texts.es:
Fina tiene 38 años, vive con sus 3 hijos en L. casa D. sus padres. DesD. hace 11 años se dedica a L. elaboración y venta D. panes, para lo cual se levanta D. madrugada para que una vez que salgan del horno los distribuya a las diferentes tiendas y bodegas D. su comunidad. Es por ello que día a día se esfuerza para producir mayor cantidad D. panes y que sean del gusto D. las personas, para ello contrata a una persona especialista en L. elaboración D. panes, mientras que Fina supervisa todo el proceso. Su deseo a futuro es implementar su taller D. panificación con maquinaria moderna, ya que actualmente L. preparación es D. manera artesanal.   
Esta es L. sexta oportunidad en que tiene un préstamo con MFP y está muy contenta D. ser parte D. su banco comunal, por lo que se compromete, una vez más, a ser puntual en sus pagos. El dinero que solicita será utilizado en L. compra D.  los ingredientes necesarios para L. preparación D. los panes, como harina, levadura y manteca.
texts.en:
Fina, 38, lives with her three children in her parents’ house. For 11 years she has been making and selling bread. To do so she gets up a dawn so that once they come out of the oven she can distribute them to different stores and mini markets in her community. That is why she works so hard day to day to produce a larger quantity of bread that people will like. To do that she hires a specialist in making bread while Fina supervises the whole process. Her wish for the future is to set up a bread making shop with modern equipment. Currently the preparation is by hand. This is her sixth opportunity to have a loan with MFP. She is very happy to be part of her communal bank. She promises, once again, to be punctual in her payments. The money she is asking for is to buy ingredients she needs to make bread like flour, leavening, and shortening.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients for making bread

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel S. is from the village of Pandan, Gingoog City. She is 41 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children.

Maribel owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Maribel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

Maribel is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 


About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El señor Juan S. esta muy agradecido por su cooperación en el crédito anterior el cual pudo invertir en comprar mercancía.
Nueva mente esta solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar mercancía de invierno ya que no tiene suficiente y sus clientes le están pidiendo que venda ropa y zapatos para la temporada de frío. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias del negocio ya que tiene bajo su responsabilidad a dos hijos que están estudiando ya desea que terminen una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Juan S. is grateful for his previous loan which he used to buy merchandise. He is again asking for funds to buy Winter merchandise since he does not have enough inventory to meet his customers' needs who are requesting cold weather shoes and clothing. He plans to repay his loan with part of his business earnings since he has two children who are students and he wants them to become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy Winter merchandise.

loans.name: Marcia Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Marcia H. es una mujer emprendedora, con deseo de superación, ella es costurera y vende ropa variada, zapatos, sandalias, también hace varios años formo un grupo de danza con sus sobrinos que van a todos los eventos que los invitan, ella es la que hace los traje para el baile por que en cada participación le dan una ayuda económica lo cual comparte con los del baile una parte y la otra para comprar tela oh lo que haga falta. Ella va a comprar mercadería al mercado oriental ropa, tela, zapatos, chapas, adornos para el cabello. El cual vende al contado y al crédito,  entrega a las oficinas del banco y a sus clientas. Tiene 43 años de edad, de tres hijos solo uno tiene a su cargo de 16 años de edad, que esta cursando su secundaria. Los otros dos están casados. Cuando inicio su negocio lo hizo con dinero que su esposo dio y compro poca ropa y solo  trabajaba por encargo. La idea era poder ayudar  a su esposo a cubrir los gastos básicos de agua, luz ya que el trabaja como conductor y su salario es bajo. Con este préstamo invertirá  en la compra de materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro para comenzar a construir un cuarto e ir poco a podo terminarlo ya que todo esta caro. Da las gracias a la institución por el apoyo a mejorar su vida personal como en la inversión de su negocio.
texts.en:
Marcia H., 43, is an enterprising woman who wants to get ahead. She is a seamstress and sells assorted clothing, shoes, sandals. Also, a few years ago, she formed a dance troupe with her nieces and nephews and they perform wherever they are invited. She makes all the costumes for the dances and, with each performance's earnings, she shares part with each dance troupe member and part she uses to buy more fabric or whatever else is needed. She buys fabric, clothing, shoes, buttons, hair accessories at the east market which she then sells for cash or credit. She distributes to the bank's offices and to her customers. Of her three children, only a 16-year-old, who is a secondary school student, is still under her care. The idea here is to help her husband with basic household expenses like utilities since he works as a driver and his salary is low. With this financing she will buy building materials such as stone, sand and iron to begin to build a room and little by little finish it since materials are very expensive. She thanks the institution for the help given to improve her personal life and for investing in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stone, sand, cement and iron to build a room.

loans.name: Utkirjon

texts.en:
J. Utkirjon is 27 years old. He is married and has four daughters. Utkirjon uses his car to provide taxi services. He has been in this business for the last six years, and he has gained a rich experience on driving. Utkirjon always trys to provide high quality services at prices that are attractive to his customers. Utkirjon is doing his best to make his business stable and profitable because he is the main bread-winner in his large family. He is ready to work from early morning until late at night in order to keep his customers and to obtain new ones. Today his car needs thorough repairing, so he is requesting a loan of 3000 Somoni. He wants to purchase spare parts such as wheels, antifreeze, and other parts. Utkirjon thanks everyone for supporting him and promises to repay the loan in a timely manner. The well-being of this family is in your hands.    


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. Tajikistan has produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients have access to viable business opportunuties. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Buy spare parts for repairing his car

loans.name: Jargalsaihan

texts.en:
T. Jargalsaihan is 34 years old and lives with his 2-year-old son, Bold-Erdene, in Zavkhan province in western Mongolia. They live together in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Jargalsiakhan operates a carpet and construction materials business in his town. He opened for business in 2003 as a carpet distributor. He had early success selling carpet and his earnings enabled him to begin selling construction materials. Today, his business continues to grow quickly and he has a strong base of loyal customers. Ever since his wife's death two years ago, Jargalsaikhan has worked hard to manage his business and raise his son. He says, “I must save money to provide my son with a good future.” To continue his success, Jargalsiahan hopes to soon open an electronics and appliance store. He is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase electronic items and appliances to start his new business.

About XacBank
XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team: http://www.kiva.org/team/xacbank_mongolia

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here:http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&queryString=Mongolia&status=fundRaising&gender=All&sectors[]=All&regions[]=All&sortBy=Expiring+Soon

loans.use: To purchase electronic items and appliances to start his new business

loans.name: Aveina

texts.en:
Aveina T. is 40 and married with 1 child (8 years-old).  She owns a business venture, catching & selling ocean-caught fish .  Aveina has 3 years of experience in this business.  Aveina needs a loan of WST $1750 to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Aveina joined SPBD.  This is her 3rd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Aveina's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

Overall Social Metric Score provided by SPBD:*                1.9 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela was a little disappointed with her last harvest. She said that it was due to the weather that she was not able to achieve the harvest she aimed for. A 27-year-old married woman with three children, she works hard to ensure her farm will be productive at the next harvest.

Estela applied for a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI. This loan will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy refgrigerators to sell

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina T. is from the village of Tangaro, Catarman Camiguin Province. She is 60 years old. Josefina is married and has 5 adult children. Josefina owns & operates a food preparation/sales business; she sells mainly snacks, salads, and beverages to the local community. Josefina has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Josefina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Josefina is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make her products. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Josefina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients to make products for sale

loans.name: Odonchimeg

texts.en: Odonchimeg is 34 years old and lives in Tuv province, Mongolia. She and her daughter live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. They have have lived there for the past five years. During the day, she operates a retail meat business. In 2006, she rented a counter at a local market and started her business with a working capital of 200,000 tugrugs (~ 140 USD). After much hard work her working capital has grown to 2,300,000 tugrugs (~ 1618 USD). With her business profit, she purchased new furniture for her home this year. Odonchimeg pays attention to her daughter's education, and has used her profits to hire a private tutor for her daughter as a supplement to her secondary school lessons. Odonchimeg has great business experience from previous years and has loyal customers. Odonchimeg says: “I would like to expand my business and to purchase an apartment for me and my daughter.” She is requesting a 1,200,000 tugrug (~ 844 USD) loan to purchase a large amount of meat at wholesales price to resell for a profit.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of meat at wholesales price

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice sells groceries, foodstuffs and drinks at retail prices in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. She has been in this business for a very long time. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future. She is 35 years old and married with 2 children. She is an Ibo by tribe. Her husband also works to support their family. Eunice is a friendly and happy woman. She says her only challenge is lack of funds and she hopes to overcome this difficulty. She needs a loan of NGN 70,000 to purchase more groceries and foodstuffs to sell. She loves her business and family dearly and hopes to excel in life. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.
