loans.use: To purchase more groceries and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Nolie's Group

texts.en:
Nolie V. S. is from the village of Centro 3, Angadanan, Isabela. She is 42 years old. Nolie is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.
Nolie is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Nolie owns & operates a business a general store selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Nolie has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.
In 2008, Nolie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nolie is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Nolie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Felipe De Jesus

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Felipe De Jesus G. le está haciendo falta las protecciones en las puertas y ventanas.
Pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder pagarle a la persona que se encargar de realizar y colocar las protecciones. 
Ya que tiene paco tiempo se las acaban de entregar y no la han podido habitar por faltas de la seguridad de familia, ya que trabaja casi todo el día. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo en una fábrica en el área de producción,  ya que su esposa se encargara de los gastos familiares con el sueldo que recibe como mesera de un restaurante.

Las personas que aparecen en la foto es la esposa y los hijos del señor Felipe De Jesus G., ya que el se encontraba en su trabajo el día de la visita.
texts.en:
Felipe De Jesus G.’s house lacks protection on the doors and windows. But, he does not have the money he needs to be able to pay someone for the protections and to put them into place. He just got it a little while ago, and they have not been able to live in it due to the lack of family security because he has to work almost all day. He plans to pay the loan with the salary he receives from working in a factory in the area of production. He wife is in charge of the family expenses, which she pays with the salary she receives as a waitress in a restaurant. The people appearing in the photo are Felipe De Jesus G.’s wife and children. He was working on the day of the visit.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cost of placing protections on the doors and windows

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 33 years old and married with 2 children. His children are in primary school. He lives in Benin City. He sells fish to make a living. He has been in this business since 3 years

He needs the loan of NGN100,000 to purchase more of fish to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fabrics and other materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokha P. (pictured here), age 36 years old, is a widow with one son and two daughters. She lives along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penn, the capital city of Cambodia. 

Sokha has been operating a business selling jasmine flowers since she was young. She grows them on her own and buys some from her village and transports them to sell in Phnom Penh market. 

Sokha does not have enough capital to purchase jasmine flowers under contract for resale, so she is requesting her first loan in the amount of US$ 500 to increase her capital.

loans.use: To buy jasmine flowers under contract for resale

loans.name: Clely Esteher

texts.es:
doña Clely F. tiene 50 años de edad, vive en el barrio las Arenas de la ciudad de Choluteca, Clely se dedica a la venta de golosinas enfrente de una empresa empacadora de camarones. Clely es bien trabajadora, se lavanta todos los dias a las 4 de la mañana para preparar sus comidas y luego llevarla a vender, ademas  en sus tiempos libres se dedica a la crianza de gallinas en su casa de habitacion.  
Tiene una hija  que es la que le ayuda a preparar las comidas.
el prestamo lo utilizara para comprar mas materiales para fabricar sus golosinas ya que las ventas estan muy buenas y se queda rapido sin comida. las ganancias las necesita para cubrir con los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en:
Doña Clely F. is 50 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Las Arenas in the city of Choluteca. She sells sweets in front of a shrimp packing company. Clely is a good worker. She wakes up every day at 4am to prepare the foods that she will sell. During her free time, she raises chickens at home. Clely has a daughter who helps her with preparing food.

This loan will be used to buy more ingredients for making sweets. Her sales have been very good and she stays away from offering fast food. The income she generates is needed to cover her household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda es socia del Bancomunal Amaquella, es casada madre de 3 hijos, el primero tiene 23 años, la segunda tiene 20 años y la tercera tiene 15 años.
Yolanda se dedica a la venta de tara, cochinilla y cuero este negocio lo realiza desde hace 18 años, ella aprendió este oficio de sus padres, menciona que no tuvo ninguna dificultad en su negocio para la compra de estos productos ella viaja a distintas ferias en los lugares de Seccelambras, Acosvinchos, donde también van otros compradores pero la estrategia de ella para que le vendan estos productos es invitarles un pancito o refresco.
El sueño Yolanda es poder sacar profesionales a sus hijos, construir su casa, y poder tener una tienda de ferretería.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a member of the Amaquella Community Bank. She is a married mother of 3 children. The eldest son is 23, the second daughter is 20, and the third daughter is 15. Yolanda sells tara tree products, cochineal [a red dye], and leather. She has been in this business for 18 years, and learned it from her parents. She mentions that she did not have any difficulties in her business. To purchase these products, she travels to different markets in the areas of Seccelambras and Acosvinchos, where other buyers also go, but her strategy to get them to sell to her is to offer them a bread roll or a drink. Yolanda's dream is to be able to make her children professionals, build her house, and to be able to have a hardware store.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of tara tree products, cochineal [red dye] and leather

loans.name: Khadim Rassoul Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de Solidarité KHADIM RASSOUL est créé le 30 décembre 2009. Il fait partie du Banc Villageois de PALENE COKI. Il est composé de 30 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même village. Et se sont organisées par affinité. 

Le groupe a comme responsable Madame NDOUMBE S. W.. Elle se trouve debout à l'extrême droite de la photo. Elle est âgée de 56 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants. 

Elle fabrique et vend des jus de fruits naturels. Par ailleurs, elle fait de l'embouche ovine.

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra d'acheter des condiments pour la fabrique de ses jus de fruits naturels et d'acheter également 02  moutons.

Son objectif est de renforcer son niveau d'épargne et de participer à la prise en charge de la famille, par la nourriture et la santé.
texts.en:
Solidarity group KHADIM RASSOUL was created on December 30, 2009. It's part of the "Banc Villageois de PALENE COKI". It is composed of 30 women, all from the same village. They are grouped by affinity. Mrs. NDOUMBE S. W. is the head of the group. She's standing on the far right in the picture. She's 56 years old, married, and the mother of two children. She prepares and sells natural fruit juice. She also raises sheep. Her new loan will enable her to buy ingredients to prepare her natural fruit juices, and to buy two sheep. Her goal is to bolster her savings and to help paying her family's food and healthcare expenses.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients to prepare natural fruit juices, and to buy two sheep

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
This is Cecilia M., 60, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Leandro M., an analyst, and is the mother to a young, hardworking adult.

Cecilia operates a snack stall. She mainly sells "proven," sometimes also known as "chicken proven" or spelled "proben." According to Wikipedia, "proven" is “a type of street food popular in some regions of the Philippines. It consists essentially of the proventriculus (part of the stomach) of a chicken, dipped in cornstarch, and deep-fried. It is served either in a small bagful of vinegar, or skewered on bamboo sticks to be dipped in the vinegar just before it is eaten.” She also sells “palamig,” a kind of sweetened beverage with cut-up gelatin floating in the vanilla flavored drink. Her main customers are her neighbors and her immediate community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine pesos a day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php18,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, condiments and seasonings. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. Cecilia has been a member of Center for Community Transformation for five years now and regularly attends fellowship meetings. 

Cecilia dreams to be able to enjoy a peaceful and successful life through all her hard work on her business. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: Buy more quantities of products like meats, condiments and seasonings

loans.name: Gotitas De Amor Group

texts.es:
El Bancomunal Gotitas D. amor inicia su 6to ciclo con 16 socias.
Graciela tiene 8 meses en FINCA, primera vez que asume el cargo D. secretaria en la Junta Directiva D. su Bancomunal, le gusta la facilidad con la que recibe sus prestamos y el ahorro.
Graciela es conviviente, tiene casa propia donD. vive junto a sus 3 hijos D. 15, 12 y 7 años D. edad, todos están actualmente estudiando. Graciela se dedica a la venta D. productos naturales como BioLife, HerbaLife, Esika y Unique, ella ofrece a sus amigas y familiares al crédito, también lleva productos a la selva pero los venD. al contado. En la selva tiene chacras donD. siembra cacao, cosecha cuatro veces al año y el cacao lo venD. allá mismo. 
Su préstamo lo utilizará para la compra D. productos naturales y también ropa, pues desea incrementar la venta D. ropa en su negocio. 
El sueño D. Graciela es incrementar y hacer crecer su negocio y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The Gotitas D. Amor Community Bank is beginning its sixth loan cycle. Graciela is one of the sixteen members of the group and has been with Kiva partner FINCA for eight months. She is now taking on the role of Secretary to the Board of Directors of the bank for the first time. She enjoys the simplicity of obtaining loans and the opportunity to save money. Graciela is in a common-law marriage and lives in her own home with her three children aged 15, 12, and 7, all of whom are students. She earns her living by selling natural products from the brands BioLife, HerbaLife, Esika and Unique to her friends and relatives on credit. She also takes her products to communities in the rainforest and sells them on account. Graciela has land there too where she grows cocoa. She harvests it four times a year and then sells it. She plans to use her loan to buy more natural products as well as clothing as she wishes to expand her business and sell clothing too. Her dreams are to have a bigger business and to see her children in good jobs.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy natural products

loans.name: Lina

texts.en: Lina C. is a 53-year-old married woman who supports her family by selling kitchenware. She lives in Mojon, Tutay, Pinamungajan, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her kitchenware business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). Lina is now borrowing PHP 15,000 so that she can purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 11th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 26,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Lina aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable) way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team: http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: New kitchenware stock to sell

loans.name: Karina Katiuska

texts.es:
Karina es vendedora de productos para el hogar como electrodomésticos, accesorios y un poco de papelería. Vive en el suburbio de Guayaquil zona caracterizada porque sus habitantes son comerciantes informales. 

Para ayudar con los gastos familiares ya que su esposo era el único que trabaja ella tubo que comenzar a buscar una actividad que le generara ingresos, comenzó por vender ollas, platos plásticos, etc.   Poco a poco a tenido ingresos para solventar los gastos. Vende electrodomésticos, papelería a crédito para las personas que no pueden pagar la contado. 

Para seguir con su negocio ella quiere comprar sabanas, edredones, ollas arroceras para así tener mas oportunidades de venta. En el futuro quiere tener un almacén de electrodomésticos.
texts.en:
Karina sells household products such as electrical appliances, accessories, and some stationery.  She lives in the suburb of Guayaquil, a region characterized by inhabitants who are informal traders.    

Since her husband was the only one working, she had to begin looking for a business that would generate income to help with the family expenses
She began by selling “ollas: (rounded earthenware pots or jars, used especially for cooking or for carrying water), plastic plates, etc.  Little by little she has earned income to pay the expenses.  She sells electric appliances and stationery on credit for people who cannot pay cash.

In order to continue her business, she wants to buy sheets, comforters, “ollas” and rice cookers so she will have more opportunities for sales.  In the future, she wants to own an electrical appliance store.

loans.use: Electrical appliances, sheets, comforters.

loans.name: Lhaasuren

texts.en: Lhaasuren N. is 31 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Both of his daughters attend a local secondary school. Lhaasuren owns and operates a consumer goods retail business in his town. He started his business in 2007 by selling a variety of consumer goods in a rented stall at the "Undrah" trade center. Since then, his business was successful enough to purchase a container where his wife has been operating a retail clothing business. They have found success with both businesses and their working capital has reached 2,000,000 MNT today. His earnings have enabled him to purchase a fence and a car for his family as well as the container for his business. Lhaasuren is a very modest and hardworking man and is requesting a 700,000 MNT loan to purchase more inventory goods for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory goods

loans.name: Sarmila

texts.en:
This is 28-year-old Sarmila N.. She is married and has one child, aged nine. In 2000, she established her metal utensil workshop business. Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid one loan from Patan BPW, which was used to buy raw materials for her work. In the future, Sarmila plans to raise the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.   

Nepal has a long and rich history of traditional handicrafts.  Throughout the Kathmandu Valley, skilled artisans produce unique pieces of art that reflect Nepal's cultural diversity. Terracotta pottery comes from the red clay of the surrounding Himalayan foothills. Bronze and silver statuettes are formed using wax molds and intricate hand-tool finishing. In Patan, Newari culture and traditions are reflected in the images and symbols etched into metal or formed in stone. With the help of a Kiva loan, Nepal's artisans are able to purchase raw materials in greater volume. This increase in volume allows a single artisan to work on several pieces at the same time, while increasing her profit margin.

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her work

loans.name: Family Care Group

texts.en:
Mariama T. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Mariama was born in Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. She is 29 years of age and married to a salaried worker. The couple has two children who are attending primary school. For seven years now, Mariama has been selling clothes, slippers, hair extensions, etc. 

This is the first loan that Mariama and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and, consequently, improve their living conditions. Mariama will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to expand her business. She will buy the above-mentioned items at wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: To buy clothes, slippers, hair extensions, etc.

loans.name: Faustinah Syombua

texts.en:
Faustinah is a 35 years old married woman and a mother of two children, aged 5 years and 10 years. She lives in Makueni which is a rural- urban centre. She has a stall where she sells new clothes and especially men's wear. This is her primary business which she has been doing for a number of years now.

Her clients are mainly the residents of Wote, which is near Makueni town. She got to know about KADET through a friend who was already a member. She has never borrowed from other financial institutions. 

With this loan that she has applied for, she plans to add more stock by buying items like; shirts, trousers, and t-shits to be able to meet the demand for her clothes in the month of December which is normally a peak season.

loans.use: To restock her shop with more clothes like shirts, trousers etc

loans.name: Chinara

texts.en:
Chinara S., a 42-year-old married mother of three children, lives with her family in Chat-Kul village. Her husband works as a railwayman.

In rural areas, where salaries are low and often unstable, it’s very hard to live, so in order to support her family and find an additional income, Chinara started her business in cattle breeding and beet cultivating, using her initial capital of 25,000 KGS. Owing to her persistent and hardworking personality, Chinara achieved success and used the revenues to pay for her elder daughter’s education.

Currently, Chinara’s farm consists of four milk cows and still needs to be developed. For this reason, she is applying for a loan of 60,000 KGS to buy more cattle. With the revenues from the loan, she plans to give a good education to her school-going children.

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Juana Antonia

texts.es: Juana Antonia se dedica es la venta de mercadería en general hace mas de 21 años que tiene este medio de vida. Ella es una persona muy responsable y disfruta de su actividad. Esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos, por lo que han sido de mucha ayuda para su actividad. Juana tiene varios clientes que le solicitan diferentes pedidos, es por eso que solicita financiamientos para realizar la compra de materia prima variada.
texts.en: Juana Antonia has sold general merchandise for more than 21 years. She is very responsible and enjoys her work. This is not the first time she takes out a loan. They have been a great help in the past. Juana has many clients that make many orders which is why she is requesting the loan to buy more merchandise.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel K. B. is a 47 year old man, married to Suphilina Sang and together they have four children. His wife buys and sells clothes and therefore adds income to the family. Samwel is a shop keeper and milk seller and his businesses are in Ngenyilel in the outskirts of Eldoret. He has been in this business for six years now and gets a monthly income of fifteen thousand shillings.

This will be Samwel's Second loan with KADET and he continues to say that he did not have any problems in repaying the first loan but rather he made profits which enabled him to repay the first loan well. With this current loan he plans to add stock to his retail shop business with items like rice, sugar, milk and other fast moving shop items.He is pictured here transporting goods. 

In future Samwel wants to own a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To add stock like buy sugar, milk, rice for resale

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia V. is married and has four adult children. 

To make a living, Cecilia owns and operates a "lapida" (epitaph) making business, providing tombstone engraving services to local community members. Cecilia has been in business for more than ten years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2004, Cecilia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. 

Cecilia is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used as additional working capital. This will be the 11th loan taken out by Cecilia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: To be used as additional working capital

loans.name: Ayda

texts.en:
Ayda is a beauty salon owner from Jabalia refugee camp in Gaza Strip.  Ayda is married and taking care of her parents; neither of her parents is capable of working due to their age and poor health. Ayda started this business four years ago and now she has a good number of customers.

Ayda took a loan from FATEN to purchase creams, equipment and supplies and repair the salon--painting the walls and using the free space she has to offer more services.

Ayda appears in the picture in her salon.

loans.use: Purchase beauty salon equipment and supplies and repair the store

loans.name: Ronald Antonio

texts.es:
Ronald es soltero escogió esta actividad ya que estudiaba en la universidad y al ver que en el sitio faltaba un lugar para sacar copias y comprar útiles de oficina decidió ahorrar y realizar un préstamo para comprar una copiadora y una guillotina para realizar encuadernados y asi sacar copias  a los estudiantes de dicha universidad. 

Trabaja de lunes a viernes de 8:00am hasta las 6:00pm y los sábados hasta las 2 de la tarde realiza todo tipo trabajo de copias , además de encuadernación , em plastificación y anillados de folletos y lo complementa con la venta de útiles de oficina a veces recibe la ayuda de sus hermanos cuando él tiene que asistir a clases .

Con el préstamo va a comprar paquetes de hojas útiles de oficina copiadora a color
La meta de Ronald es terminar sus estudios universitarios, además de expandir su negocio al cual desea implementar el servicio de internet para las investigaciones de los estudiantes de la universidad
texts.en:
Ronald is single.  He chose this activity because while studying at the university he noticed that there wasn’t any place there to make copies and buy office supplies.  He decided to save up and take out a loan to buy a copying machine and a paper guillotine in order to make bindings and copies for the students at said university.

He works Monday through Friday from 8am until 6pm and on Saturdays until 2pm.  He makes all kinds of copies but also binds books, laminates and creates three-ring binders.  He complements this with the sale of office supplies.  When he has to attend classes his siblings help him out with the business. He will use the loan to buy reams of paper, office supplies and a color copier.

Ronald’s goal is to complete his university studies and expand his business where he wants to install Internet access so that the university students can do their research.

loans.use: For paper and a copying machine.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua E. lives in Abee near Elmina with her husband and two children. Every day she walks the streets of her community to sell cosmetics and other items which she carries around on her head in a large bowl. Ekua uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.  She would like to use the money from the loan to expand her business. Her plan is to buy more goods and satisfy more customers. By investing she promises herself an increased profit. She wants to save some of the money she will make to provide her children the opportunity to enjoy a good education.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell.

loans.name: Samahani

texts.en:
Samahani S. A. is a 39-year-old lady and a single mother of four children. She runs a poultry business in Likoni and has been in this business for the last year getting good returns.
  
This is Samahani’s first loan from KADET Ltd. and she plans to buy two hundred chickens and two sacks of feed. She anticipates profits which she will use to renovate her rental houses. 

Samahani’s dream is to become a successful business lady and to be able to comfortably provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy two hundred birds and two sacks of feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, underwear, dresses, lotions, and creams.

loans.name: Keziah

texts.en:
Keziah W. M. is forty-one years old, married, and they have four children aged between twenty-nine years old and ten years old. Her business is located at an area in Nairobi called Waithaka. 

Her business is well known by the name Soko-Satelite. She sells shoes to the local people a business she has engaged in for the last six years. She has managed to provide employment to two people. She says that this business is profitable and the only major challenge she has is financial constraints. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. 

She is using her loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more shoes to grow her business and meet the demand by her customers. In future, she hopes to grow her business to wholesale. She describes herself as a visionary lady.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to grow her business.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is 34 years old and the father of two daughters and three sons. Khaled was working in a coffee and nuts roasting house. Khaled wanted to start his own business as he has the experience and has saved enough money to rent a place, prepare it to launch the roasting house and start distributing to shops in the city.

Khaled took out a $3,000 loan from FATEN to purchase nuts and coffee grains needed to launch the business that he has been working on for the last 13 months. Khaled, who appears in the picture here, will be able to have a better income after starting his own business.

loans.use: to purchase nuts and coffee grains to launch a coffee-roasting house

loans.name: Yousef

texts.en:
Yousef is a 27-year-old ambitious man, who couldn't find a job in the field he studied so he opened a barber shop. Yousef has been a barber for four years now. He wants to purchase creams and hair products to attract more customers so he took out the loan from FATEN, expecting to improve his financial situation.

Yousef appears in the picture here in the barber shop.

About this loan product:

FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending help text: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m

loans.use: To purchase creams and hair products to use in the shop.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 43 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Analiza has been raising pigs for 20 years and also earns additional income from manicure/pedicure and weaving. 

Analiza is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional pigs and feed.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs and feed.

loans.name: Fotemogoban  B Group

texts.fr:
FOTEMOGOBAN B est un regroupement de  10 femmes toutes mariées, qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 30  ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. EIles vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à KAPALA, un village situé à environ 17 km de la ville de SIKASSO 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Ces clientes sont à leur premier cycle de prêt de campagne afin de satisfaire leurs besoins en moyen de production et en intrant agricole. Ce groupe de femme fait la culture du pois du sucré, du maïs, d’arachide  comme les autres femmes du village. 
NAHAWA, qui est assise en troisième position, autrement dit assise au milieu,  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 2 sacs d’urée, 1 sac de complexe céréale et le reste comme frais de labour car elle a à sa disposition des bras valide pour les activités de sarclage.
Après les récoltes  sont stockées pendant une certaine période avant d’être vendues à des clients venant un peu de partout de la région de Sikasso. Le pois est surtout vendu à des industrielles qui le transforme en jus pour la vente sur place et pour l’exportation. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 30.000 à 45 000 FCFA qui seR. utilisé  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
FOTEMOGOBAN B est un regroupement de  10 femmes toutes mariées, qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 30  ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. EIles vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à KAPALA, un village situé à environ 17 km de la ville de SIKASSO 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Ces clientes sont à leur premier cycle de prêt de campagne afin de satisfaire leurs besoins en moyen de production et en intrant agricole. Ce groupe de femme fait la culture du pois du sucré, du maïs, d’arachide  comme les autres femmes du village. 
NAHAWA, qui est assise en troisième position, autrement dit assise au milieu,  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 2 sacs d’urée, 1 sac de complexe céréale et le reste comme frais de labour car elle a à sa disposition des bras valide pour les activités de sarclage.
Après les récoltes  sont stockées pendant une certaine période avant d’être vendues à des clients venant un peu de partout de la région de Sikasso. Le pois est surtout vendu à des industrielles qui le transforme en jus pour la vente sur place et pour l’exportation. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 30.000 à 45 000 FCFA qui seR. utilisé  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.

loans.use: Achat d’intrants et payer les frais de labours

loans.name: Trinitas

texts.en:
Trinitas is 59 years old. She is separated from her husband and has seven children. 

Trinitas has a shop that buys and sells bananas. She has had this business for five years.  She requested a loan for 7,000 PHP to finance her buying and selling business.

Trinitas has been a member of HSPFI for five years. In the future, Trinitas hopes to expand her business for the benefit of her children.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell

loans.name: Naseeran's Group

texts.en:
Naseeran is a widow; she lost her husband as a result of a sudden death. It was a very difficult time for her, but she never lost heart and worked very hard to raise her children. Now her children have become young [adults] and started work. Unfortunately she couldn’t provide her sons education so they remain illiterate. 

Her eldest son has a motorbike showroom business. The second one has a hosiery business and the third one operates a canteen in a nearby school. Her daughter is a student.  

Naseeran has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Asasah for her son who wants to buy another motorbike for his showroom. This will help him expand his business and earn more profits. He has been doing this business for the past eight years and Naseeran is confident that an investment will help him increase his profits by expanding his business. She is a regular client of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In previous loan years, she has proved herself a very responsible client by paying her installments on time and by attending every meeting.

loans.use: to buy another motorbike for a motorbike showroom business.

loans.name: Gorethe

texts.en:
Gorethe is a 30-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur. She has three children between the ages of 2 and 12 years old and her husband works as a driver.

For the past 12 years, she has been running a business selling green bananas.  This business has enabled her to build a house and feed her children.

She requires this loan to buy one ton of bananas that she will sell for a profit.

With the future profits she will earn, she plans to pay the school fees for her children and hopefully accumulate savings.

loans.use: to purchase green bananas to sell

loans.name: Saida

texts.en:
Saida is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge is seasonality, especially in her business. She dreams of expanding her clothes business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 57-year-old married woman with six children. The oldest child is 34 years old and the youngest is 17.

Ruth and her husband are both farmers. They own the land that they till to plant rice and cassava. According to Ruth, they sell their harvest at her town's market. With their income from farming, they are able to buy their daily needs and send their youngest child to school.

Ruth is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes to achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a very hard working woman who has been practicing mixed farming for over five years.  She is 28 years old, married to Mike, who is also a farmer.  They have two children. 

Caroline is applying for her first loan and plans to use the amount to buy farm inputs . She intends to use the additional income from the proceeds of this loan, to buy cattle for fattening and to pay her child's school fees. She hopes to develop her business and be financially stable in the future

loans.use: to buy buy farm inputs like manure, wheat and maize seedlings

loans.name: Ruzigul

texts.ru: Рузигул занимается купля продажей продукты питания. Она разведена и у неё 4 детей. Она сама кормит своих детей с помощью данного бизнеса. Ей тяжело содержит свою семью в хороших условиях. Она продает ежедневные продуты такие как масло, сахар, макароны, напитки, а также порошок, носки мыло и т.д. Рузигул хочет расширить свой бизнес и с этой целью запрашивает займ в размере 2000$ США. Она заранее благодарна всем кредиторам за их помощь и поощрения.
texts.en: Ruzigul is involved in buying and selling food products.  She is divorced and has four children.  She supports her children by herself with the help of this business.  It is difficult for her to provide good conditions for her family.  Ruzigul sells everyday products, such as oil, sugar, pasta, drinks and also detergent, socks, soap, etc.  Ruzigul wants to expand her business and is requesting a loan in the sum of $2000 for this purpose.  She is grateful to all creditors in advance for their help and support.

loans.use: to purchase food products

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman with two children who are ten and fourteen years old.  She runs a retail shop in a Nairobi market where she sells sugar, flour, rice, beverages, detergent, and other items.  Jane says that her business is profitable and the major challenge she has is one of financial constraints.  However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. 

Jane is using her loan of Kes 50,000 to buy more general items to expand her retail business.  She hopes to be a wholesaler in future.  She is very hardworking and honest.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, rice, beverages, detergent, and other items to sell at her retail shop.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Amelita works hard to support her family.

She has a grinding machine business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Amelita is borrowing PHP 49,500 through NWTF to purchase more coconuts for her business.

Amelita has sustained her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to achieve her dream of saving money to expand her business and to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more coconuts for her business.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario de 31 años de edad, vive en su casa propia con su esposa e hijos, la cual cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.   Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

Rosario desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral (ovejas y vacas), sus corrales se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los cuales son apropiados y amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para poderlos ofrecer en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos familiares.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1200 nuevos soles  para la compra de más animales y su respectivo alimento, con las ganancias que obtenga con la venta de sus animales podrá cubrir su crédito como tener una mejor calidad de vida para su familia.  Rosario es una persona que con esfuerzo y mucho empeño a sabido sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Rosario is 31 years old. He lives in his own house with his wife and children. The house has only electric service, and it is located in the rural part of the district of Tambogrande, which is part of the department of Piura. People in this area work in agriculture, ranching and handicraft production. 

For the past several years, Rosario has worked raising and selling farm animals (sheep and cows). His enclosures are behind his house, and they are large and appropriate. He feeds the animals balanced commercial feed and natural grasses, so that they achieve optimal growth. He is then able to offer them for sale at the various markets in the area, obtaining good earnings so that he can cover his family's expenses. 

He has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1200 Peruvian new soles, to buy more animals and the appropriate feed for them. With the earnings he obtains from selling his animals, he will be able to pay off his loan while also providing his family with a better quality of life. Rosario is a person who has found ways to help his family get ahead, with much effort and dedication.

loans.use: to buy more animals and appropriate feed for them.

loans.name: María Elida

texts.es:
La  Señora María Elida, tiene 35 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos, ella reside en  la Comunidad del Triunfo de la Cruz en  el Municipio de Tela, Atlántida.
Vive con sus 4 hijos, su madre y un hermano. La actividad económica a que se dedica es a la venta de ropa usada. 
Ella inicio su negocio con el apoyo de un familiar que le enviaba ropa usada desde Los Estados Unidos. Luego con las ganancias comenzó a comprar más ropa para la venta.
Doña Maria Elida ha solicitado un prestamos para continuar con su negocio, ella piensa comprar un fardo de ropa variada (camisetas, ropa de niños, blusas, etc.) y así poder ofrecer variedad a sus clientes.
Se siente motivada a seguir trabajando para ayudar a su familia, apoyar el estudio de sus hijos y surtir bien su negocio.
texts.en:
María Elida, age 35, is a single mother with four children.  She lives in the Triunfo de la Cruz community in the Tela municipality, Atlántida.  She lives with her four children, her mother, and a brother.  She sells used clothes.

She started her business with the help of a relative who sent her used clothes from the United States.  She later used her income to buy more clothes to sell.

María Elida has requested a loan to continue with her business.  She plans to buy a bundle of various clothes (shirts, children’s clothes, and blouses, etc.).  That way she will be able to offer her customers variety.

She is motivated to continue working in order to help her family, to support her children’s education, and to stock her business well.

loans.use: to buy a bundle of used clothes.

loans.name: Mario Dieter

texts.es: El  señor Mario es cliente antiguo  ingreso  a la institución en el año 2005, siendo un cliente responsable y puntual en sus pagos hasta el momento, el cliente tiene la profesión de odontólogo, soltero  que vive en casa familiar de  sus papas,  el señor Mario se encarga  de  los gastos familiares y   el crédito  lo  invertirá  en la compra de  medicamentos que le ofrecen  de oferta para su consultorio donde atiende a varios clientes ya que es muy conocido por el buen trabajo que realiza,  el siente feliz por la confianza que le brinda la institución nuevamente.
texts.en:
Mario is a longstanding customer who joined the institution in 2005 and has been a responsible client, punctual in his payments, ever since. He works as a dental surgeon, is single, and lives in his parents' house. Mario is in charge of his family's expenses and will use his loan to buy medicine that he can put on sale at his office, where he sees several clients, since he is very well-known for the good work he does. 

He feels happy because of the trust the institution has shown him once again.

loans.use: to buy medicine for his dental office

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana, de 54 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora, además de muy alegre y sociable, está casada con Jairo, fruto de esa unión tuvo cinco hijos que ya son mayores de edad y tienen sus familias. Ya no viven con ella, pero la visitan muy seguido. La actividad que realiza Juana es la venta de abarrotes y gaseosas, para eso abrió en su propia casa una bodega y fuente de soda, en donde atiende a  sus clientes, iniciándose con un capital propio y los créditos recibidos de sus proveedores desde hace 30 años, logrando hacer crecer su negocio a base de esfuerzo y dedicación, encargándose sola a la atención de sus clientes ya que su esposo realiza viajes por su trabajo.Lo que le gusta de su actividad es que con el fruto de sus ganancias logró apoyar a su pareja que es operador de maquinaria pesada, a brindarle una mejor calidad de vida  y educación de sus hijos que son su orgullo, además de sentirse una mujer productiva y estar ocupada. Por lo contrario, lo que no le gusta es que algunos de sus clientes  le piden créditos, a lo que ella se niega porque ya tuvo malas experiencias con ese tema, y viendo que tiene una regular cliente, considera que no es necesario incursionar en ese tipo de venta. Por otra parte, comenta que no tiene muchos gastos en su hogar, por eso solo tiene planes de mantener su negocio. Este será el préstamo número 5 con la institución MFP, se siente cómoda y a gusto con el apoyo financiero para avanzar en su negocio, por eso se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en créditos anteriores. Además se siente a gusto con su grupo, ya que los considera personas responsables y solidarias. Con el monto solicitado de 2000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería, como productos en general al por mayor, gaseosas a precios más cómodos, para así tener mayores márgenes de ganancias.
texts.en:
54-year-old Juana is a hard-working and entrepreneurial woman.  She is also very cheerful and sociable.  She is married to Jairo and the couple have five children who are now adults and have their own families.  They no longer live with Juana but visit her very often.  

Juana's business is selling groceries and soda.  She opened a grocery store and small diner in her home where she serves her customers.  She started out with her own capital and some loans from her suppliers 30 years ago.  She managed to grow her business through her hard work and commitment.  She serves her customers on her own as her husband travels a lot with his work.  What Juana likes about her business is that the profits she makes have enabled her to support her husband, who is a heavy machinery operator.  She has also provided her children, who are her pride and joy, with a better quality of life and an education.  She also feels like a productive woman and enjoys being busy.  On the contrary, what Juana does not like about her work is that some of her customers ask to buy on credit which she does not allow because she has had bad experiences with this.  As she has a regular customer base, she sees no reason to provide this kind of service.  Juana tells us that she does not have many household expenses and so her only plans are to keep her business running.

This will be Juana's fifth loan from MFP.  She feels comfortable and happy with the financial support that she receives which allows her to make progress in her business.  For this reason, she pledges to make her repayments on time as she has with her previous loans.  Juana feels happy to be a member of her community bank as she considers them all to be responsible and supportive people.  She will use the sum of 2,000 soles that she has requested to invest in buying merchandise, such as general products, wholesale.  She will also buy sodas at more affordable prices.  This will allow her to enjoy a better profit margin.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products, and soda

loans.name: Felicita Del Socorro

texts.es:
Perfil del Cliente 	En el municipio de Quezalguaque en León, la señora Felicita se ha desempeñado como maestra de primaria desde hace 25 años habiendo adquirido muchísima experiencia en este trabajo ya que le apasiona mucho enseñar a los niños. Ella es casada y con un hijo al que tiene que proporcionarle las condiciones necesarias para sus estudios.

Doña Felicita atraviesa una dificultad y es que  requiere mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda ya que quiere seguirla mejorando, por lo que ha tomado la decisión de acudir a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción comocemento, pintura, rodo, arena, mano de obra y transporte pues su sueño es tener una casa muy bonita y al iniciar esta obra de construcción logrará este objetivo. 

Iniciará realizando las mejoras en la casa por medio del rellenado y pintando, para así dejar mas bonita su casa y de esa manera crearle mejores condiciones e imagen, ya que también es una vivienda productiva porque habita en la misma y tiene una pulpería como otros ingresos.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Quezalguaque in León, Sra. Felicita has worked as an elementary school teacher for the past 25 years. She has acquired plenty of experience in her job and is very passionate when she teaches the children. Felicita is married and has one child, who she tries to provide the necessary conditions for his studies.

Doña Felicita is going through some difficulty and needs to improve the conditions in her home. She wants to proceed with these improvements, so she made the decision to approach CEPRODEL and request a loan to buy construction materials such as cement, paint, rollers, sand, as well as pay for labor and transportation costs. Her dream is to have a beautiful house, so her goal is to get the construction work started.

She will start the improvements to her house by plastering and painting. This will spruce up her house and give it a better condition and appearance. In addition to living there, Felicita’s home is also a productive place since she also has store to generate additional income.

loans.use: to pay for materials, labor, and transportation costs associated with her home improvements.

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel is a 35-year-old, married man with three children. For three years, he has been working as a wheat farmer; during that time, he has had good harvests.

He is now applying for his second loan through KADET ltd, which he will use to buy wheat seeds and to prepare his land for additional farming activities. With the profits he expects to generate as a result of this loan, he plans to pay for his children's school fees.

He has dreams of becoming a prominent farmer. He explains that he is an assiduous man who works hard to succeed despite the fact that he has very limited resources.

loans.use: To purchase wheat seeds and to improve his land

loans.name: Paola Alaxandra

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Florón de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Renacer.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Paola, ella tiene  33 años de edad, está separada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 11 y 3 años, la mayor estudian en colegio, ella en la actualidad vive en casa de sus padres.

Ella es una muy buena madre que para que a sus hijos no les falte nada se dedica al comercio, vende productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días de la semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días, lo que más vende son los perfumes y la bisutería ya que son muy buenos.  Lleva más de 1  año con su negocio y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y sobretodo los productos que están de oferta y aprovechar las ventas para la temporada que se avecina. Lleva cuatro ciclos en el Banco Comunal  y le gusta por los beneficios que le da el banco.
 
Su sueño es que a sus pequeños hijos no les falte nada ya que por eso lucha todos los días.
texts.en:
In the fortress El Florón of the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known since many years as the city of the real tamarinds, the associates of the “Reborn” Communal Bank gather every fifteen days.  

In this place we find señora Paola.  She is 33 years of age.  She is separated and has two children ages 11 and 3 years.  The oldest child attends school.  She currently lives in her parents’ home.  

She is a very good mother who is dedicated to commerce so that her children lack nothing.  She sells Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and accessories for ladies).  She works three days of the week.  She sells her products on credit and collects every eight days.  The perfumes and costume jewelry are her best sellers, since they are very good.  She has carried out this business for more than 1 year and it goes very well.  

This loan will be used to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and above all the products that are being offered to take advantage of the sales for the season that approaches.  She has had four loans with the Communal Bank and she likes the benefits that the bank gives her.  Her dream is that her small children lack nothing and for this she strives every day.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Ginelba

texts.es:
La señora Ginelba solicita el crédito para la compra de juguetes (muñecas, autos, pelotas, transformers) y también para la compra de parlantes para computadoras, para variar su mercadería y ofrecerla a su clientela. Ginelba es casada, tiene un hijo y vive en casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona Norte de la ciudad de La Paz. 
Es la octava vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la sexta con Kiva.
texts.en: Ginelba is asking for the loan to buy toys (dolls, cars, balls, transformers) and also to buy speakers for computers to vary her merchandise and offer it to customers.  Ginelba is married and has a son.  She lives in her parents’ house located the city of La Paz’s Norte zone.  This is the 8th time she’s worked with IMPRO and the 6th with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy children's toys and computer speakers to sell.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 50 years old and lives in Conat, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with four children. 

Lilia has a fish vending business and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase more fish to sell. 

Lilia has been a member of PMPC for a month.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Perveen is a sewing expert. Her family appreciates her for supporting them and working so hard to make their financial life easier. 

Her husband is a fruit seller and sells seasonal fruits in the market. 

Perveen is a mother of a son and a daughter. Both of them are young and stay at home. 

She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for further improvement of her sewing business. 
With the loan investment she will buy a new sewing machine and clothes for improve her work quality and income. 

She is very experienced and has a good number of clients in her community who give her regular orders. She is confident about her business's further growth as a result of loan investment.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for sewing business

loans.name: Arizal

texts.en:
Arizal is a son of Komida clients, and he is a student in Islam An-Nur Vocational high school where he takes the mechanical speciality. 

He comes from a poor family, but, if he is funded by a loan from Komida, he believes that he can continue his education and can achieve his dream.

loans.use: pay the cost of secondary school

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase Capital

loans.name: Azer

texts.en:
Azer works in exchange. He is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Khodjali region. He has settled in  Khirdalan settlement, is married and has 2 children.
In the beginning of his business he borrowed $300 to buy apparatus for counting money.
The second loan of $600 he spent to do capital repairs in his office.
Now he needs a loan of $1000 to buy additional apparatus. 
Azer has run this business for 5 years.

loans.use: To buy additional apparatus

loans.name: Scholastica

texts.en: Scholastica has eight children. She has been doing sewing to eke out a living for her family. Her husband has no job. She recently joined the SPBD microfinance program with the hope that she can buy a new sewing machine (to replace her old one) and purchase additional clothing material so she can earn more from her sewing business. With her determination and hard work she intends to grow her sewing business if given the opportunity to improve what she has now.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine and clothing material

loans.name: Verónica Isabel

texts.es:
Veronica is married and has three children, 8, 9 and 12 years of age. Veronica's father was left unemployed four years ago and in order to obtain an income that would permit an way out of his debts he began with the sale of ears of corn and snacks, in which he relied on Veronica's help; after her father left the business and she continued in order to help her husband with the expenses of their home. When they started they had very few products but Veronica has been increasing her stock and received good response from her clientele.

In order to continue growing with her business Veronica asks for a loan of $375 that will be used in the purchase of merchandise and in publicity in order to improve the quality of service offered, to make herself known in the neighboring housing developments and increase her sales; she firmly promises to pay back this amount in six months. Give Veronica the opportunity to grow; form part of her success; she and her family will thank you greatly for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

Verónica es casada y tiene tres hijos, de 8, 9 y 12 años de edad. El padre de Verónica quedó desempleado hace cuatro años y para obtener un ingreso que le permitiera salir de sus deudas comenzó con la venta de elotes y botanas, en donde contaba con la ayuda de Verónica, después su padre salió del negocio y ella continuó para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar. Cuando empezaron tenían muy pocos productos pero Verónica ha ido incrementando su surtido ha recibido buena respuesta de sus clientes.

Para continuar creciendo con su negocio Vero solicita un préstamo de $ 375 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía y en publicidad para mejorar la calidad del servicio que ofrece, darse a conocer entre las colonias cercanas e incrementar sus ventas, sella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Dale a Vero la oportunidad de crecer, forma parte de sus logros, ella y su familia agradecen mucho tu ayuda.

loans.use: The purchase of merchandise and publicity for her snack stand.  Compra de mercancía y publicidad

loans.name: Blanca Petra

texts.es:
Bianca is a hard-working woman with a 12-year-old son. Sadly, her husband died shortly after their son was born. Out of the necessity to keep her family moving forward and provide for her son, Blanca, as an enterprising woman, opened her own convenience store. She started with few products, but thanks to her nose for sales and the good service she provides she soon was successful in increasing her selection.

Currently, Blanca is requesting a loan of $925, which she will use to increase her supplies and meet her clients' demands. She plans to repay the loan within four months. Today you can help those who need it most and be a part of Blanca's success. Thank you for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Blanca es una mujer muy trabajadora y tiene un hijo de 12 años de edad, lamentablemente su esposo murió al poco tiempo de haber nacido su hijo. Ante la necesidad de sacar adelante a su hijo y darle los cuidados necesarios, como Blanca es una mujer emprendedora, inició su propio negocio con la venta de abarrotes, comenzó con muy poca inversión pero gracias a su gusto por las ventas y al buen servicio que ofrece pronto logró incrementar la variedad de productos que ofrece.

En estos momentos Blanca necesita un préstamo de $ 925 dólares que se compromete a regresar en 4 meses, con esto espera poder surtir mejor su negocio y cubrir todas las necesidades de sus clientes. Hoy puedes ayudar a quien más lo necesita, forma parte de los logros de Blanca, muchas gracias por tu apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase supplies

loans.name: Sandra Del Rosario

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Sandra del Rosario and my main activity is producing and selling "Baleadas" (a sort of pancake). My business is located in a gas station and I've been doing this for 2 years now. It allows me to contribute with the expenses of my family and to honour the commitments with the suppliers. Nowadays, my priority is to purchase a bigger tent and a table because the demand is growing every day and the space is pretty small.

Translated from Spanish by Augusto Salazar, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola Mi nombre es Sandra del Rosario, mi actividad principal es la elaboración y venta de Baleadas ( productos para consumo humano), ubicado en una de las gasolineras de mi ciudad, cuento con 2 años de experiencia en este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para contribuir con los gastos de mi familia y otros compromisos con los proveedores, actualmente mi prioridad en la compra de una carpa mas grande y una mesa ya que cada dia la demanda es mayor y el espacio es muy pequeño.

loans.use: Purchase of a tent, a table, flour, butter and chicken.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mrs. Sok S., age 26, sells fish at a market, earning around $2 per day of profit. Her husband, age 30, works as a fisherman to supply the fish his wife sells at the market. He also climbs palm trees to tap the sap to make palm sugar. They have two children, one who is a student and one who is too young to attend school. She would like to request a loan of $200 in order to purchase additional firewood in order to boil the palm sap to make palm sugar to sell in the market. Previously, they sold the sap to someone else to make the sugar, making a very small margin of profit. With the firewood, they can move up the production line and receive retail prices for the palm sugar themselves, earning an additional $2 per day.

loans.use: To purchase firewood to make palm sugar.

loans.name: Gavhar

texts.en:
Tajiboeva Gavhar is a 53-year old lady. Gavhar and her husband, who is a driver, have been married for almost 30 years and raised three wonderful children. Two of them are already married and have the children of their own who adore their grandparents. 
Gavhar has been running her own small business for 25 years already. She has a store selling shampoos, detergents, toothpaste and brushes and other items. Her youngest daughter helps her in the store registering the stock and serving the clients. Gavhar and her daughter are very friendly and polite which allows them to attract the clientele. 
Now she is requesting 1000 US dollars. Gavhar is planning to spend the loan for purchasing more goods for selling, thus increasing the range of the products. Gavhar promises to pay her loan in 12 months and thanks everybody who decided to support her.

loans.use: Purchasing of additional home products in order to sell them and increase the  range of goods

loans.name: Alla

texts.en:
Alla has her own small manufacturing and sales business. She makes bedding material and other things and then sells them in her kiosk at one of the busy markets in Kharkiv, eastern Ukraine. Alla has been doing this for about five years and her business has become quite successful. Her recent profit in a typical month has been around $1700. Alla is married and has one son.

Alla has requested a loan of $1000 to increase her business capital. She has benefited in the past with several loans from Nadiya Ukraine and has proven to be a reliable loan client. We are happy for another opportunity to assist her in further developing her business.

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Amanda

texts.es:
Amanda has an account with the community bank Bellavista, located in Psj. Coronel Bustamante No. 157, in the Calleria district, in the city of Ucayali. She is 45 years old, is mother to three children and her husband works for a natural gas company. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos fo S/300 she invested the funds in to a sales and purchase business of liquors.

Today is a distributor of a wiD. variety of natural liquors maD. from roots, which are more desireable than liquors produced from sugar canes, having a nicer flavour that her customers love.

With the loan of $700, which she will repay in a term of 5 months, she will invest in the purchase of 4 gallons of liquor, and the remaining funds she will invest in the purchase of ingredients such as roots to make her liquors.

Amanda is very happy, always wearing a smile on her face and that is why she has so many clients. She is also known for her charisma and the good customer service she provides them. For Amanda, Manuela Ramos has been a great help in her personal finances.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Amanda pertenece al banco comunal Bellavista, ubicado en el Psj. Coronel Bustamante N° 157, distrito D. Calleria, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 45 años, es madre D. 3 hijos y su esposo trabaja en una empresa D. gas. Con el primer préstamo que recibió D. Manuela Ramos D. S/ 300 deciD. invertir en la compra y venta D. aguardiente. En la actualidad distribuye gran variedad D. licores naturales a bases D. raíces, teniendo mas salida el aguardiente D. caña, que es muy agradable y gusta mucho a sus clientes. Con el préstamo D. S/.2,000, el cual pagará en 5 meses, invertirá en la compra D. 4 galones D. aguardiente, lo que resta D. capital lo invertirá en cortezas y raíces para que elabore los licores. Amanda es muy alegre, siempre tiene una sonrisa en su cara y por eso tiene muchos clientes, además por el carisma y la buena atención que les brinda. Para Amanda Manuela Ramos es una gran ayuda para su economía.

loans.use: To purchase liquors, ingredients -  crusts and roots.

loans.name: Scarlett Marisol

texts.es:
SCARLETT MARISOL M. is 26 years old and lives in north Batahola. She is married to an electrician with whom she has 2 small children, ages 6 and 10. They are her greatest joy in life. Her dream is to give them a better education so that they grow up to be productive individuals. This young entrepreneur spares no effort for the wellbeing of her family. She sells clothes and cosmetics from home and in the afternoon works in a pool hall as a cashier. She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise, increase her inventory, and improve sells.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

SCARLETT MARISOL M., de 26 años de edad. Esta Jovencita vive en Batahola Norte, es casada y su esposo es electricista, tienen 2 hijos pequeños de 10 y 6 años de edad que representan su mayor alegría, su sueño es darle la mejor educación y que crezcan siendo personas de bien. Esta Joven emprendedora no escatima esfuerzo para el bienestar de su familia, vende a domicilio ropa y cosméticos y por las tardes trabaja como cajera en un negocio de Billar. SOLICITA un crédito para comprar por docena en los mercados mercadería de la que ella vende y ampliar su inventario para mejorar sus ventas.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Leonardo Antonio

texts.es:
Leonardo lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood of Managua. He's a married man, 52, and his wife sells clothes and cosmetics to help with expenses. He owns a minibus that he uses to take school-aged children to and from school, something he's done for 15 years. He started the business when he used a loan to buy a vehicle and contracted with the school to bus their students. With this loan, he hopes to build a room on his house that he will rent and, in the future, buy another minibus.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

El Sr. M. habita en el barrio Memorial Sandino . Es casado con 52 años de edad su esposa vende ropa y cosmético para ayudar en los gastos. El es transportista tiene un microbús de recorrido del colegio con 15 años de trabajar, este negocio comenzó cuando se decidió a adquirir un vehiculo al crédito y así comenzó hacer un contrato con el colegio para traslados de los alumnos ahora con este préstamo desea construir un cuarto de habitación para alquiler y en un futuro adquirir otra unidad de transporte.

loans.use: Build a room.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase 40 palm fruit plants,12 units of watermelon plants, 5 cans of jocote fruit, 100 units of mango, 20 banana plants, 12 units of papaya, 5 dozen avocado plants and 1 basket of mamon fruit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Rosa Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia is a persevering woman who knows how to overcome the adversities of life and get ahead on her own. After getting a separation from her husband 12 years ago, she started working in factories. However, this forced her to spend less time with her children, which is why she started making and selling turnovers to her neighbors and to the local stores 11 years ago. Thanks to her business, she has been able to get ahead.

She needs a loan of $600.00 USD, which she will repay in 6 months, in order to purchase the ingredients needed to make more turnovers, as well as make pizzas, which is a new activity that she is taking on.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Claudia es una persona perseverante, que sabe sobreponerse a las adversidades y sale adelante por ella misma, después que se separo de su esposo hace ya mas de 12 años empezó trabajando en fabricas pero esto la orillaba a pasar poco tiempo con sus hijos, por lo que hace 11 años emprendió por su cuenta haciendo y vendiendo empanadas con sus vecinos y en las tiendas, y gracias a su negocio ha salido adelante.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $600 que pagara en 6 meses para compra materia prima para hacer mas empanadas y para elaborar pizzas, que es algo nuevo en lo que esta incursionando.

loans.use: Purchase turnover and pizza ingredients

loans.name: Trim

texts.en:
Mrs. Trim C., 36 years old and the mother of a preschool aged child, owns a small grocery store in the local market in Mong Barang Village in Kampong Chhang Province. Her husband, Mr. Prach Bunthoeurn, shown on the left of the photo, is a motorbike taxi driver whose small income helps support the family. 

Since her business is doing well, Mrs. C. would like to expand it, so she is requesting a loan to buy additional grocery products to meet customer demand.

loans.use: To buy additional grocery products to meet customer demand.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La señora Victoria pertenece al Banco Comunal “Maria Magdalena”, vive en la región San Martín, provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, distrito de Juanjui. El negocio está ubicado en el Jr. Leticia, en el mercado Poma Rosa de la ciudad. Se dedica a la compra y venta de gallinas. 
	
Con este crédito de S/. 2,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará gallinas, ya que las compras lo realiza diariamente, eso quiere decir que invierte a diario, además quiere comprar un motokar para dar servicio de mototaxi así como también facilitar su traslado a comprar y vender las gallinas.

La señora Victoria tiene 38 años de edad, vive con su esposo y con sus 2  últimos hijos, 03 ya son independientes. Ella es muy trabajadora y su meta es la de comprar un terreno para construir su casa.
texts.en:
Victoria belongs to the Bank Communal "Maria Magdalena". She lives in the San Martín region, Mariscal Cáceres province, Juanjuí district. The business is located in the Jr. Leticia, in the Poma Rosa market of the city. Victoria purchases and sells chickens. With this amount of $675, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy chickens. As the purchasing is done daily, she must also make a daily investment. She also wants to purchase a motokar to provide mototaxi service, as well as facilitate her transportation to buy and sell chickens. Victoria is 38 years old, lives with her husband and their last two sons (three are already living independently). She is very hardworking, and her goal is to buy land to build a house.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase chickens

loans.name: Mame Diarra

texts.fr: MAME DIARRA S. COMMERCIALISE DES CEREALES TELS QUE MIL, ARACHIDE, NIEBE, ET HABITE AU QUARTIER NDAYANE DE DIOURBEL. ELLE EST DANS CE SECTEUR DEPUIS 5 ANS.
texts.en:
Mame Diarra S. sells grains including millet, peanuts and cowpeas. She lives in the Ndayane district of Diourbel. She has been in this line of business for five years.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy and sell grain

loans.name: Shamama

texts.en: Shamama is 37 years old and has two children. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Kalbadjar region, settled in Khirdalan settlement. She has been in the general store business for fifteen years. She would like a loan of 970 AZN to buy goods to help improve her business.

loans.use: to buy foods

loans.name: Yawo

texts.en:
Yawo K. is a 32-year-old man, who is married with 2 children. In the local language, Ewe, his first name indicates that he was born on Thursday. Yawo lives in the village of Wome, a small town approximately 130 kilometers from Lomé, the Togolese capital.

To provide for his family, Yawo picks up passengers along the road with his motorcycle and drops them off at their destination. This service is always in demand in Wome because there is no electricity in this village, and people must often travel further than walking distance to take care of business. Yawo has asked for this loan from Kiva, so he can buy a new motorcycle, which will permit him to improve his business. With the profits he will earn from his business, Yawo can continue to send his children to school and provide for his wife and family.

loans.use: Buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Pavlo

texts.en:
Pavlo C. uses his car as a taxi and is his main source of income. His profit is about 1,300 UAH per month. Pavlo has been in this business for 5 years and has been successful. A high unemployment rate in his city required him to be creative with ways to make a living. He is married and has two daughters.  
Pavlo recently got a newer car, and though it's not expensive, it requires frequent maintenance. Pavlo would like a loan of 3,000 UAH ($375) to use for car maintenance. He plans to pay the loan back in 6 months.

loans.use: car maintenance

loans.name: Lilybeth

texts.en:
Lilybeth G., a 48-year old, is married to Jaime G., presently residing at Purok Bularan, Miputak Dipolog City. Gifted with 4 children, she has 3 who are married and one is on her last year in High School. 

On January 30 of 2006, she enrolled to be a member of Paglaum MPC, since she has been interested in the benefits like dividend sharing and insurance at Paglaum. She is in need also of a capital because she wants to try managing her own business. Her first loan of 3,000 php was her stepping stone for a hog-raising business. Being a MIGS member of the Cooperative, she enjoys other services that the Cooperative gives. She availed herself of several loans and now she applies an amount of 14,500 php to buy feed and piglets.

She will do her best to help her youngest finish in college. And she will always continue patronizing Paglaum because of the big opportunity that has been given to her.

loans.use: to buy feed & piglets

loans.name: Debbie

texts.en:
A responsible lady best describes Debbie B., 41 years old, single and resident of Dullan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She helps her family since her mother died. Her mother was a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) before she died. But because of her lingering sickness, Debbie's mother couldn't attend the weekly meetings of PMPC; she then transferred her membership to Debbie.

Debbie engaged herself in “sari-sari store" (a small grocery) business where she could earn a living. The financial assistance that the PMPC provided to Debbie has helped her a lot. Being a member in good standing, she was able to avail of  loans several times already. Now, she applies for PHP14,900 for coconut trading. She plans also to buy dried fish in Pagadian City for sale. In the future, she also hopes that someday she will also have her own family.

loans.use: To buy coconuts for sale

loans.name: Issomadin

texts.ru: Исомаддин работает преподователем в средней школе. Ему 50 лет, он женат, имеет 5 детей. Кроме основной работы Исомаддин имеет мельницу по переработке зерна в муку. Если не иметь дополнительного источника дохода то в нынешнее время не выжить. Цены на продукты питания и промышленные товары высокие, а заработной платы преподователя на все не хватает. Сейчас Исомаддин планирует закупить зерно для чего подал заявку на КИВА.
texts.en:
