Issomadin S. is a middle school teacher. He is 50 years old, married, and has five children. Beside his primary job, he also has a grain mill for producing flour. Without additional income he would not have been able to survive. Prices for food and consumer goods are high and a teacher's pay does not cover expenses. Now Issomadin has applied to Kiva for a loan to buy grain.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grain for mill

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en: Teresa V. is a 57-year-old mother of eleven who lives in San Jose, the capital of beautiful Antique Province.  Her youngest child is still in primary school. Another child is in high school and one is attending college. The rest of her children are finished with school.  She and her husband farm rice.  Teresa plans to use the money from this loan to buy fertilizer for her rice crop and to purchase a water buffalo (called  "caribou" in the Philippines) to use as a work animal in the fields.  Teresa would like to be able to buy more farmland someday and hopes to be able to provide for the rest of her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and one water buffalo for use in farming rice.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia M. is married with three children and has received an education through junior high school. Since 2004, she has worked as a trader in Elmina, selling clothes, various materials and shoes. While Cecilia works as a trader, her husband is employed as a miner.

She uses her income to help support her family and provide housekeeping money. Cecilia will use the loan to purchase additional clothes, shoes and materials to expand her business. With her newly gained profits, Cecilia plans to save in order to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase clothes, shoes and materials to expand her business

loans.name: Zina

texts.en: Zina is a wife and mother of six children who are currently in school. She is a forty-four year old trader who trades in charcoal, maize & corn dough. Charcoal is a very popular source of energy for cooking in many traditional Ghanaian homes. Zina obtains her supply of charcoal from Afram plains and retails them to her customers. She wants to use the loan to buy more charcoal and maize to increase her inventory. She believes the loan will enable her to increase her savings and allow her to provide her children with their educational needs. She belongs to the community group called Olivet Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral and provide support to one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal and maize.

loans.name: Nazya Group

texts.en:
Nazya is the group leader of the Nazya group, which has three members. To expand their businesses, they requested a loan of 15000 Afghani. Nazya wants to take a loan to make her hairdressing shop larger. Parwen wants a loan to buy a new machine for her business of tailoring. And Aqa jan wants to buy necessary materials for his vegetable shop.

They all are happy about the process of the loan and want to say that it can support the entrepreneurs a lot.

loans.use: To make their businesses larger

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia N. is thirty years old and married. She is the mother of five children: three sons and two daughters. All of her children are still in school – senior high, junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Her husband is a farmer.

Emilia is a trader. She trades in printed textiles and ladies’ wear – dresses, underwear, footwear, etc. She sells under a shed in the market square and treks to other towns to sell as well. She has been in business for one year and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She desires to expand her business and give her children the best education.

loans.use: To buy ladies’ wear in bulk

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi de l’association Djantoyerela est composé de 2 polygames et 2 monogames ayant en moyenne 37 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans le quartier Bananissabakoro de  la ville de Ségou (4ème  Région administrative  de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues par des liens professionnel et social et font le commerce d’articles divers tels l’achat et la vente des céréales, des pagnes, du bois de chauffe, des produits cosmétiques etc. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de commerce, elles ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles sont à leur 2ème  prêt solidaire. Le premier prêt fut correctement remboursé.
Ce deuxième  prêt servira à utiliser,  20 tissus pour pantalon, 10 complets de pagnes wax, 4 sacs d’arachide, 3 sacs de mil et 5 chargements de charrette en bois de chauffe.
 Le mil est décortiqué, lavé, pilé en poudre, pétri et frit en galettes  pour être vendu, quand aux graines d’arachide, elles sont triées, lavées, grillées, décortiquées et broyées pour donner de la pâte destinée à la vente. 
Elles se ravitaillent en tissus et pagnes wax mensuellement au Burkina Faso et aux autres produits à la foire hebdomadaire du grand marché de Ségou.
Elles revendent toutes leurs marchandises en détail au comptant et à crédit à domicile et en ambulant dans les quartiers à une clientèle composée d’hommes, de femmes et d’enfants. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 31.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt, la tontine et faire face aux évènements sociaux sans l’apport d’autrui.
texts.en:
Group Benkadi of the Association Djantoyerela is composed of 2 polygamous women and 2 monogamous women. On average, they are 37 years old, with 4 children each. They all live in the neighborhood of Bananissabakoro in the city of Ségou (4th Administrative Region of the Republic of Mali). They know each other through professional and social links.

In their business they sell various items, such as grains, “pagnes” (brightly printed cloth), firewood, cosmetics etc. With the goal of increasing their business, they decided to join the credit program Soro Yiriwaso – this is their second loan as a group with Soro Yiriwaso. The first loan was properly repaid.

This second loan will be used to buy 20 pieces of fabric for pants, 10 sets of wax “pagnes”, 4 sacks of peanuts, 3 sacks of millet and 5 carts of firewood. The millet will be hulled, washed, crushed into a powder, then kneaded and fried as tarts for the women to sell. The peanuts will be sorted, washed, roasted, peeled and crushed into a paste (i.e. peanut butter) to sell.

They will supply the cloth and wax “pagnes” monthly from Burkina Faso and the other products at the large weekly market in Ségou.

They sell their merchandise at retail for cash or credit, from their homes and walking around the neighborhood. Their clientele composed of men, women and children.

They anticipate an average monthly profit of 31,000 FCFA which they will use to repay the loan, the tontine (a traditional revolving credit association) and to pay for social events without contribution from others.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a variety of items for their business.

loans.name: Fanaticas Group

texts.es:
La asociación “fanáticas” esta formada por catorce integrantes, una de ellas es Rosalía C., actual presidente de la asociación, ella trabaja junto a su esposo prestando servicio en transporte publico, ella precisa comprar repuestos para su vehiculo,  otras de sus compañeras se dedican a la chiflería (elaboración y venta de  remedios caseros), tejidos a mano de mantas y chompas, venta de material escolar y otros.
Todas desean  mejorar sus negocios con la compra de productos, tienen la seguridad de obtener mejores ganancias, para el bien de sus familias.
texts.en:
The Fanáticas is an association comprised of 14 members. Rosalía C. is the current president. She works together with her husband providing public transportation services. She needs to buy replacement parts for her vehicle. Other members of the group make and sell home remedies, make hand woven blankets and sweaters, and sell school materials and other things. All of them wish to improve their businesses by buying products. They are sure that they will get better earnings to help their families’ well being.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products

loans.name: Fa

texts.en:
Fa R. (10100006935) is a 32-year-old woman living in the town of Toamua Safune. She is married and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, Fa owns & operates a business selling baked goods in the local community.  Fa has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 250 WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Fa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Fa is requesting for the first time a loan from SPBD of 1000 WST, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make her products for sale.  The loan will be the first loan taken out by Fa from SPBD.  Fa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra L. is from the village of Agusan, Canyon Camp Phillips, Bukidnon. She is 40 years old. Alejandra is married and has 10 school-aged children. To make a living, Alejandra owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling vegetables in the local community. Alejandra has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Alejandra joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alejandra has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Alejandra is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Alejandra from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Yolanda Maria

texts.es:
La señora  Yolanda es socia del  Banco Comunal “Nueva Flor”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 35 años de edad, estado civil casada y es madre de 5 hijos y no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, vive en el centro poblado de Rosa Cami.

La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace casi 6 años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, para la compra de ganado porcino.

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, este dinero lo invertirá en la compra de ganado ovino para engorde.

Su mayor deseo comprar mas ganado y educar a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan los ahorros.

loans.use: Para la compra de ganado ovino.

loans.name: Marysol

texts.en:
Marysol B. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 30 years old. Marysol is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Marysol owns and operates a 'sari-sari' (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Marysol has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marysol joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marysol has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Marysol is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Marysol from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Yarnn

texts.en: Yarnn S., 29, pictured here, has a business selling brooms at the local market of Takeo province; he earns approximately around US $3 each day while his wife, Chhuon Pab, stays at home making brooms for him to sell at the market. The brooms are made from a kind of long grass which grows in the forest. Both husband and wife learned how to make brooms from their neighbors and they started doing that business in 2005. This couple has three young children. Yarnn told a loan officer that every month his family needs to spend around US $75 on food and US $5 on utilities. Yarnn is asking a loan from Kiva via Credit, a local partner, in order to purchase long grass to make more brooms.

loans.use: purchasing long grass to make more brooms

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina C. is 47 years old and married to Vencensio C.. Both are residents of Purok-4 Pangabuan, Tangub City. They were blessed with nine children who are now either adults or of school age. Angelina is a vendor of “amahong” (a family of sea shells), while her husband is a fisherman. She earns an average net income of $100 a month in vending amahong. She has been dealing in amahong for twenty years.

As a good member of PAGLAUM MPC under the PDP-LP Program, she is given the privilege of being granted her third-cycle loan in the amount of P6,000.00. She is very thankful to PMPC for the trust given to her. She enjoyed the other products and services offered to all our members of PAGLAUM MPC.

The proceeds of this loan will be used to buy a boat pump machine to be used by her husband in fishing, and the rest of the proceeds will be used in supporting their daily needs and for the repayment of their loan.

loans.use: To buy a boat pump machine

loans.name: Roberta

texts.es:
Roberta tiene 55 años, está casada y es madre de 7 hijos, actualmente vive con 4 de ellos.
La encontramos en plena faena de tapar el horno en tierra donde había realizado la “pachamanca” (alimentos que se cuecen bajo tierra por el calor del sol) para los operarios y su esposo que cosecharon sus productos. En cada cosecha, Roberta acostumbra a brindar este plato al término de la faena; y a las 11 de la mañana lleva las porciones de carne, papas, en este caso ocas, acompañados de ají y queso, pues sólo así dice ella “tendrán fuerzas para cargar los sacos de 60 kilos”.
Pero Roberta no sólo prepara el almuerzo durante las cosechas, sino que también se encarga de coser los costales de productos para cerrarlos y estén listos para ser transportados. 

Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP y en todo este tiempo viene trabajando con mucha responsabilidad en sus pagos. Asimismo, brinda su casa para la reunión del mes, pues es la presidenta de su banco comunal. El dinero que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes químicos para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Roberta is 55, married and the mother of 7, with 4 living at home. She is shown here working hard covering the oven with dirt where she has made the “pachamanca” (food that is cooked underground by the heat of the sun) for the workers and her husband who harvest their crops. For each harvest, Roberta offers this dish at the end of the work, and at 11 in the morning she takes servings of meat, potatoes, in this case “ocas” (Peruvian potato dish) accompanied by chiles and cheese. She says that’s the only way “they will have the strength to carry sacks weighing 60 kilos”. But Roberta doesn’t only prepare lunch during the harvest. She also is in charge of sewing up the bags to close them so they are ready for transport. This is her fourth loan from MFP and during all this time she continues paying back responsibly. She offers her house for the monthly meeting since she is the president of the communal bank. She plans to use the money that she is asking for to invest in the purchase of chemical fertilizers for her next planting. .

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Pepe

texts.en:
Pepe M. is a 71-year-old woman living in the town of Auala. She is married and has 8 adult children. To make a living, Pepe owns & operates a business venture making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling baked goods in the local community. Pepe has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 250 WST a month from these activities.

In 2008, Pepe joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pepe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Pepe is now requesting a new loan of 1500 WST which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Pepe plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Kaira Farah

texts.en: Kaira Farah H. sells eggs, bread, milk and steel wool to soldiers at the Barracks soldier camp which is near Thika town. She has done this for the past year.  She has one employee and faces the business challenge of lack of funds to restock eggs.  She is using the proceeds of KES20,000 to buy eggs and clothes.  Kaira's life goal is to own a fully stocked shop.  She is married to a soldier and has seven children ranging from four to seventeen years. She describes herself as friendly, generous and social.

loans.use: To buy eggs and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen C., 52 years old, is a rice farmer in Norala, South Cotabato. She started her business in 1990 and is still tilling her farm hoping that she will be able to have an abundant harvest.

When she started farming, Carmen said that it was really difficult, especially since the farm needed enough capitalization to grow rice. She was happy that she joined CEVI and was able to get access to small loans.

Now, Carmen would like to apply for a loan of Php 12,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies to grow her crops well.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Con Metas Y Sueños 1 &2 Group

texts.en:
Amada is the coordinator of her group Mujeres con Sueños y Metas (Women with Dreams and Goals), and her story is representational of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients in general. Her group is located in the slums, north of the capital, Santo Domingo, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure as a single mother with her four children.

Amada is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling bacon and Longaniza (a pork sausage popular in the DR) by purchasing 180lbs of meat. She will use the profits to invest in a freezer, which will serve a dual purpose of supporting her business as well as providing cold storage for her family. Her long-term goal is to save enough money to have a large comfortable home and to send her kids to university. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: 180 lbs of meat with which to make sausage and bacon

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a 49-year-old married lady with four children: two in college, one married and the other one in primary school. She has a textile shop where she sells buttons, cloth linings, zips, threads, elastics and cloth ribbons.  She has been running the business for 15 years but previously she was operating a cafeteria.  

She has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to add stock of cloth material. She hopes to become a wholesaler and import goods from Dubai in the future. She describes herself as creative and hardworking.

loans.use: To add stock of cloth material

loans.name: Shurentsetseg

texts.en:
Shurentsetseg is 39 years old and lives with her husband and their two sons in Arhangai province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a 'ger', the Mongolian nomadic tent. They have been living in their current home for 15 years.  Her husband operates a transportation business. Shurentsetseg has been operating a meat retailing business since 1999.  

Shurentsetseg's business is well-known in their home province. When the business first started, its working capital was 200,000 tugrugs (~ 140 USD). However, after 11 years of hard work, Shurentsetseg's working capital has grown to 2,800,000 tugrugs (~ 1,970 USD).  Since she started the business, her family's quality of life has improved, and she has purchased a car for her family with the business profit. 

Shurentsetseg has been planning to expand her business in the future.  She is a very hard-working person and has great communication skills.  She says, “I would like to provide a good education for my children.” Shurentsetseg is requesting a 4,000,000 tugrug (~ 2814 USD) loan to purchase large amounts of meat at wholesale prices for her business.

loans.use: To purchase large amounts of meat at wholesale prices

loans.name: Ngandu Development Group, Mukono

texts.en:
G. Mary, shown at the top right in the small photo as well as in the group photo, is the leader of her lending group. She is 42 years old and the married mother of three children who are in high school.

Mary sells dairy products in Mbale, Mukono district. She has been doing this for the last twelve years and has had to remain strong in the face of challenges. However, her friendly nature has always been her strength, as her loyal customers have always been at her beck and call.

Mary’s future business plan of action is to buy more cows to increase her dairy sales and to be able to expand her business which is still small scale. Her hopes are high that with this loan, she will be able to see her dreams come to fruition.

loans.use: To pay the workers that look after her cows

loans.name: Juana Del Carmen

texts.es: Juana del Carmen A. D. G. D. 39 años D. edad, resiD. en Santa Rosa D. Lima, ubicado en el departamento D. La Unión, este es un pueblo muy conocido por su comercio, ya que muchas personas D. Honduras y D. todo el país D. El Salvador llegan a este pequeño pueblo a comprar prendas D. oro, el cual es el producto que más se venD. en este lugar ya que existen diferentes minas D. este metal en esta región, así mismo otro D. los comercios más fuertes es D.  ropa la cual se comercializa a muy buenos precios. Juana vive junto a su esposo quien se dedica a la venta D. ropa. Ella posee su propio negocio el cual es una venta D. ropa para hombres, mujeres y niños, la cual la comercializa a las afueras D. su casa, lugar muy concurrido por personas, por ser calle principal. Juana cuenta con muchos clientes, los cuales son compradores periódicos, lo que beneficia en gran manera a Juana. Ella solicita un préstamo a Integral con el fin D. poder comprar mayor cantidad D. ropa en diferentes estilos, colores y tallas, lo cual le permita obtener mayor cantidad D. clientes y D. esta manera poder aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Juana del Carmen A. D. G. is 39 years old and lives in Santa Rosa D. Lima, located in the department of La Unión. This town is very well known for its traD.: many people from Honduras and from all over El Salvador come to this small town to buy gold garments. This is the most highly sold product due to the many gold mines in this region. The other strong industry is clothing, which is sold at very good prices. Juana lives with her husband, who works in clothing sales. Juana has her own business selling clothes for men, women and children outsiD. her house. Her stall sees a lot of passerbys as she lives on the main street. Juana has many customers, some of whom are regulars, who are of great benefit to her. Juana is applying to Kiva's field partner Integral for a loan to purchase more clothes in different styles, colours and sizes, which will enable her to reach a greater number of customers and increase her sales accordingly.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothes

location.town: Santa Rosa de Lima, departamento de La Unión

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Finishings on the ceiling and detail work on the house

loans.name: Salinah

texts.en:
Salina C. was born in 1974. She is married to Joseph Tarus who is a 45-year-old soldier. They have two children: Sharon (10 years old, in primary school) and Mary (10 years old, in primary school).

Salina sells fruits and vegetables and started this business one year ago. The business gives her a monthly profit of Ksh 6,000 and her husband’s salary brings in additional income. 

Salina did not borrow from another source before KADET. She was introduced to KADET by its staff and clients. She has borrowed a loan of Ksh 10,000 from KADET and, from this loan, Ksh 8,000 will be used to purchase five iron sheets and timber for constructing a premises for her business. The remaining balance will be used to purchase livestock.

Salina's business is in Kabarnet Town, opposite the municipal council building. Her clients pay in cash. If this loan boosts her business, she will use the extra profit to buy goats for her family and educate her children.

Salina dreams of and hopes to buy a plot of land and use it to construct a house for her family. She also dreams of becoming a wholesale vegetable vendor.

Salina describes herself as an honest and God-fearing lady.

loans.use: To construct premises for her business and buy livestock

loans.name: Obare

texts.en:
E. is 27 years old and single. He is a farmer from Kisii town in Western Kenya. He has been farming for over eight years and his main products are milk, maize and tomatoes, which he sells to the local market. He relies solely on his farming activities to cater for his needs.
E. has a good record with Kiva partner, Juhudi Kilimo, after successfully completing his loan of 30,000 KES. He has requested this loan from Juhudi for 50,000 KES to purchase a dairy cow. Through this loan, he will be able to increase his sources of income through the sale of milk. His major challenges in farming are a lack of a proper market for his products and a poor road network to access the market.
He hopes to expand his dairy farming by purchasing four quality dairy cows producing at least 20 litres of milk each per day. He is requesting that Juhudi continue to support him financially.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Samoeun

texts.en:
Mr. Samoeun P., age 37 (was in the picture) and his wife, Mrs. Sitha Rith, age 31, live in a small village outside of Phnom Penh. They have been married for ten years and have three children: one son and two daughters. All of them are still young.      

Samoeun has been a taxi driver for fifteen years. He drives garment factory workers from his village to the factory and back. Mrs. Sitha Rith sells vegetable in Phnom Penh market. 

Samoeun is asking for his first loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for his wife to carry vegetable to sell. He also will use a part of the loan to change new wheel of his taxi.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for his wife to transport vegetables to sell plus buy a wheel for his taxi

loans.name: Francisca Graciela

texts.es:
Doña Graciela de 55 años  de edad, labora como supervisora de enfermeria desde hace 36 años en hospital de Nueva Guinea,  tiene 2 hijos los dos mayores de edad viven en su propia casa, de ella depende economicamente solamente 1 nietecito de 3 añitos de edad al que cuida como su propio hijo. 

Graciela esta solicitando su primer credito para comprar piedras canteras y cemento para realizar mejoras en la vivienda, ya que una pared de la cocina se encuentra en mal estado y necesita cambiarla, su mayor sueño en la vida es que su familia permanezca unida y salud.
texts.en:
Graciela is 55 years old. She has worked as a nursing supervisor for the past 36 years at a hospital in Nueva Guinea. She has two children, both of whom are grown and live in their own home. Only one little grandson, 3 years old, is economically dependent on her, and she cares for him as if he were her own child. Graciela is requesting her first loan to buy quarry stones and cement to make improvements to her home, since one wall of her kitchen is currently in bad shape and needs to be replaced. Her greatest dream in life is to see her family remain united and healthy.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying construction materials

loans.name: Martha Dorely

texts.es:
Martha es una madre de familia de años de edad que vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Motupe un distrito conocido a nivel nacional por sus festividades religiosas, pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a confeccionar diversos artículos en tela como bolsos, manteles y otros adornos para lo cual cuenta con una pequeña máquina de coser en un ambiente de su vivienda, ella confecciona todo tipo de artículos a pedido aunque también los realiza de modo independiente, su principal grupo de clientes se encuentra en el distrito donde vive.

Martha desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más material, de modo que pueda aumentar su produción y también sus ventas, por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le permitan realizar esta acción y seguir trabajando.

Martha es una mujer tranquila y alegre, su mayor anhelo es seguir implementando su taller y  enseñar su oficio a otras mujeres de su localidad, otro se sus anhelos es brindarle a su hijo menor la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera superior.
texts.en:
Martha is a mother and lives with her family in the district of Motupe, which is renowned throughout the country for its religious festivities. It is located in the province of Lambayeque, one and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo. She produces various woven articles, such as handbags, tablecloths and ornaments, with a small sewing machine in a room of her home. She produces all kind of articles on demand, but also on her own initiative. Most of her customers live in the same district as she does. Martha wants to expand her business with the purchase of more material, so that she can increase her production and also her sales. Therefore she came for the first time to Edpyme Alternativa and applied for a loan of 1000 new soles, which will enable her to carry out this investment and keep on working. Martha is a quiet and cheerful woman. Her greatest desire is to continue to tool up her workshop and teach the craft to other women in her village. Another of her desires is to enable her youngest child to study at a school for higher education.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more material to expand her handicrafts production

loans.name: Blandine

texts.fr:
femme de 33ans,mariée et mère de 2 enfants dont l'age varie de15ans à 16 mois et a 3 personnes à sa charge, ayant quittee sa scolarité tôt après le deces de son père,étant ainé elle se lanca dans la coiffure en 1995. son revenu journaliere  est de 10000frs par jour.
Avec ce prêt elle aimerai agrandir son activité en achetant des produits cosmétiques tel que des defrisants, des demelants, des bigoudis, des mèches(pony,anglaise,olive), des filets et pinces à cheveux et d'autre produits de première necessité.
sa strategie est de faire  des promotions de ses produits, avoir des prix abordable, avoir des meilleurs produits dans son salon de coiffure.
Son  ambition est  d'aller acheter les produits de cheveux à l'étranger et être grossiste car elle pense beaucoup améliorer les conditions de vie de sa mère et de ses frères. son entourage est content d'elle car elle se debrouille bien.
texts.en:
Blandine is a 33 year old mother of two children aged 15 years and 16 months, who also cares for 3 other people. She had to quit school soon after her father died, since she was the eldest in her family. In 1995, she started hairdressing, and her daily income is 10,000 francs. With this loan, she would like to grow her business by buying cosmetics such as hair straighteners, detangler, curlers and extensions (ponytails, ringlets, Olive brand), hair nets and clips, and other essential items. Her strategy is to promote her products, have reasonable prices and keep the best products in her salon. Her ambition is to someday go overseas to buy hair products and become a bulk seller since she believes this would very much improve living conditions for her mother and brothers. Her friends and family are proud of her because she is very resourceful.

Translated from French by Eileen Jessop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetic products (hair extensions, straighteners, detangler)

loans.name: Rashad

texts.ru:
Rashid H. 31 let. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey , doch 10 let kotoraya uchitsya v shkole i zanimayetsya risovaniyem i sin 5 let. Rashid i eqo semya yavlyayutsya   oni pereselenci iz Fuzuli, seychas oni projivayut v Fuzuli regione, .

Rashid uje 5 let zanimayetsya skotovodstvom . Etomu biznesu on nauchilsya u svoeqo otca. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit  dlya razvitiya biznesa. Rashid prodayet na rinki molko i sir.
texts.en:
Rashid H. is thirty-one years old and has two children. His daughter is ten, goes to school and likes to draw, and his son is five. Rashid and his family live in the Fuzuli region. For five years Rashid has bred cattle, a trade he learned from his father. Rashid sells milk and cheese on the local market. Now he's asking for a loan of 2000 AZN to expand his business.

Translated from Russian by Alex Kostrubsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Elvo Iban

texts.es:
Elvo de 53 años, tiene una tienda de víveres en donde vende arroz, enlatados, canes etc. Vive en una zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y las casas están ubicadas en montañas. 

El tiene la tienda para no depender de un empleador y así conseguir mas dinero para mantener a su esposa y dos hijos. Vende lácteos, granos, bebidas, aceites a un bajo precio. Trabaja con su esposa desde las 07h00am hasta las 22h00pm todos los días. 

Para poder incrementar los víveres de su tienda quiere comprar con el préstamo arroz, azúcar y aceites. En el futuro quiere ampliar y surtir mas su tienda para darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
53-year-old Elvo has a grocery store where he sells rice, canned goods, meats etc. He lives on the outskirts of town where the roads are made of dirt and houses are built on the hillsides. Elvo has his own store because he doesn’t want to work for an employer, and this way he earns more money to support his wife and children. He sells milk products, grains, drinks, and oil at good prices. He and his wife work in the store from 7am to 10pm every day. In order to increase the stock in his store, he wishes to use the loan to buy rice, sugar, and oil. In the future he plans to expand the store and stock it with more items so that he can provide his children with a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and oil

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena E. is a married woman who lives in Sitio Canonoy, Brgy. Miranda, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: a coffee shop, a general store and a food-vending business. Her husband Jomarie, who is 44 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living and also helps with his wife's business activities. They have four children who are 2 to 13 years old. Elena joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 11 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Elena has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 10000 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 12th loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000, which she intends to use to buy more stock to sell in her coffee shop and food-vending businesses so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children and save up for future emergencies. Elena E. is a Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable") woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team: http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Santos Manuel

texts.es:
Santos Manuel A. A.
Santos es de 24 años de edad, casado, tiene un hijo varón y una mujer, es comerciante, actualmente es ayudante de albañil, en el servicio tiene dos años de experiencia, solicita su primer crédito para compra de lamina para su vivienda, se ha evaluado la capacidad del solicitante y la utilidad del crédito, la cual es factible la autorización del mismo.
texts.en: Santos is 24 years old, married and has a son and a daughter.  He is a merchant.  He is currently a construction worker, in which  he has two years of experience.  He is requesting his first loan to be able to purchase metal sheeting for his home.  The financial standing of the solicitor has been evaluated and also the usefulness of the loan.  It is feasible to authorize this loan.

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Cornelius Moturi

texts.en:
Cornelius has been practicing farming in Naivasha town for the last 15 years. He is 34 years old and married to Christine Nyaboke. They have five children.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the cash to plant onions and tomatoes, which he will sell.

In the future, Cornelius hopes to open a cereals shop to be run by his wife.

loans.use: To plant onions and tomatoes

loans.name: Emerthe

texts.en:
Emerthe is 31 years old and married with four children aged between 2 and 8 years old. Emerthe is a businesswoman and her husband does not work. She owns a business selling various style of clothes in the local market. She has been selling clothes for 4 years and works from 8am to 6pm during the week. 

Emerthe is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business through purchasing more bales of clothing which will allow her to sell various styles of clothes. With the profits from her business she hopes to pay for school fees for her children.

loans.use: Purchasing more bales of clothes

loans.name: Eda Oralia

texts.es:
la sra. Eda C. cuenta con una pulpería en donde ofrece a su clientela productos de la canasta básica familiar, teniendo 9 años de experiencia en el manejo de este tipo de actividad ya que antes  de ir a vivir a Las Trojes tenia su negocio en la aldea de Maquingales donde a su vez tiene una finca de café, su negocio esta ubicado en la Terminal de buses de dicho municipio, lo que le permite tener muy buena clientela todo el año , con las ganancias que le genera este negocio le permiten satisfacer los gastos personales y cumplir con los compromisos del hogar. 
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercadería ya que por los momentos no cuenta con el capital de trabajo suficiente para surtir mas su pulperia y asi satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Eda C. owns a general store where she offers her customers basic household goods. She has 9 years of experience in this type of work. Before she came to live in Las Trojes she also had a similar business in the village of Maquingales, where she had a coffee farm at the time. 

Her business is located in the municipal bus station of Las Trojes, which guarantees her a steady stream of customers all year. The income she earns from her business allows her to cover her personal and household expenses.

She will use the loan to buy products for her store, since she doesn't currently have enough working capital to stock her store and meet customer demand.

loans.use: Purchase of rice, beans, bread, sugar, coffee, milk, bread, cookies, sodas, juice, lard, oil, soap, toilet paper, churros, sausages, cheese, soup, pasta, salt, condiments, seasonings, cereal, batteries, light bulbs, flashlights, matches.

loans.name: Allah Jawai's Group

texts.en:
Allah jawai lives in a city called Jaranwala which is located in Punjab province and is known for its agriculture industry in Pakistan. She lives there in the area named Mughalpura in a 2 roomed brick house with her family. She came here 3 years ago. She doesn’t have any children yet. So to spend her time she does her household responsibilities and also weaves carpets. She is an expert in her work and makes very good quality carpets on order. She receives orders from carpet sellers and earns well by fulfilling the orders on time. Her husband is a loader by profession. He uses his donkey cart to load different items such as construction supplies and fruits & vegetables. He offers good loading services to his clients by delivering their items to the designated places safely.  

Allah jawai has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to financially assist her husband in purchasing of a new donkey cart, because his old cart has become rough and rotten. His work is being affected and he is losing his customer base. She is hopeful that a new cart will help her husband's business and to retain his clients as well. 

Allah jawai is a new loan applicant of Asasah and hopes that an investment in her husband’s business will take his business to a more profitable position and she will be able to repay the loan easily. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Allah jawai.

loans.use: To buy a new donkey cart for loading business.

loans.name: Munansi Development Group

texts.en: N. Florence is the leader of Munansi development group in Mubende. She is 34 years old and married with 3 children, all of them in school. Florence is a market vendor in Mubende, Kibaati zone where she sells clothes to retail buyers in the area. In addition, she is also involved in farming and as a result sells some of the produce from her farm. She was a tailor before the clothes business 10 years ago and she needs a loan to be able to buy more clothes for resale. She is a friendly lady and this has made her more successful.

loans.use: Purchasing more clothes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 5 whole hens.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.ar:
محمد في عمر 37 سنة متزوج وله ولد يعمل في بيع الالبسة الجاهزة له في عمله 5 سنوات يحب عمله يبتكر فيه
اكثر ما يميزه هو ملاحقة الموديلات الجديدة والصدق والامانة في التعامل له تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة حيث ساهم القرض 
الاول في زيادة البضائع في المحل وزيادة المدخول يريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة الى شراء ثياب بالجملة لبيعها
وتوسيع المحل وبذلك يزيد مدخوله ويستطيع ان يخفف من وطأة المنافسة عليه حيث ان زبائنه تطالبه بزيادة البضائع
texts.en: Mohamad is a 37-year-old husband and father who, for the past five years, has been selling ready-made clothes. Mohamad is very honest, trustworthy, and innovative in his work and is always following up on the latest trends. Given his good credit history with Al Majmoua, he now wanted to ask for another loan to expand his shop and purchase clothes wholesale. This would help Mohamad counter the competition and meet the rising demand of his customers.

loans.use: To purchase clothes wholesale

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en: Violeta G. is from the village of Buenavista. She is 50 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Violeta owns and operates a business selling coconuts and charcoal in the local community. Violeta has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2008, Violeta joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Violeta has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Violeta is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Violeta from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Goreth

texts.en: Goreth is 29 years old, married and has twins who are two years and five months. Goreth sells lotions and petroleum jelly, which she has done for five years. Her husband works as a businessman. Goreth will use the loan to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. With her profits she plans to expand her business. Goreth plans to build a house, make savings and she would like to have a bigger shop in the future.

loans.use: Purchase foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Mirna Aidé

texts.es:
La señora Mirna P. y su esposo el Sr. Jorge Rodríguez son padres de dos hijas, a las cuales quieren bridarles una mejor educación de la que ellos tuvieron. Por lo cual están solicitando nuestra ayuda para poder financiar la compra de una computadora, ya que por el momento no cuentan con el dinero necesaR. para comprarla y no desean que sus hijas salgan perjudicadas al no poder comprarla.
Ella planea pagar este crédito con sus ingresos como vendedora, ya que su esposo se hará cargo de los gastos familiares con los ingresos que gana como vendedor.
texts.en:
Mirna P. and her husband, Jorge Rodríguez, are the parents of two girls. They want to provide them with a better education than what they had. This is why they are requesting our help to be able to pay for the purchase of a computer, as they don’t currently have the necessary money and they don’t want their daughters to lose out because they couldn’t buy it.

She plans to repay the loan with her earnings as a saleswoman, as her husband will be responsible for the family expenses with his income as a salesman.

loans.use: To buy a computer

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia N. has been working as a street vendor for 22 years now. Every day she walks the streets of her home town Jukwa near Abura and sells fried fish, meat pies and pastries. Afia has received senior high education. She is married and has four children. Her husband is an agriculture officer. Afia assists her husband in taking care of the family. 

Her loan will be used to buy an oven for her pastry business. Preparing the pastries herself and in larger quantities will enable her to increase her profit. For the coming months she plans to reinvest most of the profit to establish her business.

loans.use: to buy an oven for her pastry business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria M. is from the village of Rang-ay, Dagatkidavao, Valencia City, Bukidnon. She is 21 years old and married. Maria owns and operates a business  providing motorela or habal-habal services to local community members. Maria has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2011, Maria joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the service. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Maria from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools needed for maintenance

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es: Miguel Ángel M. E. de treinta y cinco años de edad vive en Lourdes en el departamento de La Libertad. El posee una tienda en su residencia desde hace mas de tres años, la cual le ayuda a solventar las necesidades de su hogar. Su tienda es muy reconocida por las personas pues siempre encuentran lo que necesitan además el lugar es muy higiénico y en el les ofrece muy buen servicio. Miguel es un hombre que se esmera por salir adelante y por ello además de la tienda ofrece servicio de transporte cuando lo requieren sus mismos clientes de la tienda. La demanda en su tienda por parte de sus clientes ha sido más frecuente, es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar más productos como cereales, lácteos, bebidas, productos enlatados entre otros. Miguel es un hombre de metas y espera que su negocio le permita cumplirlas además le dé un futuro mejor y más seguro económicamente.
texts.en:
Miguel Ángel M. E. is 35 years old and lives in Lourdes, in La Libertad department.  He has a store in his home which he has had for more than three years.  His business helps him to cover his household needs.  Miguel's store is very well known because people can always find what they need there, it is very hygienic and he offers very good customer service.

Miguel is a man who goes to a lot of trouble to get ahead in life and, for this reason, he also offers a transport service whenever the customers who shop in his store require it.   Miguel's customer demand has increased and so he is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to buy more products such as cereals, dairy products, drinks, canned goods, etc.  Miguel is a man who has goals to achieve and he hopes that his business will allow him achieve these goals and also provide him with a better and more financially-secure future.

loans.use: to buy cereals, dairy products, drinks and canned goods

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Patrick

texts.fr: Patrick M. a un studio photo, et client d’ACB depuis 2009.  Il a 28 ans, il est célibataire, né au Rwanda, Patrick a fini  G1 en journalisme.  Ce crédit est son 2 eme cycle avec ACB, et il va utiliser son prêt pour acheter deux appareils pour son studio.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est de chercher les appareils performants et modernes pour améliorer les qualités de services qu’il offre.  Il voudrait s’autofinancer, et aussi chercher comment peut-il se marier ainsi fonder sa propre famille.
texts.en: Patrick M. owns a photo studio. He has been a customer of the microfinance institution ACB since 2009. He is 28 years old, is single, and was born in Rwanda. Patrick studied journalism at the university until level G1. This is his second loan cycle with ACB. He will use the loan to buy two cameras for his studio. His strategy for growth is to buy high-performing and modern equipment in order to improve the quality of his service. His goal is to become self-financing, and also to look for ways how to get married and start his own family.

loans.use: to buy two cameras for his photo studio.

loans.name: Sodnomdarjaa

texts.en: Sodnomdarjaa Z. is 41 years old, married, and has two children, both of whom attend school. They live in a rented apartment in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. He manages a grocery trading business with the help of his wife. He started his business in 2010.  In addition, he operates taxi service business in order to supplement his family's income. Generally, his wife is responsible for the grocery trading business. Sodnomdarjaa is serious man who says, "I am planning to have my own house with the savings." He is requesting a loan for 2,750,000 MNT, which he will use to purchase a plot of land to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase a plot of land to build a house

loans.name: Ronald

texts.es:
Ronald es vecino del cimarrón en Cartago. El se ha dedicado toda su vida a la agricultura. 
Sin embargo el ha decidido que quiere probar también en la Industria de la leche. Los lácteos es una de sus pasiones es por eso que él desea un préstamo de  500 000 (quinientos mil colones) para la compra de una vaca lechera, con la que podrá empezar su proyecto lechero.
El desea mejorar sus ingresos, y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
Ronald e  socio de la Empresa de Crédito comunal Nuevas Esperanzas para Cimarrón una de las 110 empresas socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Ronald is neighbor in the Cimarrón community of Cartago.  He has dedicated his whole life to agriculture. 
Even so, he has decided that he wants to try out the dairy industry.  Dairy is one of his passions, and that is why he is requesting a loan of 500,000 (five-hundred thousand colones (($1025 USD)) ).  He wants to purchase a dairy cow with which he can start his dairy project.
Ronald wants to improve his earnings and to offer his family a better quality of life.
Ronald is a member of the communal Credit Union "Nuevas Esperanzas para Cimarrón," (New hopes for Cimarrón), one of the 110 business partners of EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Baljidmaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Baljidmaa is 36 years old, lives with her husband and 3 children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her eldest 2 children attend a local secondary school and the youngest one stays at home. 

Baljidmaa runs a secondhand clothes-selling business during the summer season and a timber and charcoal business during the wintertime. Her husband works for public service, but during his free time he helps in his wife’s business. Baljidmaa has been running this business since 2009 and now she is planning to focus solely on her secondhand clothing business. The used clothes come from abroad from developed countries. 

She is planning to do some renovation to her work place, which she is renting. She also wants to increase her inventory by buying more clothes. The loan she is taking will be used to buy more secondhand clothes to sell and to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy more secondhand clothes for resale

loans.name: Ariunaa

texts.en:
Ariunaa is 42 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a house in Tuv province, Mongolia. Her older son is a student while the younger three attend secondary school.

She manages a tire repair business in her town, with the help of her husband. She started her business in 2005 and gained much experience. In addition, she also conducts a welding service at her workshop. Her workshop is located near the main road of her province. Therefore, she has been able to build a strong customer base. During the summertime, her children help with the family business.

She is planning to operate a car wash service, too. She is a polite woman who says, "All I want is to get my children educated and to be better people." She is requesting a 400,000 MNT loan to purchase cleaning products for her car wash business.

loans.use: to purchase cleaning products

loans.name: Kholmurod

texts.ru: Холмурод проживает в районе Восеъ. Ему 63 года. Он женат. У него 6 детей. Его жена занимается торговлей парфюмерии. Сам Холмурод имеет средне - специальное образование, он шофер. По специальности он проработал 5 лет. Сейчас Холмурод занимается растениеводством. Он арендует участок земли, где сеет пшеницу. Целью получения кредита является закуп минеральных удобрений для повторного посева пшеницы.
texts.en: Kholmurod lives in Vose.  He is 63 years old, married, and has six children.  His wife sells perfume.  Kholmurod has a vocational education as a driver.  He worked in his profession for five years.  Now he farms.  He rents a plot of land where he grows wheat.  He is taking out a loan to buy mineral fertilizer for a second wheat harvest.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer for a second wheat harvest.

loans.name: Ma.neniere

texts.en:
Ma.Neniere is married with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ma.Neniere is 50 years old and has two children who are in school.

Ma.Neniere has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Ma.Neniere requested a 12,000 Philippines pesos loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to customers.

Ma.Neniere has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Ma.Neniere would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Bwanda Bakyara Kwetungura Group B

texts.en:
34-year-old Enid is a retail businesswoman who plies her trade in Rukungiri town in western Uganda. The mother of three began her business 10 years ago with savings from her farming business. The farming business, which she runs on the side, is pivotal to her business in the sense that she reinvests most of her food sales profits into her retail business. This means she constantly restocks her retail business with commodities when demand is high at her shop and when she is running short on commodities. This is one factor that helps her business stand in such a good stead and makes her confident about the future prospects of her trade. This, in combination with her diligence and will power, are sure shot winning calling cards. Enid also does some goat and pig husbandry. Monthly, she says, this business generates her sales revenue totaling up to Ugandan shillings 150,000.
With this Kiva loan, Enid says she is going to purchase more retail commodities such as sugar, salt, cooking oil, maize flour, etc to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more retail commodities such as sugar, salt, cooking oil, maize flour, etc to sell

loans.name: Heremakono V Group

texts.fr:
Les sept  femmes du groupe HEREMAKONO V sont  toutes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent  toutes dans des familles polygames à Nogonlon, l’un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, MAMINE, la première personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des debout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du marché de Baou, de Koula, de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 65 000F CFA en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
The seven women of the HEREMAKONO V group are all married with an average age of 30 and on average three children. They all live in polygamous families in Nogonlon, one of the villages of the rural commune of Banco, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region, second administrative region of Mali. 

They collaborate with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to better organize their activities at the beginning of the rainy season. The crops they cultivate are, among others, rice and peanuts. They are on their first loan with Soro Yiriwaso.

With this first loan, MAMINE, standing first on the left, intends to buy farm inputs and small equipment, and pay the fees for plowing to maintain 0.5 hectares of rice and peanuts. 

The crops are sold at the markets of Baou, Koula, Banco and N’Golobougou, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women. Mamine expects to make an average profit of 65,000 F CFA at the end of the crop season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide and small equipment.

loans.name: Modesta

texts.en: Modesta is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. Modesta has a sari-sari store or retail shop that sells a variety of products like canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for seven years. She requested a loan for PHP 25,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. Modesta has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Modesta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Omar

texts.en: Omar is a 37-year-old Lebanese married man and the father of two school-aged children. He has owned a car repair shop since 2000 and has more than 15 years of work experience in the same field. He is specialized in repairing all types of vehicles. Today, he is asking to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase car spare parts with the intention of better serving his clients. He is looking to diversify his business and open a new shop where he can buy and sell car spare parts. His income is needed to help support his wife and two young children.

loans.use: to purchase car spare parts.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is 61 years old, a mixed crop farmer, and she is married to Philip who is also a farmer. They are blessed with one child aged 32 years. She has been in the farming business for the past ten years with the monthly income of KES 10,000 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Hannah will use the loan to buy farm manure and seedlings for her farm. 

With the anticipated profit, she will venture into the pig-keeping business. Her hope is to own a large pig farm which will help her raise the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To buy manure and seedlings for her farm.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is a business woman, age 57, and blessed with four children. For the last 6 years, she has been managing a butcher shop to bring up the family. She has employed one person to assist her in the business. Previously, she used to run a retail shop. In the next 5 years, she wants to open another outlet of her business. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to buy a cow for slaughter.

loans.use: To buy a cow for slaughter

loans.name: May Ann

texts.en:
May Ann is 21 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

May Ann has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for 11,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.
 
May Ann has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, May Ann hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Arman

texts.en:
Arman is 28 years old. He is single and lives with his parents in Vanadzor city. His brother lives and works in the Russian Federation and shares the expenses of his family in Armenia. 

For more than 4 years Arman has been building and selling brick ovens, fireplaces and barbecue braziers. His work is in high demand and he is famous as a brick maker in the province of Lori marz. He has orders from Vanadzor and different nearby cities. 

Arman is very fond of his profession and, thanks to brick construction, he is able to take care of a family himself, so as he confessed he decided to marry in the near future. 

Arman is asking from Kiva a 300,000 AMD loan to buy a new multifunctional tool (machine) for his brick activity.

loans.use: To buy a new multifunctional tool (machine)

loans.name: 01.05.02 Đông Sơn Thanh Hoa Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hiền works in agriculture raising poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Hiền is 52 years old and married with one child.

Hiền is the group leader of the 02 Đông Sơn solidarity group, which consists of four members. 

She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with one dependent.

In 2010, Hiền joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hiền has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hiền has been involved in this business for three years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

In the future, Hiền hopes to remodel her house, for her children to find a good job, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase poultry to raise

loans.name: Wendtoin Group

texts.fr:
Mme Rihanata est le responsable du groupe WENDTOIN. Mariée, elle est mère de 3 enfants. Le plus âgé a 15ans et le moins âgé a 4ans.2 vont a l’école et elle a 4 personnes en charge.

Elle est coiffeuse depuis 09ans. Mme s’approvisionne au marché de bissighin.Ses clients sont les femmes, les filles.

Elle veut s’acheter  02 douzaines  de mèche outré, 02 douzaines  de laine et 10 sachets de perle.

Mme économise ses bénéfices s’acheter une moto. Elle ambitionne  ouvrir un grand salon de coiffure.
texts.en:
Madame Rihanata is the leader of the group WENDTOIN. She is married and is the mother to 3 children ranging in age from 4 to 15. Two of her children are in school, and she supports 4 other people.  

She has been a hair stylist for 9 years. She buys supplies in the Bissighin market. Her customers are women and children. 

She wants to buy 2 dozen bags of hair extensions, 2 dozen bags of wool and 10 bags of beads. Madame is saving her earnings to buy a motorcycle. She would like to open a large hair salon.

loans.use: to buy 2 dozen bags of hair extensions, 2 dozen bags of wool, and 10 bags of beads

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
La señora Ana tiene 51 años y vive con sus dos hijas en el municipio de Arizona. Ana es madre soltera y sus hijas tienen 17 y 19 años de edad y ellas están estudiando. 

La señora Ana empezó vendiendo ropa, perfumería y cosméticos hace 10 años. Empezó vendiendo productos Avon y prendas que ella misma fabricaba. Con las ganancias obtenidas, ella fue invirtiendo para fortalecer su negocio. Ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijas. Hoy en día, ella dedica 6 horas diarias  a la venta de ropa y productos por catalogo. 

Doña Ana ha solicitado 3 créditos con ODEF y ha logrado surtir el negocio y ofrecer una amplia diversidad de productos a su clientela. Solicitó este crédito de L11,700 para surtir su inventario con ropa usada, ropa nueva, lociones, cremas y cosméticos. Su sueño es que sus hijas logren graduarse.
texts.en:
Señora Ana is 51 years old, and lives with her two daughters in the town of Arizona.  Ana is a single mother, and her two daughters, aged 17 and 19, are attending school.

Señora Ana began selling clothing, perfume, and cosmetics ten years ago.  She began by selling Avon products and clothing items that she made herself.  With the earnings she gained, she was able to invest in strengthening her business.  She has been able to move her daughters ahead in life.  Today, she works six hours daily selling clothing and items from a catalog.

Doña Ana has requested three loans from ODEF, and has been able to stock up her business and offer a wide variety of products to her customers.  She requested this loan of L11,700 to stock up her inventory with second-hand clothing, new clothing, creams and cosmetics.

Her dream is for her daughters to be able to graduate.

loans.use: to purchase second-hand clothing, new clothing, lotions, creams and cosmetics.

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es:
La señora Basilia cuenta con 42 años de edad, está casada con el señor Arnulfo quien es campesino, tienen 3 hijos, de los cuales solo enrique y Eduardo estudian, cursan primer año de prepa y segundo año de secundaria ya que el mayor está casado, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de quesos, desde hace mas de 3 años.
Dice que inicio con esta actividad, ya que quería poyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y la educación de sus hijos, también para mejorar un poco su nivel de vida y contar con una solvencia económica más estable, y así poder vivir cómodamente, el crédito que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra de mas insumos como son: leche, sal y cuajo. 
El sueño más grande que tiene doña Basilia es el de poder hacer crecer aun mas su negocio, y ampliarlo, para así tener una mejor producción y surtido puesto que así incrementara un poco mas sus ganancias. 
Esta muy agradecida con fundación realidad y los prestatarios de kiva, por toda la ayuda y la confianza que le están ofreciendo, ya que gracias al apoyo recibido su vida ha cambiado mucho al igual que su negocio.
texts.en:
Basilia 42, is married to Arnulfo, who is a farmer. They have three children. Only Enrique and Eduardo are in school; one in first year of high school, and the other in the second year of junior high school. Their eldest son is married. 

She has been making and selling cheese for three years. She says that she started this business, as she wanted to help her husband with the expenses for the household and their children's education. She also wanted to improve her standard of living a bit, have more financial stability, and so be able to live comfortably.  

She is going to use the loan she received to buy more ingredients, such as milk, salt, and curds. Basilia's greatest dream is to make her business grow even more, and expand it. This way she can have better production and selection, and in this way increase her earnings a bit more. 

She is very thankful to Fundación Realidad and to the Kiva lenders for all the help they are providing, and for their trust in her. Thanks to the support she has received, her life has changed a lot, and so has her business.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients such as milk, salt, and curds.

loans.name: Sivorn's Group

texts.en:
Married with four dependent children, Sivorn is a 28-year-old peasant. For ten years, she has been planting maize to feed her family, and her husband is a mechanic in the village. 

Sivorn now leads a group of two female members. This is her first loan, while her group member has been with VisionFund for one year. For the harvest season, she is applying for a loan with VisionFund. She will use this loan to hire workers to harvest her maize crop. She hopes to increase her crop and earn more income to continue improving her standard of living.

loans.use: to hire workers to harvest her maize crop

loans.name: El Suspiro Group

texts.es:
El Grupo El suspiro esta integrado por 14 persona cada uno de ellos con una actividad economica, esta grupo se encuantra hubicado en una comunidad que se caracteriza por tener un clima calido y esta rodeado de huleras(arboles de hule).

La señora dulce maria tiene la edad de 24 años, solo estudio hasta es tercer grado de secundaria y esta casada con el señor alejandro, ellos tienen un hijo de solo un mes de nacido. Doña Dulce Maria nos platica que hace un poco mas de dos años decidio abrir un pequeño negocio de venta de refacciones  para bicicletas y automovil para ganar un poco de dinero extra y ayudar a sus esposo con los gastos del hogar, ella dice que Gracias a Dios le ha hido muy bien ya que es la unica refaccionaria de la comunidad y las ventas son buenas. ella invertira su credito en la compra refaciones para bicicletas y automovil para resurtir su negocio. ella espera que con esta inversion su negocio prospere  y sus ganancias aumenten para continuar invirtiendo en su negocio ya que en un futuro le gustaria que su hijo tenga la oportunidad de estudiar.

los demas miembros del grupo son:
 
esperanza refrescos
martha refrescos
venernda costura
emilia antojitos
minerva ropa 
herminia antojitos 
maria del carmen refrescos
maria isabel abarrotes 
ofelia refrescos 
reyna venta de catalago 
maxiimo pescado
eugenia antojitos 
irma refrescos
texts.en:
The El Suspiro communal bank is comprised of 14 people.  Each one of them has a business activity.  The group is located in a community that is known for having a warm climate and for being surrounded by rubber trees.

Dulce Maria, age 24, only went to school up to the third year of secondary school.  She is married to Alejandro, and they have a son who is only one month old.

Dulce Maria tells us that a little over two years ago she decided to open a small business selling spare parts for bicycles and automobiles.  She did this to earn a little extra money and to help her husband with the household expenses.  Thank God that it has gone very well for her.  She has the only spare parts business in the community, and sales have been good. 

She will use her loan to buy spare parts for bicycles and automobiles in order to restock her business.  She hopes to prosper from this investment in her business.  She also hopes to increase her income in order to continue investing in her business.

In the future she would like her son to have the opportunity to go to school.

The other members of the group are:

Esperanza:  soft drinks
Martha:  soft drinks
Venernda:  sewing
Emilia:  snacks
Minerva:  clothes
Herminia: snacks
Maria del Carmen: soft drinks
Maria Isabel:  groceries
Ofelia: soft drinks
Reyna:  catalog sales
Maxiimo: fish
Eugenia: snacks
Irma: soft drinks

loans.use: to buy spare parts for bicycles and automobiles.

loans.name: Linder

texts.es:
Linder de 21 años de edad, convive con Mayra con quien tiene a Lincoln de 10 meses de nacido, su único hijo. Ellos viven en una casa propia en la comunidad nativa San Román Bajo en el distrito de Perené, provincia de Chanchamayo. Desde que se enteró que sería padre, Linder se dedica a la agricultura. Es así que siembra café y maíz.  Con el café ha ganado mucha experiencia y ya conoce compradores para su próxima cosecha, que es anual. En cambio, el maíz se cosecha cada 4 meses. Ambos productos los comercializa en la ciudad de Pichanaki.
“El kilo de café lo estoy vendiendo a 11 soles, pero en junio sube hasta 14, me conviene mucho”, afirma.
Linder tiene muchas metas trazadas, su hijo es uno de sus más grandes motores. Quiere seguir trabajando para brindarle un hogar decente, una educación eficiente. Para ello invertirá más en el campo, por que sabe como hacerlo y las ventajas que trae cuidar constantemente sus cultivos.
Piensa alquilar un terreno para sembrar más café, pero eso lo realizará dentro de 1 año. Éste sería su primer préstamo de MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. A la vez muestra entusiasmo al pertenecer a “La Bella Durmiente”, su banco comunal, del que se siente esperanzado.
Con el dinero del préstamo podrá adquirir bolsas de abonos orgánicos para la renovación (cambio o enriquecimiento de tierras) de una parte de sus sembríos de café.
texts.en:
Linder is 21 years old. He lives with Mayra, with whom he has Lincoln, who is 10 months old, his only child. They live in their own home in the native community of San Román Bajo in the Perené district, province of Chanchamayo. Since he found out that he was going to be a father, Linder has worked in farming. He plants corn and coffee. With the coffee he has gained a lot of experience and he already knows buyers for his next harvest, which is yearly. On the other hand, the corn is harvested every 4 months. Both products are sold in the city of Pichanaki.

“I am selling a kilo of coffee for 11 soles, but in June it goes up to 14, it's very good for me," he affirms. Linder has a lot of goals and his son is his biggest motivation. He wants to keep working to offer him a decent home and an effective education. For that, he will invest more in the field, because he knows how to do it and the advantages that taking care of his crops brings.  

He plans on renting land to plant more coffee, but he will do this within a year.
