This is his first loan with MFP, and he is committed to making his payments on time. he is enthusiastic about belonging to "La Bella Durmiente" [Sleeping Beauty], his communal bank, which has given him a lot of optimism. With the money from the loan, he will be able to buy bags of organic fertilizer for renovation (change or enrichment of the land) for a part of his coffee crop.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Samia

texts.en: Samia is a 44-year-old married woman from Al Zarqa, Amman, Jordan who has four dependents. She is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to repaint her home and expand it. She hopes that in the future she will own a home that her family can live in.

loans.use: to pay for home improvements

loans.name: Virgen De Schoensttat Group

texts.es:
El grupo se denomina Virgen de Schoensttat, las integrantes viven en Ciudad del Este está en su ciclo número 3. Las integrantes están dentro del programa de eliminación de pobreza y con ello han mejorado mucho sus vidas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Mirta, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel dos. A través del esfuerzo y su trabajo continuo ella se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza. Se dedica a la venta de remedios naturales. Es un trabajo muy sacrificado, pero ella lo hace para poder ayudar a su familia.
Solicita de este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de hierbas medicinales para la venta y así seguir teniendo los medios para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
This group is called Virgen de Schoensttat, its members live in Ciudad del Este and they are working their 3rd cucle. They take part in the poverty elimination program, thanks to which they have greatly improved their standard of living.
Mirta is a member of this group, and her latest survey indicated that she is within a Level 2 poverty stage. By working constantly and thanks to her efforts she is improving her poverty status. She engages in selling natural remedies, a very demanding activity she nonetheless carries out in order to help her family.
She is requesting a loan to buy medicinal herbs to sell, in order to keep on earning what she needs to support her family.

loans.use: To buy medicinal herbs to sell.

loans.name: Mercedes Monserrate

texts.es:
EL Grupo Crédito San Pedro De Pueblo que se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Pueblo Nuevo del Cantón Santa Ana, lugar de gente honesta y dedicada a las faenas del campo y a la ganadería, con bellos paisajes campestres y gente amable.
En este lugar vive la señora Mercedes, tiene 49 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esa relación tiene 4 hijos mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun vive en su casa. Su marido es comerciante.
Doña Mercedes junto a su esposo tienen una  tienda de víveres en su casa donde venden todo tipo de víveres, granos, carnes, legumbres, lácteos, aguas, gas de uso domestico, así como también artículos de bazar y papelería, su negocio es muy concurrido ya que cuentan con muy  buena clientela que han podido conseguir en el transcurso del tiempo que llevan con su negocio, allí trabajan junto al esposo y sus hijos cuando ellos los visitan, llevan más de 30 años con este negocio el cual lo han ido mejorando con el paso del tiempo y mucho mas después de recibir los créditos.
Este crédito es para surtir aún más su tienda, vas a comprar toda clase de víveres. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por los beneficios y ayuda que le brinda la institución. Sus sueños son seguir aumentando su negocio.
texts.en:
The San Pedro de Pueblo Credit Group meets every fifteen days in the parish of Pueblo Nuevo in the Sana Ana Canton, a place where there are honest, friendly people who work in farming and livestock-raising, and beautiful country landscapes.

Señora Mercedes lives here. She is 49 years old, and she has a common-law marriage. She has four grown children from this relationship, one of whom is still living at home. Her husband is a businessman.  Doña Mercedes and her husband have a grocery store in their house where they sell all types of groceries: grains, meat, legumes, dairy products, water, and gas for domestic use, as well as household items and stationery. 

Their business is very busy, as they have very good customers that they have been able to acquire throughout the time that they have had their business.  Her children work there with her husband whenever they come to visit. They have had this business for more than 30 years, and it has been improving with the passage of time, and much more so after receiving the loans.

This loan is for stocking the store even more. They are going to purchase all kinds of groceries. She has been in the credit group since the beginning, and she likes it for the benefits and the help that the institution gives her. Her dream is to continue increasing her business

loans.use: to purchase groceries.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles a 49-year-old hardworking married man who lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. He used his previous loan to buy seedlings and fertilizers for his banana farm. He deals in pig rearing alongside rentals to earn extra income. He started this business so as to improve the standards of living of his family. 

He hopes to complete the sanitation of the pigsty; however, his main challenge is bad weather, especially the rainy season when there is a lot of mud and the pigs are affected by diseases. 

Charles will use the loan facility to buy building materials to improve the sanitation for the pigsty.

loans.use: to buy building materials to improve the sanitation for the pigsty.

loans.name: Tubehoneza Sub Group A

texts.en: Divine is a group leader; aged 34 years.She is married with 2 children aged 2 and 8 years. The group is called TUBEHONEZA means “GOOD LIVING” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business for changing their better future. She has a shop and has been running in a business for 7 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school of her children.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice for sale.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 48 years old married with three children. She is a dedicated member of Gondo Women Group being the Vice chairperson and a leader in her Anglican Church.

Currently all her children are in high school causing her to strain because of the associated school fees. She pays USD520 per term thus requiring that she secure a loan every year. She had a loan of USD225 and has cleared it, paying it back promptly.

She grows tea leaves, vegetables and she has dairy cows. She has been able to meet the basic needs of her family through the income she gets from her farm. She puts effort in applying manure in her farm and buying the right feeds for her animals to maintain high produce. On average, she gets USD225 per month from selling some of her farm produce.

loans.use: Susan wants to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Abdullayev

texts.en: A. is from Agsu town, and is a low-income person. He is married and has 2 children. He started business 4 years ago. He first borrowed from Normicro Agsu branch $300 in 2005 and developed his business. Now he applies for $650 to expand his business.

loans.use: business expansion

loans.name: Orepa

texts.en: Orepa is a 38-year old single mother with two children.  Her husband lives overseas and failed to support her and her children as promised.  She was left to struggle on her own to support her children.  She joined the SPBD program to find a means to provide for her family.  In Samoa, women and men wear bright patterned fabrics, and Orepa had the idea to start a tye-dye business where she makes beautifully patterned fabrics (worn sarong-style by women and men) for both locals and tourists.  With the income from her business, she is able to provide the basic necessities for her children and keep current with their school fees.  Orepa is very proud of herself (as is SPBD) for being a dedicated single mother and a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: Purchase extra goods for upcoming events

loans.name: Aracely

texts.es:
Aracely is a hard working, responsible woman. She and her partner have two daughters, ages 11 and 13, and a 9 year old son. Because their father’s income has not been enough to cover all of the household expenses, 3 years ago Aracely began selling produce and groceries in order to bring in some extra income. Though she started with just a few products, as her sales have increased she has been able to expand her business.

Demand for her products has increased lately, and Aracely is asking for a $1,100 loan to fill the need by purchasing additional merchandise. She has agreed to pay the loan in 6 months. You can be part of Aracely’s success by helping today to improve this family’s life.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer.

Aracely es una mujer muy responsable y trabajadora. Ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijas de 11 y 13 años de edad y un hijo de 9 años. El ingreso que su pareja aporta al hogar resultaba insuficiente para cubrir todos los gastos, así que para poder obtente un ingreso extra, Aracely inició con la venta de frutería y abarrotes hace tres años, comenzó con muy pocos productos pero, gracias a que sus ventas cada vez fueron mejorando, ha logrado hacer crecer su negocio.

La demanda por sus productos se ha incrementado mucho en esta temporada y para poder cubrirla, Aracely solicita un préstamo de $ 1,100 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Forma parte de los logros de Aracely, hoy es momento de ayudar, decídete a mejorar la vida de esta familia.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Alexandra

texts.es:
Business Description

Alexandra began her business twelve years ago. She manufactures garments for women, men and children, such as slacks and trousers, blouses, T-shirts, and leg warmers. She gives her customers personal attention every day, from nine in the morning until six in the evening.

Purpose of the Loan

She would use the loan to buy a machine that attaches snaps and clasps to clothing and also to buy fabric from which to make outfits. In this way, she hopes to offer a greater variety of products to her clients.

About the Applicant

Alexandra is 32. She is a single mother. Her husband left her nine years ago. She lives with her parents, and she has a space for her workshop there. She employs another single mother with a three-year-old daughter. She used her own capital to start her business. She hopes to improve herself and her business and in this way give her parents more help with household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio Padial, Kiva Volunteer

Descripción del Negocio

Alexandra inicio su negocio ladies' undergarments hace 12 años. Los productos que elabora son: Prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños como pantalones, blusas, camisetas, calentadores. La atención de su clientela la realiza de manera personal todos los días desde las 9am-a -6pm.

Uso del Préstamo

Alexandra necesita del préstamo para invertir en la compra de una maquina para pegar broches y también adquirir telas para elaborar conjuntos de vestir. De esta manera ofrecer nueva variedad de productos a sus clientes.

Información Personal

Alexandra tiene 32años. Es madre soltera .Su esposo la abandono hace 9 años. Tiene 1 hija que está estudiando .vive en la casa de sus padres .Ocupando un espacio para su taller .Alexandra proporciona empleo a otra madre soltera que tiene una niña de 3 años. Inicio su negocio con capital propio. Aspira mejorar y crecer junto con su negocio. Para de esta manera lograr brindar una mejor ayuda a su hogar y a sus padres.

loans.use: To buy tools for her sewing business

loans.name: Fetaiai

texts.en: Fetaiai is 42 years old, is married and has 5 children. The family has lived on their plantation for ages as it is their only source of income. Fetaiai heard of SPBD through the women in the village. She is thankful for the opportunity given to her because she can use the loan money to buy tools that are needed on the plantation. Fetaiai is planning to open a farm stand in her village where she could sell her crops.

loans.use: To buy equipment for her plantation

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George M. is a 27 year-old man who is married with one child. He lives on the outskirts of Nairobi in a town called Mlolongo. He has no other dependents. In the year 2005, he was employed by a Property Management Company. His employment there didn’t last for long; unfortunately, the company collapsed and George had nothing else to do other than to go home. With the salary that he was earning, George had managed to save Ksh 20000 (USD 286) which he used to start a barbershop business. He used the money to buy a shaving machine.

After some time, he noticed that people had a problem communicating since not everybody owned a mobile phone. With the earnings that he made, he bought a community phone in order to curb this situation. The business thrived, but, due to a lack of funds to support the business, it almost collapsed. He used his own talents and skills of patience and hard work and started repairing spoiled mobile phones, selling blank CD’s and selling scratch cards. After a period of six months, his business started booming and customers started flowing into his shop. The problems that George faced after losing his job made him innovative.

George now wants to expand his business and wants to buy two shaving machines, one smoother, and also a photocopying machine. The total amount is $450. He believes that, if this loan is given to him, he will be able to boost his business and attract more customers. From the increase in profits, he will be able to better provide for his family and educate his child.

The repayment period for his loan will be 8 months.

loans.use: To purchase two shaving machines, one smoother, and a second-hand photocopying machine.

loans.name: Umed

texts.ru:
Umed S. is 22 years old, has a high school education and is a bachelor. He will use his loan to purchase young livestock. He will fatten the livestock and resell it every 20-25 days. Umed will use his revenues to purchase new livestock to feed.

This business will help Umed to earn a living as it is currently hard to find a well paying job. He will pay back the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Собиров Умед, возраст 22 года, образование среднее, семейное положение - холост. На полученный кредит он хочет приобрести несколько голов крупного и мелкого рогатого скота. Он будет откармливать скот и продавать через каждые 20-25 дней. На вырученные деньги он будет приобретать новое поголовье мелкого и крупного рогатого скота. Так как в настоящее время трудно найти хорошо оплачиваемую работу, таким образом он будет иметь возможность зарабатывать небольшие денежные средства на содержание своей семьи. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase livestock

loans.name: Aleksey

texts.ru:
Aleksey K., 24, is married and has 1 child. Aleksey sells spare parts. For that he rents a small store in Kurgan-Tyube. Aleksey has been in business for 2 years. He plans to use this loan to increase inventory of spare parts in his store. Aleksey plans to repay the loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Кононюк Алексей, возраст – 24 года, образование среднее, женат, имеет 1-го ребёнка. Алексей занимается торговлей запчастей. Для этого он арендует небольшой магазин в городе Курган-Тюбе. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже в течение 2 лет. Полученный кредит он хочет использовать на приобретение запчастей для автомобиля. Этот кредит поможет ему увеличить ассортимент продаваемого товара, а местные владельцы транспортных средств будут иметь возможность приобрести необхдимые запчасти для своих автомобилей. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 6 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase assortment of the goods sold

loans.name: Porfidia

texts.en:
Porfidia is 38 years old. She has two stands in the central market where she sells meet, which is supported by her buying of cattle locally, and she also sells Herbalife products. Her family is comprised of 5 people, her, her husband, and 3 kids 16,12, and 7. Porfidia has more than 17 years of experience in her various activities, for which the competition does not have much impact given that she has a fixed clientele that appreciates her business. Her prices are relative and vary according to the market of supply and demand. She also has a good credit history.

Translated by James Lombardo, Kiva volunteer

Porfidia tiene 38 años de edad. Tiene dos puestos en el mercado central de Warnes donde vende carne, paralelamente también realiza la comercialización de ganado vacuno en la zona, por otra parte trabaja con productos de Herbalife. Su familia está compuesta por 5 personas, ella su esposo y sus tres hijos de 16, 12, y 7 años respectivamente. Porfidia tiene más de 17 años de experiencia en sus variadas actividades, por lo que si bien la competencia es media la misma no le afecta mucho debido a que cuenta con clientela fija que aprecia su trato al cliente. Los precios son relativos que varian de acuerdo al mercado de la oferta y demanda. Tiene muy buenos antecedentes crediticios.

loans.use: Capital for work

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Maria Auxiliadora is married, 36 years old, and has two children who are 10 and 18 years old. Her husband is a taxi driver. Maria Auxiliadora is a hairstylist and cosmetologist and has her own beauty salon. She also works on an on-call basis. She started her business as a hairstylist and her biggest desire is to set up a whole beauty salon with all the products that she needs for her customers. Maria Auxiliadora is asking for a loan in order to buy the equipment and beauty products necessary to start the expansion of her business and for her growth as a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Veronica MR, Kiva volunteer

Doña Maria Auxiliadora tiene 36 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos de 18 y 10 años. Su esposo es taxista. Ella es estilista y cosmetóloga, y posee un salón de belleza pero también hace trabajos a domicilio. Inició su actividad cortando cabellos, su deseo es poder poner un salon de belleza completo con todos los productos necesarios para ofrecer. Solicita el crédito para comprar equipos y productos de belleza para empezar así su creciemiento tanto profesional como del negocio

loans.use: To buy equipment and beauty products

loans.name: Giovanna Del Rosario

texts.es:
Giovanna used her own money to start a bakery business. She is 45 years old and lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood of Managua. She's married and has 3 beautiful children, 2, 7 and 15. She and her husband, who is in Costa Rica, are saving money to educate their kids and make on-going improvements to their house. With the loan she is going to replace the roof so that water doesn't pour in during the winter and finish the house's porch.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Giovanna es una mujer que comenzó trabajando con su propio dinero haciendo repostería, ubicaba a sus clientes, ella tiene 45 años de edad y vive en los laureles sur es casada tiene 3 hermosos hijos de 2, 7, y 15 años. Con la ayuda de su esposo que esta en Costa Rica es ahorrar dinero para la educación de sus hijos, y seguir haciendo mejoras en su vivienda con el negocio quiere establecer una venta de cosmético y repostería en un puesto fijo bien ubicado. Con el préstamo va hacer cambio del techo para que no se le pase el agua en el invierno y concluir el porche de su casa.

loans.use: Replace roof.

loans.name: Dara Salam 2007-2 Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Diana E.. Diana is 35 years old and is married to a husband who is a businessman.Their four children range in age from 4 to 18 years old and the children go to school. Each week, Diana earns approximately 75 Sudanese pounds ($US 37) in profits from selling bread and, with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to expand the business.

Diana is joined in her small group by Hanan J., Suzi S., Hawa J., and Florence A.. Hanan J. sells bread and wants to build a hotel. Suzi S. brews alcoholic beverages and wants a loan to open up a bar. Hawa J. wants to expand her bread-selling business. Florence A. currently sells at a hotel and is requesting a loan for the construction of houses.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand a bread-selling business

loans.name: Lissikatou

texts.fr:
Mrs. Lissikatou H., 28, is married and the mother of three children, of whom two are enrolled in school. She is married to Ernest Fanou, a trained cook who lost his job two years ago. Mrs. Lissikatou H. has lived for 25 years in Xwlacodji, a densely populated neighborhood of Cotonou. For the past 8 years, she sold foodstuffs, especially corn. In view of the evolution of her business, she felt the need to take out a loan. At the beginning of 2008, her daughter Florence had some health problems that caused Mrs. H. to spend all her business capital to save her daughter's life. Despite this very unfortunate situation, she fully reimbursed her last loan. To get her business up and running again, she is again asking for a loan in the amount of US$ 250 to be used for a new project, namely selling cooked food which should be more lucrative because of the current crisis in the food supply.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Dame H. Lissikatou est mariée et mère de trois enfants dont deux sont scolarisés. Agée de 28 ans, elle s’est mariée à FANOU Ernest, cuisinier de profession qui a perdu son emploi il y a deux ans. Dame H. Lissikatou réside à Xwlacodji un quartier populaire de Cotonou depuis 25ans. Elle vendait au départ les produits vivriers surtout le maïs depuis 8ans.Voyant l’évolution de son activité; elle sent la nécessité d’avoir recours au prêt. Au début de l’année 2008 elle a eu des problèmes de santé avec sa fille Florence qui l’ont amené à dépenser tout son capital pour sauver la vie de son enfant. Malgré cette situation combien préjudiciable, elle a remboursé entièrement son dernier prêt. Pour se faire relancer, elle sollicite à nouveau un crédit d’un montant de montant de 100000 Fcfa pour un nouveau projet plus rentable qu’est la restauration à cause de la crise alimentaire actuelle.

loans.use:
Purchase of 25 liters of peanut oil, 5 sacks of charcoal, 1 50-kg sack of corn, 1 sack of rice, a 10-kg sack of dried beans

Achat de 25 litres huile d’arachide, de 5 sacs de charbon, 1 sac maïs de 50 kg, 1 sac de riz, de 10kg de haricot.

loans.name: Thi Dung

texts.vi:
Mrs. N. Thi Dung (ID Number 09050084), 34 years old, has 2 school-going children. Besides farming, she also raises chickens as well as silkworms to get the cocoons and pupa for sale. She has never borrowed from anywhere else, but because she likes the fact that by joining this Fund she can repay the loan on an installment basis, she would like to borrow 2,006,000VND (125 USD) to purchase more silkworms for her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Ngô Thị Dung (MS: 09050084), năm nay 34 tuổi. Chị có hai con còn đang đi học. Chị làm ruộng, nuôi gà mua tơ về cắt kén để bán nhộng, bán kén. Chị Chưa từng vay vốn ở đâu. Nay vì thích hình thức tiết kiệm để hoàn trả của chương trình nên đã tham gia vay 2.006.000 VND để bổ sung vốn mau kén về làm bán.

loans.use: Raising silkworms

loans.name: Halima

texts.en: Halima K. is a Tanzanian entrepreneur who has run her own shop for the last three years. She does business in a place known as Buguruni Mnyamani in Dar-es-Salaam. Halima sells a variety of items, including cereals, and uses her income to meet her family's expenses and pay her children's school fees. She wants to expand her business but money is tight, so she has requested a loan of $900 to make this possible.

loans.use: To expand her business

texts.es:
Janet R. es una de las asociadas que compone el banco Hnos. Unidos de la cual Damaris Santana es asesora. La Sra. Jaset vive en San Pedro de Macorís, tiene 5 hijos a los cuales ama y adora se dedica a la venta de ropas ambulantemente en las calles de San Pedro de Macorís ella ha invertido el dinero que tomó prestado en su negocio con el fin de que el mismo prospere de manera eficaz, Jaset sueña con tener una casa propia donde pueda sentirse confortable con toda su familia y tener su negocio en un local fijo donde puedan asistir los clientes que normalmente le compran su mercancía.

Janet is part of a larger group of 10 men and women; her loan represents the other 9 individuals in her Bank of Hope.  Her group members have businesses in everything ranging from small grocery stores, to fried fish stands, to clothing and shoe sales.

On behalf of Janet, her group, and everyone here at Esperanza International-- we thank you for your support!
texts.en:
Janet Rafeal is one of the members who belongs to the Hnos. Unidos Bank; Damaris Santana is the adviser. Mrs. Janet lives in San Pedro de Macorís and has 5 children, who she loves and adores. She sells clothes through the streets of San Pedro de Macorís. She has invested money, which has borrowed, in her business with the end of having her business prosper in an efficient way. Janet dreams of having her own house, where she can feel comfortable with her whole family and have her business in a fixed location where she can attend to the clients that normally buy her merchandise. Janet is part of a larger group of 10 men and women; her loan represents the other 9 individuals in her Bank of Hope. Her group members have businesses in everything ranging from small grocery stores, to fried fish stands, to clothing and shoe sales. On behalf of Janet, her group, and everyone here at Esperanza International-- we thank you for your support!

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a good variety of clothes to re-sell in her community.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga a sus 26 años tiene a su pequeño de 2 años, quien significa todo para ella. Su esposo Percy la apoya mucho y está de acuerdo con sus decisiones. Ella se dedica a la venta de gelatinas, helados de hielo y chupetes, pertenece a un banco comunal y gracias al apoyo brindado sigue adelante en su negocio, pero eso no es todo, quiere mandar a construir un kiosco para la venta de sus productos y complementarlo con otros productos. Para lograr su objetivo ella estima de un préstamo. Ayuda a esta madre a cumplir con su propósito, ella no te defraudara.
texts.en:
Olga, 26, has a 2-year-old who means everything to her. Her husband Percy helps her a lot and supports her decisions. She sells gelatins, ice creams and lolly pops. She belongs to a communal bank, and thanks to the help provided she is getting ahead in her business. But this is not all: she wants to have a kiosk built for the sale of her products, including additional items. She is considering this loan in order to achieve her objective. Help this mother to accomplish her goal, she will not disappoint you.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To enlarge her business with the construction of a kiosk to sell her products

loans.name: Khanh

texts.vi: Chị Phạm thị Khanh 52 tuổi tham gia vào Quỹ Tình Thương năm 1997. Chị sinh được 3 con, 2 con đã trưởng thành và xây dựng gia đình, 1 con đang sống cùng vợ chồng chị. Những năm đầu vay vốn của Quỹ gia đình chị đã đầu  tư vào chăn nuôi lợn, gà. Thu nhập từ chăn nuôi được gia đình chị tích lũy dần và đầu tư vốn vào buốn bán hoa quả và bánh kẹo, công việc buôn bán của chị rất phát triển thu nhập đều đăn hàng ngày, chồng chị làm nghề xe ôm thu nhập bình quân 70.000đ/ ngày. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 10.000.000đ đầu tư vào buôn bán hoa quả, bánh kẹo.
texts.en:
Ms. P. Thi Danh is 52 years old, and joined the TYM fund in 1997. She has 3 children, 2 are grown and have their own family; the other child is living with her and her husband. During the earlier years with the fund, she invested the loans in raising pigs and chickens. From the money they were able to make raising animals, they saved enough to invest in a shop selling fruits, vegetables and sweets. Her business does very well, making money everyday. Her husband works outside the home, giving rides on his moped, and he makes average 4 USD per day. For this loan, her family wishes to borrow 600 USD to invest in her fruits and vegetables shop.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: Victor vive con su conviviente y sus dos pequeños hijos que están estudiando. Se dedica al transporte de pasajeros desde hace 9 años, y gracias a su buena administración del dinero ahora es propietario de dos motocarros, negocio que le ayuda a fortalecer un poco más la economía de su hogar, lo que le gusta de su trabajo es el trato directo que tiene con sus pasajeros. Además sus motos solo las manejan sus familiares (sus hermanos) y las mantienen bien cuidadas, razón por la cual le va muy bien. Es su primer préstamo con MFP, por lo que se compromete a ser puntual en sus cuotas. Con el dinero solicitado quiere comprar repuestos para mandar a reparar algunas fallas mecánicas de sus motos.
texts.en:
Victor lives with his common-law wife and their two small children who are in school. He has made a living in passenger transportation for the past nine years and thanks to his administration abilities he is now the owner of two motocabs, which has help strengthen his household's finances a bit. What he enjoys about his work is the direct interaction he has with his passengers. Furthermore, the motocab drivers are his brothers and they take good care of them, another reason the business has gone so well. This is his first loan, and he promises to be punctual with his payments. With the money he's requesting, he wants to purchase parts to make some repairs on his motocabs.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase parts for his motocabs

loans.name: Zonia Hilda

texts.en:
Zonia is a member of the Cielo (“Sky”) Village Bank. Zonia is 41 years old and married with five children. She lives in the Chumbes community of Ocros District. She buys tara (a pod used to treat leather) and cochinilla (a cactus used to make dyes for clothing and cosmetics) in different local markets each week and sells them to intermediaries, who take the products to the city of Lima to resell. Sonia also has a store in her home, where she sells dry goods, fruits and vegetables. Sonia needs a loan of 450 soles to buy tara and cochinilla. Sonia’s dreams are to improve her businesses and provide her children with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow

Zonia es socia del Banco Comunal Cielo. Zonia es casada, tiene 41 años y 5 hijos, Sonia vive en la comunidad de Chumbes en el distrito de Ocros, Sonia se dedica a la compra de tara, cochilla, los productos los adquiere en las diferentes ferias a donde viaja 1 vez por semana, luego los comercializa a intermediarios que llevan el producto a la ciudad de Lima. Además Sonia tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes, frutas, verduras. Sonia necesita un préstamo de 450 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de tara y cochinilla. Los sueños de Sonia son mejorar sus negocios, brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Buy local produce such as tara and cochinilla for resale in Lima

loans.name: Ngoem

texts.en: Mrs. Ngoem S. is a farmer in Angk Prasat village in Takeo province. Her husband, Mr. Chhov Moeurn, helps her on the small plantation. They have two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the youngest one is attending the school. Currently, the rice revenue is too small to support her family and pay for her child's education, so she is requesting a loan to pay for the school fees. Her husband is pictured with her.

loans.use: To pay for school

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa A.,48, wife of Elito, and a mother of five children.  Her five children are: Raffy, 25, and Myla, 22, are both high school undergraduates; Maribeth, 20, a graduate of caregiver course; Ryan, 15, a high school student and Jandell, the youngest is13 years old, graduating in the elementary level.  Her family is happily living together in Barangay San Lorenzo Ilagan, Isabela.

Elsa is managing her hog-raising business for years that became her major source of income to provide her children with school allowance and tuition fees.  Aside from hog-raising, her husband is also engaged in charcoal-making for added income that support their farming needs.  However, they still lack financially, thus, Elsa is requesting a loan of PHP5,000 for the feeds supply of their hogs.  She hopes that their businesses will grow for the benefit of their family.

Elsa remains humble and hard working for she believes that these traits will lead to achieve her goals in life.

loans.use: To buy feeds supply

loans.name: Chheng

texts.en: Chheng P. is forty-two years old and resides with her husband in Takeo, Cambodia. To earn a living, she works as a weaver and makes $3 per day. Her husband has worked as a farmer growing rice and vegetables since 1991, and is able to make $2 per day. This couple has three young children. Chheng P. is asking for a loan to purchase silk and other materials to expand her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk.

loans.name: Koeun

texts.en: Koeun S. is 39 years old and she lives in Trapaing Rompak village, in Takeo province.  She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice.  Her husband, Neang Oeun, is a construction worker.  They have five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others attend the local school.  Koeun is requesting a loan to purchase ten piglets to start a pig breeding business.  She will use the rest of money to buy pig food. Her husband is presented in the picture with her.

loans.use: Purchase ten piglets and pig food to start a breeding business.

loans.name: Thérèse

texts.fr:
O. Thérèse est née vers 1974 à Sakété dans le Département du Plateau au Sud du Bénin. Thérèse est mariée à OGOUTCHIBO Bénît. Thérèse est mère de trois enfants dont deux à sa charge; l'ainé Aïhatou vit avec la jeune sœur de Thérèse. Thérèse vend à manger tous les soirs au bord de la voie au quartier PK10 à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Thérèse vend du riz, du haricot, de la pâte de maïs, de la pâte de manioc et de la pâte de causette d'igname. La clientèle de Thérèse est devenue beaucoup plus importante depuis quelques temps et Thérèse n'a pas les moyens financiers nécessaire pour bien répondre à la demande de cette clientèle. C'est pourquoi Thérèse sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé pour pouvoir mieux répondre à la demande de ses clients. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
Thérèse O. was born around 1974 in Sakété in Plateau County in the south of Bénin. Thérèse is married to Bénît Ogoutchibo and is the mother of 3 children, of whom two are still her responsibility. The eldest, Aïhatou, lives with Thérèse's little sister.

Thérèse sells cooked food every evening along the road in the PK10 neighborhood in Cotonou, economic capital of Bénin. She sells rice, beans, maize porridge, manioc porridge, and cocoyam stew. Thérèse 's clientele has grown recently and she does not have the means to respond to the demand of her clientele. This is why she is requesting the help of ALIDé to better cater for the needs of her customers. The significance of ALIDé in the local langauge of Bénin, Fon, is "a pathway always exists for the poorest of the poor". Bénin is a small country in West Africa, next door to Nigeria, where the GDP per inhabitant stands at US$ 1,500.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of sacks of maize, rice, cocoyams and condiments for stew

loans.name: Diouma

texts.fr: Diouma C. est mariée avec 05 enfants  en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Sinthiang Coundara depuis 6 ans. Diouma achète des arachides pour les  transformer en pâte d’arachide et vendre. Elle veut renforcer son commerce pour soutenir son mari dans les charges familiales.
texts.en:
Diouma C. is married and raising 5 children. She has been a member of the village bank of Sinthiang Coundara for 6 years. Diouma buys peanuts to make into peanut butter for sale. She wants to expand her business so as to help her husband support their family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Production and sale of peanut butter

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria E. is 30 years old and married with 4 children. She has a restaurant where she sells cooked foods. She hopes for the loan amount of N 30,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Miguel tiene 27 años, vive con su madre y su hermana en la casa de sus padres. Todos los días, desde que tuvo 8 años, sale por las mañanas a vender periódicos, ofreciendo a sus clientes diversas opciones. Junto a su madre, desde las 4 de la madrugada adquieren los periódicos para repartirlos en los diferentes puestos de venta que están ubicados en una de las calles más céntricas de su ciudad y abastecer su propio puesto. Adicionalmente, vende revistas, folletos, y los fascículos o libros que vienen como promoción con cada periódico, según la temporada. Para Miguel las ganancias que obtiene con su negocio son rentables y les han servido por durante todo estos años para solventar los gastos de la familia. Para un futuro cercano quiere incrementar sus ventas implementando más puestos en otras calles de su ciudad. Esta es la cuarta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, él es una de las personas más dinámicas de su banco comunal, siempre promueve la unidad y es muy responsable con sus pagos. El dinero que viene solicitando será para invertirlo en la compra de libros, fascículos y más revistas para implementar su puesto de ventas.
texts.en:
Miguel is 27 years old and lives with his mother and sister in his parents' home. He has been selling newspapers every day since he was 8 years old, offering his customers various options.

He goes at 4 am along with his mother to buy the newspapers to distribute them in the different booths that are located in one of the central streets of their city, and to restock their own booth. He sells magazines, pamphlets and promotion books that come with each news paper according to the season. Miguel thinks his business is profitable and has served throughout these years to meet the family expenses.

He plans for the near future to increase his sales by opening more booths in different streets of the city. This is his 4th loan with MFP. He is one of the most dynamic people of his community bank and promotes unity; he is always very responsible with payments. The loan will be invested in the purchase of books, booklets and magazines.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy books, booklets and magazines

loans.name: Adeyemi

texts.en: M. is a single lady of 26 years. She lives in Lagos State, Nigeria where she sells provisions, shoes, ladies bags, cosmetics and drinks.  She has been in this business for the past nine years. M. has been in LAPO Microfinance for three years.  She is requesting a loan of N150,000 to purchase more provisions, ladies bags, shoes and cosmetics to enable her to meet her customer's demands. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders and LAPO Microfinance for the financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions, shoes, cosmetics and drinks to sell

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana S. is from the village of San Roque, Valencia City Bukidnon. She is 58 years old. Susana is married and has five adult children. Susana owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Susana has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos (about $167) a month for these activities.

This year, Susana joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Susana is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Susana from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

Note: This picture was taken at Susana's store during her non-operating day.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Setara Group

texts.en: Setara is the group leader of the Setara group. There are two members in this group. Each of them wants to take a loan to grow their businesses.  They are requesting a group of loan 20,000 Afghani.  Setara wants to take out a loan for her husband who has a dried fruit shop. Mena wants to take out a loan for the business of tailoring. They thank Kiva lenders that can support poor people.

loans.use: For expanding business

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Work hard and be patient in overcoming the difficulties of life, shared Aileen. She is managing a little stall selling different snacks such as noodles, bread, candies and so on. She is a resident of Barangay Salvacion Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She was not able to pursue her college education because she got pregnant before getting married, when she was in her last year in high school.

To make her business grow, Aileen is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP 5,000 as additional business capital. She wants to increase her income and as much as possible double her time for her child is already in his senior year in high school. Aileen wishes to provide her child with his need for education. She knows her son will be responsible for her when she grows old and thus she wants him attain his ambitions in life for their future. She once became a failure as a teenager but now is a proud mother without expecting help from others in managing her son’s education. She just hopes that lenders will grant her loan request.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Sonia Violeta

texts.en:
Sonia is a member of the United Friends village bank. She is 52 years-old, married, and has two children who are 22 and 21 years old and live with her. The eldest child works while the youngest studies at university.

Sonia has a food stand in the market that was an inheritance from her mother-in-law. Sonia and her husband both work there serving breakfasts, lunches, and dinners everyday until 7 p.m.

Since joining FINCA, Sonia’s business has improved and her sales have grown, which has allowed her to buy even more merchandise. She needs a loan of 2,600 soles to buy rice, sugar, meat, and beans. Her dream is to move her restaurant to a bigger location.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients

loans.name: Efosa

texts.en: Efosa is 36 years old and married with a child. He sells phone recharge cards and phone accessories and has been in the business for the past 3 years. She is requesting for the loan amount of N 50, 000 to purchase more phone recharge cards and phone accessories to sell. He says thanks to all kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more phone recharge cards and phone accessories to sell

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia C. is 47 years old, married to Eddie C. who is 52 years old now. They are blessed with five children; three of them are working in Manila and two are presently studying. Her children in Manila are helping her when she has emergency needs. But when her children need tuition fees during their examinations, she has to look for someone else to borrow money from. Their yield in their farm is insufficient to sustain her children's needs in the whole school year.

From her experiences, she knows that sending her children in school is difficult if she doesn’t have an extra source of income. Now, she has learned from her experiences. For five years now, she has been engaged in a hog raising business. This business helps her provide her children's tuition payments during their examination. When she is in need of financial assistance, she sells her pigs. At present she has insufficient funds for maintaining the feed levels of her pigs. In this situation, she is asking the KIVA lenders to loan the amount of 5,000 PHP to buy sacks of feeds for her pigs.

loans.use: To buy feed for her pigs

loans.name: Nymrita

texts.en:
Nymrita B. is from the town of Centro Napu,Tudela,Misamis Occidental. She is 36 years old. Nymrita is single. To make a living, Nymrita owns & operates a business in the food sector making & selling food. Her main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Nymrita has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Nymrita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nymrita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Nymrita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La socia MARIA pertenece al banco comunal “MINIBANK”, es natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

La socia tiene 60 años de edad, es casada, tiene cuatro hijos varones, ellos son profesionales. Ella tiene un pequeño taller de manualidades.   

Ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con el trabajo de hacer manualidades. La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar su producción de venta de manualidades como arreglos navideños. Ella quiere compran más materiales para su taller de manualidades.          
 
La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
MARIA, 60, is a member of the MINIBANK communal bank. She is from the city of Cusco. She is married and has four sons, all of whom have professional careers. She has a small crafts workshop. She alternates her household chores with making crafts. She needs financing to increase production of Christmas-themed crafts. She wants to buy more materials for her crafts workshop. She is grateful for the opportunity granted by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy handicrafts materials.

loans.name: Together As One Ii Group

texts.en:
Here are Abass M. B., Abdulai F., Abdul K., and Idrissa K.. These entrepreneurs named their group Together As One. This will be their first loan from SMT, a partner of Shine on Sierra Leone. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses both in terms of size and quality. This will enable them to make more sales, increase profits, and consequently improve their standard of living.

Abass M. B. (second from left) is the leader of this group. Abass is twenty-three years of age. He is single with one young child. Abass dropped out of school three years ago since he could not afford to pay the school fees. He then started trading. He now sells tapes, radios and mobile phone accessories. He has been in this business for two years. With his share of the loan, he will buy more tapes, radios and mobile phone accessories to sell.

loans.use: Buy tapes, radios and mobile phone accessories to sell

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita A. is from the village of Tubod, Mahinog Camiguin Province. Anita is widowed and has school-aged children. To make a living, Anita owns & operates an eatery, selling a variety of meals in the local community. Anita has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Anita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. Anita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Anita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace B., 35 years old, is a rice farmer. She has four children. Her eldest, who is sixteen years old, might not be able to go to college. As the family’s finances are already tight, enrolling her child in college would surely eat up the family’s limited income.

Mary Grace is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP from Community Economic Ventures, Inc., as she would like to grow her business. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies, allowing her to increase profits from her crops and so send her children to school.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Zivamuntuuyo Group, Jinja

texts.en:
Rose Nabiryo is the leader of her lending group in Jinja. She is 39 years old and married with six children. She has had a tailoring business as well as a clothes-selling business in Wairaka, Jinja, for 10 years. From her transactions, she is able to make about 100,000 Ugandan shillings in profits every week. These help her in expanding and recapitalizing her business as well as in taking care of her family. 

Rose knows how to handle her customers and this has kept them coming to her business. Rose hopes to expand her business by having more clothes for resale as well as ensuring that more customers give her tailoring jobs. Rose is such a hardworking lady. She needs a loan to be able to buy more clothing materials and to pay for her children’s school fees.

loans.use: Buying more tailoring materials and clothes for resale

loans.name: José Ricardo

texts.es: José Ricardo H. A. de 41 años de edad, reside en Rosario de Mora, ubicado en el departamento de La Paz. Junto a él vive su esposa y su pequeño hijo de 2 años de edad.  El señor Ricardo posee una carpintería, la cual está ubicada en su casa de habitación. En ella se encarga de elaborar muebles hechos de madera, los cuales son encargados por sus clientes. Gracias a la amplia experiencia de José en su trabajo, cuenta con mucho clientes quienes están muy satisfechos con el trabajo que él realiza, reconociéndolo como un hombre muy trabajador y responsable quien siempre entrega su trabajo a tiempo. Así mismo José elabora muebles y otros tipos de adornos hechos de madera, los cuales vende a las afueras de su hogar. Él solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar madera al por mayor, así mismo comprar repuestos de los instrumentos de trabajo. De esta manera José espera poder aceptar mayor cantidad de trabajo, ya que esta es la única fuente de ingresos con la que cuenta para sostener a su familia.
texts.en:
José Ricardo H. A. is 41 years old and lives in Rosario de Mora, located in the department of La Paz. He lives with his wife and small son who is 2 years old. Ricardo has a carpentry business which is located in his home. In this business, he makes furniture made of wood which has been ordered in advance by his customers. Thanks to his extensive work experience, Jose has many customers who are satisfied with the work he does, recognizing him as a very hardworking and responsible man who always delivers his products on time. In addition to making furniture, Jose also makes other types of decorative wood products, which he sells outside of his home. He requests a loan so that he can buy wood at wholesale, and also parts for his work tools. In this way Joseph hopes to accept more work, since this is the only source of income that he has to support his family.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy wood at wholesale

location.town: Rosario de Mora, departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita S. is from the village of Balbagon, Mambajao Camiguin Province. She is 38 years old. Clarita is married and has 1 school-aged child. Clarita owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) shop where she sells food & daily use products. Clarita has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Clarita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Clarita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Clarita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her inventory

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is 50 years old and married with 8 children. Her husband is a bricklayer and he also supports their home. Gloria sells second-hand clothes, shoes and bags at retail prices. Demand for the second-hand clothes is high in her community among those who cannot afford new clothes. She hopes to own a boutique in the future. She hopes for the loan amount of NGN 30,000 to purchase more second-hand clothes, shoes and bags to sell. She is itching for expansion in her business. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more second-hand clothes, shoes and bags to sell

loans.name: Lubugumu Twekembe Group, Mukono

texts.en:
K. Jane, shown at the bottom left in a small photo, is the leader of her lending group and is also shown in the group photo. The 55-year-old is a married woman with two children. Her children, plus the four orphans under her care, all attend school.

To cater for her children, Jane has for the last twelve years been selling local brew and agricultural produce in Namayuba village in Mukono district.

In her bid to provide a reliable source of livelihood to her family, Jane has had to come to terms with the hidden pitfalls that befall such businesses at unpredictable times. She, like many other customers of farm produce, found herself at the receiving end of the adverse weather spells which, for the most part, destroyed crops. This affected her suppliers, the farmers.

Local brew was soon outlawed too. That law was rescinded and currently she makes close to 200,000 shillings a week from her businesses. Her plan, after obtaining this loan, is to fully restock her business with more local gin and more produce to sell.

loans.use: To buy more local gin and agricultural produce to sell

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth J. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan De Oro City. She is 32 years-old and married with three school-aged children. Maribeth owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (general) store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Maribeth has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Maribeth joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maribeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from HSPFI. Maribeth is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Maribeth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Banco Mujer Camino Al Sol Group

texts.en:
This group is composed of 9 woman members who live in Talamanca, Limón, located near the hot and humid Caribbean coast of Costa Rica. The formation of this group was inspired by the positive experience of one of its members as part of another group with Fundación Mujer. The name of this group, 'Camino Al Sol', which translates as 'The Path of the Sun', has special significance to the members. The rising sun symbolizes the start of the work day and the rays it gives off illuminate the path for the members to follow. All the members of this group are motivated to improve their standard of living for themselves, their family and community. 

For many members of this group, the use of their land is central to their productive activities. These are:  harvesting plantains, rearing and selling animals (chickens, pigs), and the management of a small store.  Other activities include the sale of propane gas, as well as clothing and cosmetic sales. This loan will be used by each woman to invest in her business at her discretion.  The women of this group have developed close personal relationships; they are a mix of neighbors and family members. This will be their first loan as a group with Fundación Mujer. 

Augustina is a 32-year-old mother of four who lives with her husband and children; she is also the elected president of this group. Augustina owns and runs a small store from her home in Talamanca. This loan will be used to invest in the expansion of her store. She says that half of her income is gained at the store while she earns the other half by harvesting plantains. 

Specifically, this loan will be used increase her store inventory levels in basic products such as lard, butter and rice. For Augustina, the work day starts at 7AM and ends at 4PM; the whole family contributes when it comes to carrying out the responsibilities of running the business.  Augustina´s goal is to be able to earn more income in order to re-invest in her store's operations. Her goal is to be able to offer her clients higher quality and more diverse products. She also hopes to improve her ability to support the studies of her children financially by optimizing the success of her business.  

Augustina says her only obstacle is the lack of working capital she needs in order to make improvements to her store. This loan will help her to overcome this obstacle. Augustina says there are advantages to the group lending methodology, as compared to the individual method, ¨If we´re united there is better support and communication. It makes the credit more solid.¨

Xinia plans to use this loan to purchase tanks of propane gas. She buys tanks for 8500 colones and sells them for 10,000. With this loan, she should be able to purchase 11 tanks and earn 16,500 colones profit (US$ 30).  

Andreina, Rosibel, and Regina will use this loan to finance the purchase of catalogue products. These group members spend their days travelling in their communities, looking for clients to offer their products to (colognes, clothing, kitchen appliances, and cleaners, among other products). After collecting orders, the women travel to a central location to purchase the requested items from the catalogue company. Since they are paid upon delivery of the requested products, women who make sales in this way often lack the initial capital to make their first purchase.  This loan will be used to finance the purchase of ordered products and enable the women to return to their communities with inventory for sale. 

Lidieth, Liveth and Josefa are involved in animal rearing. These group members will use their loan to invest in the purchase of livestock (pigs and chickens) as well as animal feed and nutrients to keep the animals healthy.

loans.use: basic products such as lard, butter and rice, etc. for resale

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob is into two businesses and his business has really been flourishing. He is into the sales of building materials and farming. His primary trade is farming. He has a cocoa farm and he has been in this business for a long time. He needs the loan of NGN 100,000 to clear his farm and purchase more building materials to sell. 

 He is 48 years old and married to a trader. They are blessed with 7 children. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To clear his farm and purchase more building materials to sell

loans.name: Mathew

texts.en:
Mathew is a 30-year-old married man who is blessed with a two-year-old child. He has been running a cafeteria for five years and employs three people. His business is located near an open-air market and therefore he has many customers. He mainly prepares beef stew in his cafeteria but also makes other types of food.

Mathew has requested a loan of Kes 80,000 to buy timber and nails for renovating his business premise, chairs for his cafeteria, and three bulls to slaughter. He dreams of having a butcher shop and a restaurant in the future.

loans.use: To buy timber, nails and chairs plus three bulls to slaughter

loans.name: Chanthy's Group

texts.en: In Preah Putth village, in Kandal province, this group loan consists of four people. They have selected Mrs. Chanthy R. as a group leader. All the members making up this group loan will use a small portion of the loan, each for a different purpose. Mrs. Chanthy R. is a housewife who cooks delicious food for her family. Her husband, Mr. Phorlly Bun, is a construction worker. Her problem is that her yard is lower than neighbors’ yard. So to remedy this problem, Mrs. Chanthy R. is asking for a loan to buy soil to complete her own yard. She is a mother of four children, two of whom are seamstresses in a garment factory, while the others are attending a local public school.

loans.use: To buy soil to complete her own yard.

loans.name: Norgui

texts.es:
Norgui O. Z.	 es una señora de 35 años que vive con su esposo e hijos en un pequeño pueblo en Guanacaste llamado la Garita. La Garita es una planicie de clima bastante cálido donde se desarrollan actividades  tales como la ganadería, Agricultura y el Turismo Rural.

Desde hace varios  años Norgui   se dedica a la cría de pollos para engorde y gallinas ponedoras para la producción de carne y huevos, ella vende sus productos a los vecinos de su comunidad los cuales se muestran muy satisfechos.  Dice que tener el apoyo y la ayuda de su esposo le facilita seguir con el proyecto. Además dice que el proyecto le es muy interesante   ya que ha visto como poco a poco su negocio crece y la demanda cada vez es más fuerte.

 Actualmente Doña Norgui está solicitando un micro crédito de ¢500.000 (quinientos mil  colones) para la compra de más pollos y gallinas; concentrado, y productos para el tratamiento de enfermedades; además de ampliar y reforzar su local. Con esto ella espera hacer crecer más su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida. Su negocio va bien pero por falta de dinero no ha podido hacerlo crecer más. 

Doña Norgui  es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal La Garita una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer crédito, y espera poder seguir participando de manera más activa en este  tipo de organizaciones
texts.en:
Norgui O. Z. is a 35 year old woman who lives with her husband and children in the small town of La Garita in Guanacaste. La Garita is situated on a plain that experiences very warm climate. The main business activities are livestock breeding, agriculture, and rural tourism.

For several years, Norgui has been raising chickens for fattening and egg production. She sells her products to neighbors in the community who have expressed their satisfaction. Norgui says she has the support of her husband, which makes it easier for her to continue with this activity. She also says her work is very interesting because she has seen business grow little by little and demand get stronger.

At the moment, Doña Norgui is requesting a microloan of 500,000 CRC in order to buy more chickens and hens, concentrated feed, and products for treating illness. This will help her expand and strengthen her business. She hopes the increased growth in her business will improve her quality of life. Currently her business is doing well, but she lacks the money to make it grow even more.

Doña Norgui is a member of the Communal Credit Enterprise of La Garita, one of 100 member organizations that form EDESA in Costa Rica. This is her first loan, so she hopes to continue participating as an active member within this type of organization.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chickens, poultry feed, and medicines

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience E. prepares kenkey (boiled corn dough wrapped in corn or banana leaves) and serves it with fried fish and pepper sauce at Takoradi. She has been through junior high school. She is married to a driver and has four children.

Patience has been selling kenkey for some time now and supports her husband in taking care of her family. Her loan will be used to buy extra bags of maize to cook for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to invest in her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy extra bags of maize to prepare more kenkey to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more drinks to sell

loans.name: Baktygul

texts.en:
Baktygul K. is the resident of Kadamjai, a nice town in the south of Kyrgyzstan.  Baktygul is 31 and married. She has a daughter and two sons; all of them are at school. Two years ago, with the initial investment of 15,000 soms, Baktygul started to sell convenience goods. In this way, she makes 6,000 soms per month.  This autumn, Baktygul wants to try to sell school uniforms, so with money received from the loan she wants to purchase school uniforms and resell them at a higher price. In the future, she is planning to build a shop in her village. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase school uniforms

loans.name: Melissa Lissette

texts.es:
Melissa tiene 24 años de edad, es separada y tiene dos hijos a su cargo, uno de seis y otro de dos años de edad. Reside en casa de sus padres ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, una zona agrícola de regular movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

La necesidad de sacar adelante a sus hijos hizo que empezara un negocio de venta de carnes y visceras en el mercado de la localidad de Cayaltí. Ella ofrece estos productos todos los dias durante la mañana. Actualmente ya cuenta con un grupo de clientes fidelizados los cuales la prefieren debido al buen servicio que brinda. Con los ingresos que le brinda esta actividad ella se encarga de mantener a sus dos hijos.

Melissa desea ampliar su negocio comprando mas carne para aumentar sus ventas y percibir mayores ganancias, para realizar este objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles,

Ella es una mujer luchadora y entregada a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para poder brindarle a sus hijos un futuro estable y prometedor. Las personas que la conocen la consideranuna mujer responsable y de confianza.
texts.en:
Melissa, 24, is separated and has two children in her care: one, six-years old and the other, two-years old. She lives with her parents in the Cayalti district, an agricultural area about an hour from the city of Chiclayo. The necessity to support her children was the impetus behind her business. She sells meat and offal at the market in the town of Cayalti. She works every morning. She can now count on a group of loyal customers who prefer her because of the good service that she provides. The income from the business allows Melissa to support her two children. Melissa wants to expand the business by buying more meat so that she can sell more and increase her earnings. She is applying to Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new-soles loan for this purpose. Melissa is working and striving for her family. Her greatest hope is to continue growing as an entrepreneur so that she can provide her children with a stable and promising future. The people that know her consider her to be a responsible and trustworthy woman.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for butcher shop.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane L. is a 37-year old married woman who supports her family by fishing and fish vending. She lives in Purok Cogon III, Brgy Alimango, Escalante City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2003 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fish vending and fishing businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She currently earns an average monthly income of PHP 8,000. 

Mary Jane is borrowing PHP 15,000 so that she can increase the volume of fish she is selling.  This will be her 11th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Mary Jane aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through its alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to obtain more fish to sell

loans.name: Francisco Teodoro

texts.es: Don Francisco es de 61 años de edad, casado,  es comerciante, actualmente se dedica a  la elaboración, producción y venta de canastos plásticos, tiene más de 19 años de experiencia. He tenido ganancias gracias a este trabajo que realiza y de esta forma a logrado sostener a su familia, solicita su cuarto crédito a ASDIR, para la compra de materiales para la elaboración de canastos, es una persona responsable y trabajadora según los créditos que ha tenido con anterioridad.
texts.en:
Francisco Teodoro  Z. C.

Francisco is 61 years old and married.  He is a merchant that makes and sells plastic baskets.  He has more than 19 years of experience in his craft.  He is requesting his fourth loan for the purchase of materials he needs to make his baskets.  He has demonstrated that he is a responsible and hard-working person with his previous loans and will do the same with this loan.

loans.use: To purchase materials to make baskets

loans.name: Mburucuja Group

texts.es:
Este comité se encuentra trabajando dentro del  decimo primer ciclo, todas ya con mucha experiencia en las actividades que realizan.
Realmente es un comité muy unido ya que han superado varios inconveniente para continuar con el grupo.
Una de las integrantes  es la señora  Fernanda F. con 59 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos, se dedica a la  venta de ropas que distribuye en las tiendas  el de la ciudad de Lambaré y en otras localidades cercanas lo realiza en la hora de la tarde  y regresa a su casa ya cuando oscurece .
Es una señora muy trabajadora y valiente porque lucha para el día a día y de esa forma poder salir adelante con sus hijos.   
Lo que anhela  es tener su propio local comercial. 
Con su trabajo ella sostiene los gastos de la casa y de  sus dos hijos que estudian. 
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de remeras, blusas, camisas, shorts, soleras, zapatillas, y otros.
texts.en:
This group is currently on their tenth loan cycle and each member has acquired a great deal of experience in their individual businesses. The members of the group are very close having faced many difficulties together. 

One of the members is Fernanda F.. She is 59 years old and she has 2 children. She sells clothing, distributing to the various stores in the city of Lambare and other neighboring regions. She works in the afternoons, only returning home when the night has fallen. She is a very hard working and brave woman, for the struggles she faces day after day for the sake of her children. 

Her goal is to have a store of her own. 

She is able to cover the household expenses and her children's tuition with her business. She requests a loan to purchase jackets, blouses, shirts, shorts, sun dresses, and shoes among other clothing merchandise.

loans.use: To purchase clothing for resale.

loans.name: Wendy Estefania

texts.es:
Wendy de 23 años, trabaja con su esposo en una vulcanizadora "lugar donde se reparan las llantas de carro, bicicletas etc), vive en el Fortín de Guayaquil( zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y lomas). 

Comenzó a reparar llantas y aprender del negocio desde que su esposo se decidió a tener una vulcanizadora ya que toda su familia se dedicaba a esta actividad. Ellos trabajan desde las 07h00am hasta las 21h00pm todos los días. Cada día se levantan para dejar a sus hijos a la escuela y después se dirigen a la vulcanizadora.  

Con el préstamo quiere comprar materiales y herramientas para el negocio. En el futuro quiere establecer otro negocio y tener una economía estable.
texts.en:
Wendy, age 23, works with her husband in a vulcanization shop where they repair tires for cars, bicycles, and other vehicles. She lives in Fortín de Guayaquil, a periurban area with dirt roads and hills.

Wendy began repairing tires and learned the business after her husband decided to open a repair shop. Her entire family engages in this business. They work every day from 7am to 9pm. After they wake up each day, Wendy takes her children to school before heading to the repair shop.

This loan will be used to buy materials and equipment for her business. In the future, Wendy wants to open another business and have stable finances.

loans.use: Purchase equipment & materials

loans.name: Jameela's Group

texts.en:
Jameela has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to help her sons expand their fruit selling business. With the loan, they will buy fresh seasonal fruits to sell through their fruit shops. This will help them provide better quality fruits to their customers and earn more income. 

She lives with her family in a city named Borewala, famous for its shrines in Pakistan. Her house is located in Akhter town where she moved 20 years ago with her family. 

She has 5 children. All of them are sons: three of them are involved in a fruit selling business while one is a painter and offers his services painting houses and buildings to his customers. Her youngest son is studying in 5th class.   She herself is a housewife and does her household responsibilities at home. 

This is the 5th time Jameela has applied for a loan. In previous loan years she has always paid her installments on time and never missed a single meeting.  

She is hopeful that with the help of this loan investment, her sons will be able to improve their business, which will result in a better financial life for her family and she will be able to return the loan without any problem.
