loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal fruits for fruits selling business

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Las señora mencionada es D. la comunidad D. Parra Rancho D. la Provincia D. Tiraque del Departamento D. Cochabamba.

La señora Margarita nació 18 D. octubre D. 1961 en Parra Rancho actualmente vecina D. dicha comunidad, mismo que es representante D. la Organización D. Mujeres Bartolina Sisa D. la Provincia D. Tiraque.
La señora es emprendedora que actualmente están en proceso D. organización D. una asociación D. productores D. leche, con el apoyo D. la  Alcaldia D. Tiraque bajo un convenio interinstitucional D. P.D.A.-Tiraque, para vender sus productos D. leche para el desayuno escolar del Municipio. El crédito que está solicitando es prácticamente es para comprar una vaca lechera e insumos para la alimentación del ganado, el objetivo D. la compañera es incrementar su ingreso económico en la familia.

La actividad actual D. la compañera es la agricultura que producen papa, arveja verD. y cereales, la mayor parte se dedican a la producción agrícola en la temporadas D. siembra, labores culturales y la cosecha pero sin dejar a un lado la actividad secundaria que producción D. leche.

Su vivienda son D. techo D. teja con paredes y pisos D. barro, viven con sus familias en sus comunidades son D. origen D. lugar que tienen mucha experiencia en sus actividades que realizan y son responsable con sus obligaciones en la comunidad. Por otro lado su marido le ayudan en la producción D. leche.
texts.en:
This lady is from Parra Rancho community, in Tiraque province, in Cochabamba department.

Margarita was born on October 18th 1961 in Parra Rancho where she currently lives.  She is a representative of the “Organización D. Mujeres Bartolina Sisa” (Bartolina Sisa Women's Organization) for Tiraque province.

Margarita is an enterprising woman who is currently setting up a milk producers' organization with the help of Tiraque Council under a PDA-Tiraque inter-institutional agreement to sell her milk products to the City's school breakfast scheme.  She is requesting a loan to buy a dairy cow and supplies for feeding her cattle.  Her goal is to increase her family's income.

Margarita's current business activity is farming.  She grows potatoes, green peas and cereals.  She spends most of her time farming during the sowing season, the harvest season and the period in between these two seasons.  However, she still works in her secondary business activity which is producing milk.

Margarita's home has a slate roof and mud walls.  The people in Margarita's community live with their family members within the community.  They are all from a place where people have a lot of experience in their activities and are responsible as regards their duties within the community.  Margarita's husband helps her with her milk production business.

loans.use: To buy a head of cattle

loans.name: Debora

texts.en: Debora is a thirty-two-year-old married female with four children and owns a house in Kasese. She has been operating a retail shop for ten years during  which she initially was selling produce in the market but saved money to start a retail shop. Her challenges are debtors and price fluctuation of goods and her vision is to sell wholesale and educate her children. Debora intends to use the loan to buy rice for sale in her shop.

loans.use: To buy rice for sale in her shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase four heads of sheep

loans.name: Paul Wafula

texts.en:
Paul Wafula O. is a 32 year old man. He is married to Mary and together they have been blessed with one child. His wife is a business lady who runs a retail shop which is commonly known as a kiosk. Paul owns a welding workshop and he has been in this business for the last one year. 

This will be his second loan from KADET LTD and he plans to purchase more welding equipments into his business. The anticipated profits will be directed into the expansion of his business.
 
His dream is to own more welding workshops.

loans.use: purchase more welding equipments into his business

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen O., 52, is from the village of Duka, Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Helen runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods, biscuits, detergents and toothpaste in the local community. Helen has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Helen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Helen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP which she used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. She is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell such as snack foods and canned goods. This will be her fourth loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell, such as snack foods and canned goods.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace has been practicing farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 11 years.  She is 53 years old and is a single mother of three children.

Grace was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her fourth loan. She repaid all her previous loans well and in good time. She plans to use this loan amount to lease land for farming and to buy fertilizer and seeds.

In the future, Grace plans to venture into dairy farming to increase her income.

loans.use: To lease land for farming and buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Lery Lethy

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal La Inmaculada, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Lery, ella tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos, dos mayores de edad y una de 11 años la misma que este año empieza el colegio.  Su esposo es comerciante tiene un puesto en el cual vende legumbres.

Ella tiene una tienda de viveras de consumo en su casa en la cual vende variedad de productos tales como: arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, entre otros. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 21h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su esposo a veces le ayuda en su tienda, nos cuenta que lleva dos años en su negocio y los productos los compra en Tosagua y algunos  los recibe en su local.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de priM. necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal hace dos años y le gusta porque con uno de los  créditos empezó su negocio y con los otros ha podido ir poco a poco aumentando sus productos que le permite ganarse la vida y ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Su meta es tener una tienda más grande.
texts.en:
The “La Inmaculada” communal bank meets every two weeks in the city of Tosagua, a place known for being very dynamic most of whose residents raise animals and farm because it’s an area with much vegetation.

This is where we met Lery.  She is 45 years old, married and has three children, two adults and an 11 year old girl who will start secondary school this year.  Her husband is a merchant; he has a stand where he sells vegetables.

She has a home-based grocery store where she sells such things as: rice, sugar, oil and detergents, among others.  She works every day from 6am until 7pm and sometimes even later.  Her husband helps out in the store sometimes.  She tells us that she’s been in business two years.  She stocks up in Tosagua and some of her items are delivered to the store.

She will use the loan to better stock the store.  She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, cured meats and other basic need items.

She’s been in the communal bank for two years and likes it because she started her business with one of the loans and with the others has been able to gradually increase her stock items that allow her to earn her livelihood and help her husband with household expenses.  Her goal is to have a larger store.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, detergent, oil, cured meats and other basic need items.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
With her husband who is a cocoa farmer, Abena Z. and five their children live in Jukwa near Abura which is close to Cape Coast. Together with her husband she takes care of the well-being of the family. In order to do this she works as a palm oil extractor. 

Abena buys palm fruits and processes them into oil she then sells. Palm oil is the most common cooking oil used in Ghana and therefore part of most traditional dishes. She believes that she could satisfy a lot more customers if only she had the financial means to expand. She would like to purchase larger quantities of palm fruits to be able to produce more oil. That’s why she is hoping for a loan so she can make that needed investment.

loans.use: to purchase larger quantities of palm fruit  to produce more oil.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma S. is from the village of Suarez, Iligan City. She is 48 years old, married and has 7 adult-aged children. Wilma owns and operates a business making and selling viands such as fried fish and inun-unan nga isda (fish cooked in vinegar and spices) in the local community. She also runs a retail store selling a variety of products such as junk foods. Wilma has been engaged in her businesses for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from them.

In 2009, Wilma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wilma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. Wilma is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed, such as fish, spices and vegetables. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Wilma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients

location.town: Suarez, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: Wilfredo T. P. de 41 años de edad reside en su casa junto a esposa y dos hijas que se encuentran cursando sus primeros años de estudio. Él es un hombre decidido y comprometido en su trabajo. Trabajado esmeradamente para sacar adelante a su familia por lo que día a día se las ingenia para llevar el sustento a su casa. Don Wilfredo se dedica a la compra y venta de pan dulce, venta de desechables y productos de primera necesidad como son cereales, huevos, aceite, detergente etc. Su negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado de San Martin del Departamento de San Salvador que es muy visitado ya que Don Wilfredo siempre  agrada a las personas que lo visitan ofreciéndoles calidad, variedad de pan dulce y productos de primera necesidad. Durante algún tiempo acá ha observado que sus productos son muy demandados y cada vez hay más personas buscandolo. Debido a esto ha esto ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para comprar más productos como: variedad de pan dulce, desechables,  cereales(azúcar, frijoles, arroz), aceite, huevos, entre otros. De esta forma espera satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes así como sus propias necesidades y las de su familia. Ya que confía que su nivel de ventas se vera incrementado y por ende sus ganancias.
texts.en: Wilfredo T. P. is 41 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and 2 children, who are in elementary school.  He is a stalwart man who is committed to his work.  He works diligently to get ahead with his family, and day by day he manages to provide for the household.  Wilfredo has a business buying and selling pan dulce (sweet rolls), disposable tableware, and consumer staples such as cereals, eggs, cooking oil, detergent, etc.  His business is located in the San Martin market in the San Salvador department. This is a very busy place where Wilfredo always pleases his customers by offering them quality products and a large variety of sweet rolls and consumer goods.  Over his time there he has observed that his products are in high demand, and that every day more people are seeking out his business.  Because of this, he has decided to request this loan from INTEGRAL to purchase more products such as: a variety of sweet rolls, disposable tableware, consumer staples (cereals, sugar, beans, rice), cooking oil, eggs and other items.  In this way he hopes to satisfy the needs of his customers and also meet the needs of his own family, since he is confident that his sales will be increases and as a result so will his earnings.

loans.use: to buy more products such as: a variety of sweet rolls, disposable tableware, consumer staples (cereals, sugar, beans, rice), cooking oil, eggs and other items

loans.name: Ek

texts.en:
Ek S., 55, is married and resides in Battambong province, Cambodia, an area known for high quality rice. S. sells vegetables and fish, earning an income of about USD 8 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 3 per day. 

Each month, the family has to spend USD 80 on food and USD 54 on other necessary expenses. S. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase fruit for one of the children to resell. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy fruit for one of her children to resell.

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
Angeles is 58 years old and married with six children.  With one child still in school, Angeles works very hard to provide for her family. She buys and sells coconuts in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of coconuts to sell. Angeles has been in this business for four years.

In the future Angeles would like to save money for the repair of her home.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks of coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Camila Del Rosario

texts.es:
Camila de 38 años, vive en una zona peri-urbana en la Perimetral (lugar muy humilde, las casas del sector están rodeadas de un estero donde pasan los barcos con cargamento pesado) de Guayaquil. Es separada y tiene 2 hijos que estudian en escuelas fiscales. Tiene una tienda de víveres.

Comenzó con ala venta de confites y pequeño artículos de tienda y luego compro vitrinas e incremento y tienda poco a poco. Labora diariamente con ayuda de sus hijos. En su tienda vende productos como azúcar, aceites, y mas víveres para el hogar. Le afecta mucho la delincuencia ya que sus proveedores muchas veces fueron asaltados. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere comprar mas víveres; arroz, azúcar, aceites par aumentar sus ingresos. En un futuro quiere poner una puerta enrollable en su tienda y comprar un congelador porque tiene mercadería sin congelador.
texts.en:
Camila, 38, lives in a periurban zone in Guayaquil’s La Perimetral (a very humble place; the houses in the sector are surrounded by a body of water through which ships loaded with heavy cargo pass.)  She is separated and has two children who go to public school.  She has a grocery store.

She started off selling snacks and small store items but later bought display cases and gradually enlarged the store.  She works daily with help from her children.  She stocks her store with such items as: sugar, oil and other foodstuffs for the home.  She is highly affected by the crime rate since her suppliers have been held up several times.  With help from the loan she wants to buy more foodstuffs: rice, sugar and oil to increase income.  In the future, she’d like to install a roll-up door on the store and buy a freezer because she has merchandise and no freezer.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs like rice, oil, juice and sugar.

loans.name: Bou

texts.en:
From Prey Chor district, Mrs. Bou is a 38-year-old farmer and the mother of a school-aged child. Mrs. Bou is a single mother because she got divorced from her husband when she was young and now she lives with sister (she and her sister appear in the photo). Besides her farming business, Mrs. Bou also raises a lot of piglets and she had hoped to sell them to buyers four months after she began raising them. 

Unfortunately, the pigs are not big enough, due to lack of food. To help solve this problem, Mrs. Bou has requested a loan that she will use to buy many sacks of pig feed to fatten her pigs. She will use rest of the loan towards purchasing farm supplies to use on her field.

loans.use: to buy many sacks of pig feed to fatten her pigs and also purchase farm supplies to use on her field.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is 36 years old and married with seven children. She lives in Tangub City. For the past ten years, Anecita has worked in the fish industry and she sells fish for a living. She has been a member of PMPC for two years.

Anecita is requesting a loan to purchase more fresh and dried fish to sell.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
51-year-old Emma is a farmer from the town of Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. She has been growing rice for twenty years. Emma works hard with her husband to provide for their needs and send their children to school. 

Emma has applied for a loan to purchase seed, fertilizer and other farming necessities. She hopes for their business to prosper.

loans.use: to purchase seed, fertilizer and other farming necessities.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a 42-year-old widow with 6 children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for 7 years and earns additional income from ice retailing.

Sarah is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Kpedetin Group

texts.fr: Le groupe KPEDETIN est composé de trois personnes qui habitent le même quartier. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. Le représentant du groupe, du nom de Comlan Gratien est celui qui a la main levée sur la photo. Comlan Gratien est âgé de 46 ans et vit au Bénin. Comlan Gratien est marié à une ménagère du nom de Jeanne. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Comlan Gratien a très peu fréquenté l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Comlan Gratien a appris le métier de soudure. Comlan Gratien mène cette activité depuis douze ans ennvirons. Comlan Gratien s’approvisionne en matériaux de soudure dans l’une des villes du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu Comlan Gratien sollicite  ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe KPEDETIN, un deuxième crédit. Le premier crédit a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The KPEDETIN group is composed of three persons who live in the same neighborhood. It is the second time that this group is requesting a loan from  ALIDé, to raise the level of their businesses. The representative of the group, Comlan Gratien, is the one who is raising his hand in the photo. 

Comlan Gratien, 46, lives in Bénin. He is married to a housewife named Jeanne. The couple have two children, both enrolled in school, and both under their roof. 

Comlan Gratien did not attend school very much. To support himself and his children, he learned the trade of welding. He has been working at this trade for about 12 years. He buys his welding materials in a town in Bénin. Wishing to satisfy his clientele and grow his turnover and thus his income, he is requesting his second loan together with the members of his group, KPEDETIN. The first loan was correctly reimbursed.

loans.use: to buy gas for welding.

loans.name: Kobenkoun Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes qui constituent le groupe KOBENKOUN III sont mariées, ont une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Kafla, l’un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, WOROKIA, la deuxième assise à droite, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de riz.
Les productions sont vendues sur place au marché du village, au niveau du marché de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 45 000F CFA en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
The ten women that make up the KOBENKOUN III group are all married, with an average age of 40 and an average of five children each. They live, for the most part, in polygamous families in Kafla, one of the villages in the rural commune of Banco in Dioïla prefecture of Mali's second administrative region, Koulikoro. 

They are working together with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to better organize their activities ahead of the rainy season. Crops grown include rice and peanuts, among others. This is their first collaboration with the institution. With this loan, Worokia, the woman seated second from the right, plans to purchase fertilizer, seed, and light equipment as well as to pay labor and weeding costs for maintaining around .5 hectares of rice. 

The products are sold on site at the village market, and at the markets of Banco and N'Golobougou, whose customers consist of both men and women after the harvest. She intends to make an average profit of 45,000 CFA by the end of the season.

loans.use: to cover costs for labor, tillage, seed, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding, and light equipment

loans.name: Mwarabu

texts.en:
Mwarabu is a 33-year-old single man. Mwarabu runs a barber shop in Kilifi. His business has been in operation for the last two years and it has been a success. This marks his first loan from KADET to finance his business. 

With this loan, Mwarabu plans to purchase more shaving equipment for his business. The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to gradually expand his business. His dream is to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase more shaving equipment

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 36 years.  He is 57 years old, married to Milka, and they have seven school-going children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his fourth loan.  He repaid all his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In future, Paul hopes to become one of the leading farmers in Ndunyu Njeru area

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael, 20 years old, has practiced small scale farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last two years.

He was introduced to KADET LTD. by one of the field officers, and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.  In the future, Michael hopes to become one of the leading farmers in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en: Miriam is a hardworking business lady age 31. She is single and blessed with three children. For the last two years, she has been managing a green grocery to earn a living. She also sells charcoal to boost her income. In the next five years, she wants to expand her business. With 10,000 Kenya shillings, she wants to buy charcoal for resale.

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 23-year-old married man living with his wife and one child. He is from Lebanon. He has been working as a plumber for more than five years. He works on a freelance basis, sticking with private projects and businesses. In parallel, he works in selling used metal in order to earn greater income and to better support his family, as he is the main income source. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase plumbing tools and supplies. This may include pipes, bathroom fixtures, etc. He estimates that the loan will help him increase his profits by 25%.

loans.use: to purchase plumbing tools and supplies such as pipes, bathroom fixtures, etc.

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
El comité “OÑONDIVEPA” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santaní. Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo. Ellas son actualmente 10 mujeres, las cuales trabajan dentro de un ambiente de coordinación y ayuda mutua para la consecución de sus fines.
Angelina se dedica a la cría y posterior venta de animales. Nos comenta que es un trabajo muy sacrificado, pues debe de estar siempre pendiente de sus animales, debe de fijarse que los mismos estén en buenas condiciones y no tengan enfermedades. Por medio de este trabajo que ella realiza logra mantener a su familia y cubrir los gastos diarios.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de animales, como así también la compra de alimentos para los mismos. Agradece a la fundación paraguaya por la oportunidad que esta le brinda.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Onondivepa" is made up of a group of neighbors from the city of Santani.  The members have formed a very united group that is capable of jointly carrying out activities that strengthen their camaraderie.  At present the group has 10 women who work in an environment of cooperation and mutual assistance in order to achieve their goals.

Angelina has a business raising animals to later sell.  She tells us that this work takes a lot of sacrifice, since she has to always be aware of her animals, seeing to it that they are in good condition and free of disease.  Through this work, she manages to support her family and cover her daily expenses.  

She requests a loan to buy animals, and to also buy food for them.  She is grateful to the Fundación Paraguaya for providing her with this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy animals and animal feed

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 44 years of age. She is married and blessed with three children. She lives in Balintawak, Aurora Zamboanga del Sur.

Judith owns & operates a retail store selling different kinds of products such as eggs, cooking oil, vinegar, soy sauce, food for snacks and other family basic needs. 

She has been in this business for two years and she has a net return of PHP 3,200 every month. Judith is in need of funds. She is requesting a loan of PHP 5000 to purchase supplementary sari-sari/variety goods for her general store.

She joined GDMPC in October 2011. She plans that in the future she can buy a motorcycle for transport.

loans.use: to purchase supplementary goods to sell

loans.name: Tembo Mgwaza Group

texts.en:
Rose, who is in her early 40s, is married and has four children who attend school. She also takes care of her father. Rose has been operating two businesses: chicken layers and a dairy cow. She works from 7 a.m to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Rose's 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to start building her house and to buy chicks for her poultry business.  Rose has repaid all her loans successfully. She now wants a loan to buy more chicks and to buy cow feed. Her dream is to one day be able to start selling broilers.  

Rose will share this loan with her group "Tembo Ngwaza" which consists of 16 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more chicks and cow feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a plastic roof for her food stand, and buy ingredients.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a 23-year-old green grocery dealer in Bamburi, Mombasa. She is married and has been in this business for the last three years. She is doing great in the business. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD and this marks her second loan to expand her business. She plans to buy more kale, cabbages, spinach and tomatoes. 

She will use the anticipated profits to expand the business further and hopes to own her own grocery shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy more kale, cabbages, spinach and tomatoes.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is 27 years old. She is married and lives with her husband, Ilgar, in Gardabani, East Georgia. Svetlana and Ilgar earn a living through agricultural activities. They own a dairy farm with six milk cows and sell milk and homemade cheese. Also, they grow broom material on a family-owned three hectares of land. Svetlana makes besom brooms and sells them at the local market. Total average monthly income of the family is 1,000 Laris. 

Svetlana requested credit for purchasing up to ten calves. She will raise them during winter months and sell in late spring for a higher price. It will give additional income to the family, which will allow them to increase their spending to satisfy family needs and improve their living condition.

loans.use: to purchase up to ten calves.

loans.name: Bloques De San Marcos (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Municipal de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días las 11 socias y 1 socio  del Grupo De  Crédito Bloques De San Marcos. Los mismos que se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio en general, prestación de servicios entre otras actividades. Ellos hace poco y al conocer de los beneficios que brinda la institución decidieron unirse  para  poder acceder a los créditos que brinda La  Fundación Espoir, este es su primer ciclo en el Banco Comunal   y esperan cumplir muy bien para seguir recibiendo los beneficios que da la institución.

En este lugar conocimos a don Miguel, tiene 36 años de edad, está separado, pero de esa  relación tienen cinco hijos de  17, 12, 6, 3 y 2 años de edad, tres de ellos viven con él y  estudian dos en colegio y uno en escuela.

Ella para ganarse el sustento diario se dedica a la venta de comida como carne asada, cueritos de chancho asados, acompañados de plátano asado y de una deliciosa ensalada de legumbres, lo cual es muy solicitado por los clientes de la localidad, nos cuenta que él se desplaza en una carreta por toda la ciudad vendiendo este delicioso plato, trabaja todos los días en las tardes desde las 14h00 hasta las 19h00, lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y es así como ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijos.

Este crédito es para comprar carne de res, carne de chancho, legumbres, plátano y varias cosas necesarias en su negocio.
 
Sus sueños son salir adelante y algún dia tener un local para vender sus productos.

La foto pequeña adjunta es de una socia que por motivos de salud no pudo estar presente cuando se tomó la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
In the "Municipal" neighbourhood of the city of Portoviejo, eleven women and one man meet every 15 days as the "Bloques De San Marcos" group of borrowers. The group members pursue a range of economic activities, including sales and service occupations. To make the most of the benefits offered by the institution, they decided to unite to be able to access the credit available through [the field partner] Fundación Espoir. This is the group's first loan cycle and they hope to complete it successfully to continue to access the benefits of belonging to the institution.

Here we meet Don Miguel. He is 36 years old and, though they are separated now, he and his wife have five children, aged 17, 12, 6, 3 and 2 years old. Three of the children live with him, with two studying at primary school and one at secondary school. To earn his living he sells food, such as barbequed steak, pork chops, roast plantains and a delicious vegetable salad which his customers love. He sells these delicious dishes from a cart all over the city, working 5 hours every afternoon from 2pm till 7pm. In this way he has been able to bring up his children. This loan is to buy beef, pork, vegetables, plantains and other items necessary for his business. His dreams are to continue developing and one day to have a fixed location to sell his produce. 

The little photo inset is one of the group members, who was unwell and could not attend on the day the group photo was taken.

loans.use: To buy beef, pork, vegetables, plantains etc.

loans.name: Omar

texts.es:
El socio Omar pertenece al banco comunal "MAMACHA ASUNTA DE CALCA"; El banco se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Calca perteneciente al departamento de Cusco, a una hora de la ciudad del Cusco.

El sociotiene 30 años de edad y es casado, la socia tiene 1 hijo de 6 años de edad; El socio tarabaja en el ministerio de salud y paralelo a este trabajo en socio comparte con su conyugue la atención de sus propia tienda de abarrotes, el socio  desea invertir en la mercadería el socio comprara arroz, azucar, harina, leche al por mayor. El socio solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de arroz, azucar, harinas, fideos.

El socio agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
Omar belongs to the “Mamacha Asunta de Calca” communal bank located in Calca Province belonging to Cusco Department an hour away from the city of Cusco.  He is 30 years old, married and has a six-year-old son.

He works for the Ministry of Health but also runs a grocery store that he owns with his wife.  He wants to invest in merchandise and will buy rice, sugar, flour and milk at wholesale.  He requests the loan to buy rice, sugar, flour and noodles.

He is grateful for the loan and commits to make his installment payments according to the established timeline.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, flour and noodles.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en: Tabitha is a 31-year-old single woman. She describes herself to be patient and flexible. She operates a retail stall where she sells herbal medicines. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located at a viable place and her primary customers are walk-ins. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the shortages of herbal medicines. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy three bags of herbal medicines. Her business goal is to run a herbal hospital within five years.

loans.use: To buy three cartons of herbal medicines.

loans.name: Tomas Martin

texts.es:
TOMAS TIENE 32 AÑOS VIVE CON EN UNION LIBRE TIENE TRES HIJOS VIVE EN VENTANAS PROVINCIA DE LOS RIOS.

PERTENECE A LA VRC LAS PALMAS, QUE PERTENENCE AL CANTON BABAHOYO Y SE DEDICA A LA SIEMBRE DE MAIZ, Y AREROZ.

TOMAS SE DEDICA A LA AGRICULTURA A LA SIEMBRE DE MAIZ Y ARROZ. LAS COMPRAS LAS REALIZA EN VENTANAS.

EL DINERO DEL CREDITO LO NECESITA PARA INVERTIR EN SEMILLAS, FERTILIZANTES Y FUNGICIDAS PARA LAS PLAGAS QUE AFECTAN A LOS CULTIVO.

EL SUEÑO DE TOMAS ES TENER DINERO PARA PODER COMPRAR UN TERRENO PARA CONSTRUIR LA CASA YA QUE VIVE EN CASA ARRENDADA.

LE GUSTA HACER DEPORTE CON LOS AMIGOS DEL BARRIO.
texts.en:
Tomás Martín, 32, is in a common-law marriage and has 3 children. He live with his wife and children, ages 11, 8, and 5 in Ventanas Canton, Los Rios Province. 

He is a member of VRC LAS PALMAS, located in Recinto Campo Alegre, belonging to Bab Canton. They work as farmers.

Tomás has worked as a farmer for 15 years, sowing corn and rice. He buys and sells in Pueblo Viejo.

He is applying for the loan to work his corn and rice crop and to buy manure. With the help from the credit he will be able to buy the supplies with no problem. His dream is to be able to buy a tractor. He hasn't had any problems. In his free time he likes to listen to music.

loans.use: SEMILLAS, FERTILIZANTES Y FUNGICIDAS

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on the fish production in order to meet customer demand.

loans.name: Bakhdiyar

texts.en: Bakhdiyar is an IDP from occupied Lachin district of Azerbaijan. He came to Baku in 1993 and started the private business in 2003. He is willing to borrow first credit from Normicro Baku branch to buy equipment for his barber shop.

loans.use: To buy some equipment to serve clients better

loans.name: Tomumu

texts.en: Tomumu is 40 years old.  She enjoys fishing, and it is her livelihood.  She sells her daily catch at the roadside of her village and sometimes walks to a neighboring village to sell it.  She is applying for a small loan to buy some new nets and fishing gear for her small business.  Tomumu feels that her fishing is the only way for her to secure a bright future, and so she is anxious to keep growing it until she can save enough to buy a motorboat to go further out to sea and get a better catch.

loans.use: Buy new nets and fishing gear

loans.name: Ada

texts.es:
Ada is a 46-year-old divorced mother of three, one of whom still lives with her. Ada is a fighter, and she has struggled to make life better for her family despite her adversities.

When she was young, she studied dress design and dressmaking and worked several years in a shop. She has an entrepreneurial spirit and has always looked for ways to get ahead in her profession. She scraped together some savings and opened her own shop, where she custom-tailors clothes for men, women, and children. Her specialty is evening gowns, but she also produces sports clothes, uniforms, children's clothes, etc.

Thanks to her fine craftsmanship, she has many clients, who advertise her business by word of mouth. Business is booming, and clients want increasingly complex designs. She can't manufacture some of these designs on her outdated sewing machine, and she wants a newer model that costs $400. This machine is faster and can be used on many kinds of fabric. This machine will help her fill customer orders and work more rapidly and efficiently.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio P, Kiva Volunteer

Ada es una señora de 46 años, separada y madre de 3 hijos de los cuales uno de ellos aun vive con ella; Ada es una mujer luchadora que supo llevar adelante a su familia a pesar de las adversidades. Cuando joven estudio corte y confección, trabajo varios años en una textilería. Ella siempre fue emprendedora, y busco siempre progresar en su profesión, por lo que junto unos ahorros y abrió su propio atelier, donde hoy día ella confecciona ropas hechas a medidas para damas caballeros y niños. Su especialidad son los vestidos de gala, pero también confecciona otro tipo de ropas como deportivas, uniformes, ropa para niños, etc. Ella cuenta que gracias a su buen trabajo siempre tiene muchos clientes, estos a su vez hacen buena publicidad de ella y las demandas de su trabajo aumentan considerablemente; a la par de que aumenta la demanda los diseños también se vuelven mas complejos, y con la máquina de coser que ella trabaja no le permite realizar muchos de los diseños que le piden. Ada desea adquirir una máquina nueva, cuyo valor en el mercado es de $ 400, y que es más rápida, cose diferentes tipos de telas y que le ayudara a satisfacer sus demandas y trabajar de forma rápida y ágil.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Roque

texts.es:
Business Description

Mr. A. is devoted to the sale of pigs. He started his business two years ago and his regular customers are the butcher shops at nearby markets; his wife helps him with the sales and the demand is presently growing.

Loan Use

He wants to invest in the purchase of more pigs, to be able to satisfy his clients’ demands, and he presently doesn’t have the required capital to do so.

Personal Information

He is 37 years old and has two children, who study in nearby schools. His house is made of cane and his goal is to make his business grow and, one day, have a farm to raise his animals.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

El Sr. A. se dedica a venta de chanchos. El inició su negocio hace dos años y sus clientes fijos son las carnicerías de los mercados cercanos; en las ventas le ayuda sus esposa y actualmente sus pedidos están aumentando.

Uso del Préstamo

El quiere invertir en la compra de más cerdos para de esta manera poder satisfacer la necesidad de sus clientes, ya que hoy no cuenta con un capital suficiente.

Información Personal

El tiene 37 años y dos hijos, que estudian en establecimientos cercanos. Su casa es de caña y su meta es un día poder hacer crecer su negocio y tener una granja en el campo donde criar a sus animales.

loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Iasinta

texts.en: Iasinta is a mother of 52 years of age, married with 6 children. She had been doing sewing which she learned from her mother when she was only 20 years of age. Through her sewing she is able to send her children to school and pay for their school fees. Even though it was not enough but she tried so hard to save money for her children. Iasinta heard of SPBD through the village women and she thought to be a great chance to get some money so she could improve her business.

loans.use: To replace her old sewing machine

loans.name: Admiro Lacita

texts.pt:
Admiro Lacita M. is 37 years old. He lives with his wife and 3 children. He joined the credit program in June of 2007, and his first loan was of 5.000mt which he repaid without problems. Admiro sells plastic goods in his stand. He also sells clothes on the street. He is in the 2nd cycle and is requesting a loan of 8.000mt to be repaid in 6 months.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Admiro Lacita M. tem 37 anos de idade, vive maritalmente e é pai de 3 filhos. Entrou para o programa em Junho de 2007 com um empréstimo de 5.000MT o qual reembolsou sem problemas. Vende diversos artigos de plásticos na sua barraca e também faz venda ambulante de roupa. Vai para o 2ºciclo e vai tomar 8.000MT para pagar em 6 meses com vista a reforçar os dois negócios .

loans.use: Increase Inventory

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: My husband is a dealer who buys and sells old, used items, and we need a loan of $350 to expand his business. He intends to use this loan to buy large quantities of scrap items and sell them for a reasonable price that will allow him to support our family. I help him do this by sewing clothes for the people of my neighborhood. My husband and I have seven children, two sons and five daughters.

loans.use: Buy scrap items for my family's business

loans.name: Haja

texts.en: Haja J. is married with 4 children.  She sells peanuts and Beny on a very small scale.  With several small loans, SMT has proved Haja to be a creditworthy client, and would like to increase her loan size to enable her to expand and diversify the business for better income.  Haja does her business in the home because it is too small to be taken to the market center.  With the increase in business and income, Haja will be able to improve her family status.  She is requesting a loan of $350.

loans.use: Haja wants to move her business out of her home and into the market and needs the help of a Kiva loan to do so.

loans.name: Rosa Maritza

texts.en:
Rosa is thirty-six years old. She is married and has three children between the ages of thirteen and eight. Rosa joined the community bank “Virgen de Cocharcas” Thirteen years ago with a savings of US $1. Over the past thirteen years Rosa has found support and learned to save and be responsible.

Rosa owns a store located in her house in a small town outside of Ayacucho where she sells food staples such as flour, rice, and sugar. She has owned this store for eight years. Five years ago she was able to buy a photocopy machine with a loan from the community bank that has made her business more profitable. On the weekends, Rosa travels to regional markets to buy grains that she then grinds in to flour and sells. Rosa is hoping to open a second store in the city of Ayacucho.

Rosa needs a loan of 1400 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will use together with her savings to open the second store.

Rosa dreams that her children will be successful, and hopes to eventually be able to buy them a piece of land.

loans.use: To open a second store.

loans.name: Nee

texts.en: Nee, a mother of six, age twenty-nine, has requested a loan of $500 so that she can purchase more goods for her BBQ to sell. She has been a great client with SPBD in the past. All of her loans have been repaid with no delays. We are happy for this new opportunity to assist Nee as she continues to develop her business. She’s a very energetic mother that wishes to provide her children the best education.

loans.use: Purchase additional meats and other ingredients for her barbeque business

loans.name: Tumainis Garicheni Group

texts.en:
Tumaini is 36-year-old married woman. Tumaini is a clothes seller. She started in 2006. Every day she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in charcoal and fire wood sales, a shop and clothes sales.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Zuhran

texts.en: Zuhran Baji is a wife of Mr. F. who has been living in the city Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of five sons. Her husband is a milkman by profession. Zuhran Baji has 5 buffaloes in her home. Her husband gets milk from cows in the morning and she helps him in selling the milk. Zuhara’s husband charged 50 cents per kilogram of milk. She applies for a loan to buy one more buffalo to expand her husband’s milk business.

loans.use: To expand the milk business

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra lives in the Lomas del Memorial Sandino neighbourhood of the city. She is 42 years old, married and has a nine year old daughter. Her husband works as a gardener in a private house to support the family. Sandra has also worked as a domestic servant for the last seven years. In addition, she sells ice cream and ice from home.

With this loan, Sandra is planning to build a separate room for her business, with the view to open a shop to sell refreshments, thus improving their home and educating their daughter.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Sandra tiene 42 años de edad, habita en el barrio Lomas del Memorial Sandino, es casada y tiene una niña de 9 años de edad, su esposo trabaja como jardinero en una casa particular y ayuda a los gastos del hogar. La Sra. Sandra trabaja como doméstica también en una casa particular y tiene siete años de estar laborando, también ella vende en su casa helados y hielo. Con el préstamo que está solicitando es para construir un cuarto. A futuro es poner una refresquería, mejorar su vivienda y educar a su hija.

loans.use: Purchase of building materials to build a room

loans.name: Apaikunda's Usa River Group

texts.en:
Apaikunda is 45 years old. She is a married woman with four children between the ages of 13 and 26. She became a food and fruits seller in 2005. Every day, she works from 8am to 7pm at her business. She can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.

Apaikunda now hopes for a loan to buy more food and fruits for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, who also has a kiosk business (mini shop) and sells bananas.

loans.use: To buy more food items and fruits to increase her stock.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en: Azra was born in 1972. She works as a house mate and earns about 300 KM monthly. Her husband has a full time job and earns about 600 KM. They don't have any additional income. They have one son who goes to the primary school. This is her second loan at WWI, and it amounts to 1500 KM. She wants to repair a car that she needs for her job. Her wish is to buy a vacuum cleaner in order to improve the services she offers and find more costumers.

loans.use: To repair a car.

loans.name: Fany

texts.es:
Fany es socia del Banco Comunal Dignidad.

Fany es conviviente, tiene 36 años y 4 hijos, Fany junto a su esposo viajan a la ciudad de Andahuaylas que se ubica a 8 horas de la ciudad de Ayacucho en donde compran ganado vacuno y porcino de la feria de ese distrito, luego lo transportan a la feria de Matara para comercializarlo y también a las ferias de Ccejelambras y San Juan. Además Fany tiene un carro que alquila a su sobrino para que realice taxi en la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Fany necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de ganado vacuno. Fany sueña con tener capital propio, ampliar su negocios, construir su casa y sacar a sus hijos profesionales.
texts.en:
Fany is a member of the Dignidad (Dignity) microfinance institute.

Fany is a 36-year-old woman with a live-in partner and 4 children. Fany and her husband travel to the city of Andahuaylas, located 8 hours from the city of Ayacucho, where they purchase cows and pigs at the district market. They then take their cattle to the markets of Matara, Cejelambras and San Juan in order to sell them. Additionally, Fany has a car that she rents out to her nephew so that he can provide taxi services in the city of Ayacucho.

Fany needs a loan of 1,000 PEN, which will be invested in the purchase of cattle. Fany dreams of having capital, expanding her businesses, building her own house, and helping her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cattle

loans.name: Sixta

texts.es: La señora Sixta D. habita en el barrio Laureles Sur barrio ubicado en la capital Managua, tiene la edad de 51 años, se encuentra casada con el señor Domingo Velasquez, que se desempeña como comerciante de gallinas, juntos tienen cuatros hijos de 5,10,15 y 20 años de edad, de los cuales tres de ellos estudian y el mayor trabaja. Actualmente doña Sixta se dedica a la venta de tortillas, negocio que lo tiene  ubicado en su casa, tiene 6 año de dedicarse a esta actividad, iniciándola con fondos propios, así mismo ella desea un crédito para invertirlo en su casa ya que requiere cambiar tres puertas, por tanto esta solicitando C$ 7,000 aun plazo de 7 meses y a la vez seguir trabajando con los micro créditos para seguir ampliando su negocio de tortilla, ya que de esta manera le ayudara a mejorar las condiciones de su casa y poderle apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Señora Sixta D. lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood in the capital of Managua. She is 51, married to Señor Domingo Velasquez, who does well as a chicken businessman. Together they have 4 children of 5, 10, 15 and 20 years of age. Three of them are in school, the eldest is working. Currently Doña Sixta sells tortillas, a business that she does from her home. She has done this for 6 years, starting with her own ovens. Now she wants credit to invest in her house, as she needs to change three doors. She is requesting a loan of $375, with a term of 9 months, during which she will continue working with the micro creditors in order to continue expanding her tortilla business. This will help her to improve the conditions of her house and to help her children in their education.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy doors for her house

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To start selling underwear.

loans.name: Jeni M.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings) from Tanzania! This is 22-year-old Jeni M. M. from Kyela. She is married with one two-year-old child. Jeni has been running a tailoring business since 2004. She works at the business for 5 to 8 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by her husband. Jeni currently earns about 275 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 700 USD in order to purchase wool and other materials used for making clothes. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and range materials in bulk. Jeni thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit through micro-leasing in Tanzania. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women and uses the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase wool and other materials used for making clothes

loans.name: Atanasia

texts.en:
Atanasia is a member of the Legion Village Bank. She is 56 years old and is married with seven children. 

Atanasia has a store in her house, located in the Morro de Arica neighborhood, where she sells dry goods and meat with the help of her daughters.  

Atanasia needs a loan of 1,500 soles to buy rice, sugar and milk.  Atanasia’s dreams are to offer a wider variety of merchandise, have more investment capital and for her children to finish their studies. 


Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow

Atanasia es socia del Banco Comunal Legión. 
Atanasia es casada, tiene 56 años y 7 hijos, Atanasia tiene una tienda en su casa ubicada en el barrio de Morro de Arica, en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, carne, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de sus hijas. 
Atanasia necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, leche. 
Los sueños de Atanasia son surtir su negocio, aumentar su capital y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar and milk

loans.name: Thoeung

texts.en:
Mrs. Thoeung U. is a farmer in Kouk Doung Village in Takeo province. On her plantation she now faces a small problem because the soil in her field is infertile. She decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to make her crop more productive. She would also use part of the loan to buy more pesticides to kill all kinds of insects.

Her husband, Mr. Vith Muth, is a garment factory worker who makes a small salary to support the family. Mrs. Thoeung U. is 37 years old and the mother of five children. Four children are attending the local school while the youngest one is less than school-age. Her husband is presented with her in the picture.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine has been a vendor in the public school in their village for almost six years. She wants to have more products to sell in their school canteen; that is why she wants to take out a loan amounting to 4,000. For her, love of the business and cooperation from her family is helping her to achieve business development.

She is married to Reynaldo and blessed with four children. The eldest is Arnoldber -22 years old, a high school graduate, followed by Arnel - 20 years old, working as electrician in Manila; Rachel Joy -18 years old still studying, taking up criminology; and the youngest is Rea Jocel - 13 years old and a high school student.

loans.use: additional products to sell

loans.name: My

texts.en: My S., 28, pictured here with her husband, is married and lives with her husband in Takeo, Cambodia. To earn a living, she and her husband stay at home making rice wine and are able to make US$6 per day. This couple has three children, two of whom are in school and one is too young to attend. They would like to take out a loan to purchase rice so that they can make more wine to sell at the market.

loans.use: To purchase rice.

loans.name: Badegna Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Badegna (sont toutes mariées) avec une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans ont en moyenne 2 enfants. Elles vivent dans des  familles traditionnelles à Médine, un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente   du bois de chauffe et des fruits et légumes.
Elles sont à leur cinquième  prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe) avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Avec ce prêt, elles comptent acheter 10  chargements de charrette en  bois de chauffe et  20 paniers de fruits et légumes.
Elles  s’approvisionnent à Sikasso ville et  dans ses localités environnantes généralement auprès des producteurs. 
Les marchandises sont vendues au marché et dans les quartiers à une clientèle composée généralement de femmes et d'hommes  au comptant. En détail et à crédit.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice de 17.000CFCA par mois dont une partie sera utilisée pour les besoins de la famille et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Badegna group (all married) have an average age of 36 and on average 2 children. They live in traditional families in Médine, one of the districts of the town of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They have various businesses, among others, selling firewood and fruit and vegetables. They are on their 5th solidarity loan (group loan) with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, so as to satisfy the needs of their clientele.

With this loan, they intend to buy 10 cartloads of firewood and 20 baskets of fruit and vegetables. They buy their merchandise in the town of Sikasso and its surroundings, generally from the producers. The merchandise is sold in the market and neighborhoods, to a clientele composed generally of women and men, for cash, retail, and for credit.

They each expect to make a profit of 17,000 F CFA per month, of which part will be used for family needs and the rest reinvested in the businesses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of firewood and fruit and vegetables for re-sale

loans.name: Adenike

texts.en:
Adenike is 32 years old and she is married with two children. She sells provisions and foodstuffs.

She hopes for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Téning

texts.fr: Téning Wagué, 37 ans est mariée avec 05 enfants  en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Sinthiang Coundara depuis 6 ans. Téning veut acheter divers produits (thé, sucre, cigarettes, oignons et autres) pour les  revendre sur table. Elle veut renforcer son commerce.
texts.en:
Téning Wagué, age 37, is married and has five children to support. She has been a member of the village lending group of Sinthiang Coundara for six years. Téning wants to buy various goods (tea, sugar, cigarettes, onions, and more) to resell on her table. She wants to bolster her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell various goods

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
Abdul R., 28 years old, is married and has two sons and a daughter. He tells us the children are all in the primary school. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase, which is a farming and trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. His wife is a trader.

Abdul is a teacher by profession, but he also trades as well. He sells provisions on a tabletop in front of his house. Abdul procures his products from Dormaa. He has been in business for two years.

He has requested a loan to procure provisions in bulk. He is eager to expand his business and hopes to give his children the best education he can afford.

loans.use: To procure provisions in bulk for sale

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene 49 años, es soltera y su prioridad es el cuidado de sus padres. Desde muy joven le agradaron las manualidades y mientras aprendía a realizarlas se involucró también en la confección de ropa, posteriormente se especializó para ser sastre, pues considera que esta actividad es muy hermosa por la elegancia de las prendas que elabora. Este oficio lo viene ejerciendo formalmente desde hace 20 años en su misma vivienda, notando que los pedidos de sus clientes son cada vez más numerosos, puesto que la calidad de su trabajo es muy buena. En su negocio, la rentabilidad se basa en que los precios que cobra son altos, debido a la calidad de las telas con las que trabaja y por el acabado que realiza. Sin embargo, para mejorar su eficiencia requiere de maquinaria, por lo que espera ahorrar lo suficiente para adquirirlas. Este es 9no crédito que tiene con Microfinanzas PRISMA y en estos 5 años ha trabajado con mucho esmero para mantener unánimes a todas sus compañeras en beneficio de su banco comunal. Con los 1000 soles que solicita comprará las telas que requiere para la confección de las prendas que tiene pendientes por entregar.
texts.en:
Carmen is 49 years old, single, and lives in the city of her parents. Since she was very young, doing craftwork has given her pleasure and while she learned to do them she also got involved in making clothing. Later she specialized in being a tailor, since she considered this activity to be very beautiful because of the elegance of the dresses that she made. She has been practicing this trade for twenty years in her own home, taking notice that the requests have always been increasing in number due to the quality of her work. In her business, the profitability is based on the high prices that she charges, due to the quality of the fabrics with which she works and the finishing job that she does. Nevertheless, to improve her efficiency she needs a machine, for which she is hoping to save enough to purchase. This is her ninth loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA and in these five years she has worked with much care to benefit her community bank. With this 1000 Soles that she is requesting, she will buy fabric that she needs to make the dresses that she still needs to deliver.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali, 42 years old, lives in Bint Jbeil, Southern Lebanon, with his wife and three children. Ali has owned a grocery store for seven years. He is requesting a second loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his store. 

His previous loans, that were repaid successfully, helped him improve his store by diversifying his merchandise. Ali has a prime business position with his store being located on the main street. His clients are his friends, neighbors and passerbys. When he started his business he rented the place; now he owns it. Ali decided to pursue his business because of his experience in trading. In the future, he plans on expanding his business and open a restaurant.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his store

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
Minda S. is from the village of Marilag, Bukidnon. She is fifty-two years old and separated from her spouse. She has two grown children. To make a living, Minda owns and operates a business running a sari-sari (variety) store, where she sells several different products in the local community. Minda has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately $75 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Minda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Minda is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Minda's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Vann

texts.en:
Vann N. is a 55-year-old married man and older father. He has a lot of skills to earn a living. He plants vegetables and rice on his own farmland and is also hired by neighbors to help on their farms. He owns an old cultivating machine. Normally, he can make a daily profit of around $3.50 per day to meet his entire family’s living expenses, while his wife assists him in growing crops.

This older couple is devoted to their six children who are single and live in the family home. Two of their children are employed in farming. Vann N. says that he works hard every day to supply the money for his family's demands. He will be using his loan to purchase a new farming machine for a plowing service and to repair his old machine that has broken.

loans.use: To purchase a new farming machine for a plowing service

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena R. is from the village of Baluarte, Lumbia Cagayan De Oro City. She is 53 years old. Lucena is married and has 9 children. To make a living, Lucena owns and operates a specialized retail business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling firewood in the local community. Lucena has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Lucena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. Lucena is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Lucena from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her house.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional firewood

location.town: Baluarte, Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es:
Lorenzo tiene 62 años, está separado de la madre de sus 2 hijos y vive en su casa propia. Desde muy joven se ha dedicado a sus cultivos de naranja, café y plátanos; pero de todas sus siembras la más rentable ha sido el café, ya que hubo temporadas donde la mayoría de los agricultores no cosecharon buen café, pero él sí, entonces logró venderlo a un muy buen precio. Esas ganancias le sirvieron para comprar su terreno y construir una casa en la ciudad de Lima, pero con la separación de su esposa, él regresó a su casa rural en su pueblo, concentrando sus esfuerzos en sus cultivos de café. Aunque algunas veces las fuerzas físicas lo abandonan, Lorenzo tiene muchas ganas de seguir cultivando sus productos, y lo hace con el apoyo de algunos peones, de este manera logra solventar sus gastos y llevar una vida tranquila.
Este es su primer préstamo con MFP y está muy agradecido con todos los integrantes de su banco comunal por el apoyo y confianza brindada, asimismo reitera su compromiso de ser puntual en sus pagos. El dinero que viene solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes para abonar sus chacras de cafetales.
texts.en:
Lorenzo, 62, is separated from the mother of his two children. He lives in his own house. Since he was very young he has grown oranges, coffee, and bananas. Of all of his crops, the most profitable has been coffee. There were times when the majority of the farmers did not harvest good coffee, but he did. Therefore, he was able to sell it at a very good price. These earnings served him to buy his land and build a house in the city of Lima. However, upon separating from his wife, he returned to his rural house in his village. He concentrated his efforts on his coffee crops. Even though he is, at times, not very strong, Lorenzo has a great desire to continue growing his products. He has the help of some workers. This way he is able to pay his expenses and live a peaceful life. This is his first loan with MFP. He is very grateful to all of the members of his communal bank for their support and the confidence they have in him. He repeats his promise to be punctual with his payments. The money he is asking for is to by fertilizers to fertilize his coffee crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie A.'s main source of income comes from selling a variety of personal products in her community. She is 41 years old, married and has four school-age children. They are from the village of North Poblacion, Guinsiliban Camiguin. Margie has been in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 4,000 pesos a month.

In 2009, Margie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Margie is requesting a loan of 5,000 pesos which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to support the education of her children.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in business expansion

loans.name: Yondon

texts.en: Yondon B. is 35 years old and lives with his mother and younger brother in Uvurkhangai province in central Mongolia. They live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. B. operates a gold and silver crafts business in his town. He has a great deal of skill as a craftsman. He both designs and produces a variety of jewelry and accessories. B. uses his car to collect orders directly from his customers and also delivers the finished product to them. B. started his business with the help of his oldest brother in 2000 after moving to his province's capital city. Since then, he has worked hard to grow his crafts business, and in 2005 he used his savings to begin renting a stall at the local market. He is always looking for ways to increase his sales, and hopes that one day he will have enough money to build his own house. In the near future, B. wants to create new original designs and begin crafting a wider variety of jewelry products. As the busy fall wedding season is underway in Mongolia, B. needs to purchase more raw materials to produce jewelry for the many brides. He is requesting a 3,500,000 tugrug loan to purchase more gold and silver.

loans.use: To purchase more gold and silver for making jewelry.

loans.name: Esmerenciana

texts.en:
Esmerenciana or "Esme", as she is fondly called, is 50 years old. She manages a typical retail store in their village for almost a year and her weekly net income is PHP1,000.00. Her husband Teodoro helps her to earn money by driving a motorized tricycle in their town.  He earns a daily net income ranging from PHP500  to PHP600.  She wanted to apply for  a loan of PHP17,000 from the KIVA lenders that she will use to purchase more merchandise for her store and also for the repairs and maintenance of their motorcycle. 

The couple is blessed with six children, they are; Viggie Gil,27, undergraduate in College, followed by Randy,25, undergraduate in high school, Teodoro Jr., 20, high school level, Brylle Jann,high school level,19 years old, next to him is her sister Sarah Mae,18, first year college student, and their youngest is Charlene,12, grade 6 student. They lived at the village of Alinam, Cauayan City.  Most of the people earn their living through farming. She believes in the motto, "It's better to give than to receive".

loans.use: Additional commodities in her retail store and for the repair of motorcycle used in the business by her husband

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa es una mujer dinámica y optimista, vive en la ciudad de Yarinacocha región de Ucayali, tiene 57 años, madre de nueve hijos, Elsa se dedica a la venta de golosinas y bebidas refrescantes, actividad que realiza en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que se dedica a la compra y venta de madera. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Nuevo Edén” desde hace ocho años, el primer crédito que recibió fue 300 soles que invirtió en la compra de golosinas.
Con este crédito de 2000 soles comprará una vitrina y también golosinas para su negocio, además quiere comprar un terreno para instalar una piscigranja pues ese es su meta, criar peces para luego venderlos. Gracias al crédito que le pudo otorgar Movimiento Manuela Ramos es que ella está creciendo en su negocio... agregó.
texts.en:
Elsa, 57, is a dynamic and optimistic woman who lives in the city of Yarinacocha, Ucayali region. She is the mother of nine children. She sells sweets and refreshing drinks from her home. Her husband, who works selling lumber, supports her activities. She has been a member of the “Nuevo Edén” communal bank for the past 8 years. Her first, 300 sol loan, was used to buy sweets. With this 2,000 sol loan she will buy a display case and sweets for her shop. She also wants to buy a lot on which to set up a fish farm for this is her goal: to raise fish for sale. She stated that it is thanks to the credit from Manuela Ramos Movement that she is growing in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a display cabinet and sweets.

loans.name: Ela

texts.en:
Ela N. is a 54-year-old woman living in the town of Asaga.  She is married and has 8 adult children.  To make a living, Ela owns & operates a bakery.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from baking & selling a variety of confectioneries such cookies and cakes in the local community.  Ela has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 400 WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Ela joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Ela is now requesting a loan of 1000 WST which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  This will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  Ela plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Wassila

texts.en:
Wassila has owned a clothing store since 1998. She is a 59-year-old widowed woman who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with her two children. Wassila has competitive prices and is generous with her clients – she always discounts to please them. Her clients are mainly her friends, neighbors and passersby. When she first started her business, she had to face competition from bigger stores; whereas now, she has her own clientele and is always providing the best for her clients. She decided on this business because she wanted to improve her financial situation especially after her husband passed away.

Wassila requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her store. Wassila has been a microcredit client for 13 years now and has always repaid on time. Her previous loans helped improve her store by diversifying her merchandise and answering more of her clients’ needs. Wassila is very trustworthy and is doing what she does to improve her financial situation and provide the best for her children. In the future, she plans to keep on improving her business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Keuk

texts.en: Y. is 46 years old and the mother of eight children who are still living at home. Two of her sons are employed as internal staff for a hotel. Y. sells fritters to people who are her nearby neighbors for a profit. In addition, her husband fishes in and around the Tunle Sap River. Y. requested a Kiva loan to build a new house many months ago but now the construction is suspended due to the lack of money to continue. Therefore, Y. would like to request a second loan to finish the construction.

loans.use: To finish the construction of a new house

loans.name: Makhsatoy

texts.en:
Makhsatoy is a devoted mother that struggles day after day to provide the best for her family. Eight years ago she got the idea to start raising cattle to contribute to the family finances, taking advantage of the space she had available on their land for this business.
